xYHPiKgRz3YldTB34trJjw.text: During our last visit to Vegas we decided to try a different steak house. We didn't realize the view from the 50th floor would be so gorgeous. The steaks were delicious. Definitely worth trying once.

VVEccuutKKvVttwjI66wPA.text: The atmosphere was great, our waiter was very friendly and fast, the food was ok. Probably not worth the prices they charge, but you're also paying for the atmosphere. It's up on the 50th floor of the Rio and the decor was interesting fit their voodoo theme. Prices for a steak range from $46 for a flat iron steak to $88 for their top. I'd say to try it once if you don't mind spending the money.

8s2sBfpw3Il-wh97ZsxGTA.text: Voodoo steak has an amazing location. Atop the Rio is has a great view of the strip at night. Order some drinks, then apps and wait for your entrees to come out on the balcony with your glass of cab.   Lobster bisque, Foie gras app, seafood platter, 18oz steak, and sea bass were all very good. Compliments to the chef!

photos.caption: Photo of VooDoo Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The view from the top!
Photo of VooDoo Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seafood Platter
Photo of VooDoo Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Foie Gras App

_vzv6fpvEA7hQzVKlxMEjw.text: My wife and I absolutely LOVE VooDoo!  It is our favorite bar/lounge and we just tried the steakhouse for the first time.  Fabulous giant cold seafood tray!  I am surprised this place isn't packed.  The views are just amazing.  It is so refreshing to step outside and feel the breeze on the 51st floor of Rio.  No cover!  We will be back in March.

LbEwNFaDgeM2viu69m3ClQ.text: Meh. Just... meh. There's better and there's worse. The cow isn't bad, it just isn't "exciting".  Pedestrian wine list and marginal service. What else could you ask for?

zGBz-0U-UrM3VcVcJ97o1w.text: The steak tartar here was some of the best I've had in the last year. Great presentation, wonderful flavor.  My filet with garlic and horseradish mash was served exactly as I ordered it, rare. The macaroni and cheese was rich. The vegetables were cooked nicely, flavorful, and not overdone. Overall, this was an excellent meal in a sophisticated atmosphere. My dinner companions and I had a lovely evening.  The wine selection was good, though a touch pricey as compared to other places, but to be expected.  Service was genial, prompt, and detail oriented.

N-C_mDosRdn9xcdwglUfQQ.text: Many years ago the Voo Doo Lounge was one of my parents favorite restaurants and they ate here every time they came to Vegas.  Since then several new hotels and restaurants have popped up and although the RIO is a nice hotel it's definitely now one of the older ones and so is this restaurant.  I was more than excited to try this place, I was with a few co workers and since we were staying at the RIO, it made sense to have dinner here this evening.  For drinks I enjoyed the sangria which was fabulous followed by a glass of red with dinner, I've heard the witches brew drink is amazing but I was with my boss and co worker so I didn't want to get too crazy :).  The food and the service unfortunately I wasn't impressed with.  I felt very rushed and I really like to sit back and dine for hours upon end at a nice restaurant like this.  I also thought it was extremely expensive, now I don't mind paying $40 for a salmon dish as long as it's truly mouth watering and the side of veggies isn't just 2 pieces of cauliflower.  The one thing I'm picky with is the temperature of food, I like my food piping hot, I don't know what it was this week but everything I had was just warm.  I ordered the salmon dish, the plate was cold so obviously the fish went cold quickly, I even heat my plates in the oven at my own house when I'm cooking myself a hot meal.  We also ordered a few sides including the mushrooms and asparagus which came out 10 minutes after our meal, it would have been nice to have our sides with our meals.  Again these weren't very hot either and by the time they got to me and onto my cold plate they were freezing.  My salmon was okay, nothing special compared to any other piece of salmon I've had, I enjoyed the mushrooms, the wine was good and I have to say the one thing I enjoyed the most was the cracker/pita bread thing that came out with the bread when we arrived.  We didn't have dessert and because we said no to dessert the next thing you know, plates are cleared and the bill is on the table and we were out the door.  One trick I've learned is to always accept a dessert menu as it saves you time from being so rushed out.  The view is gorgeous and the rooftop upstairs is beautiful and a great spot to have your a picture taken but overall I'm just not that impressed.  I think so many other amazing places have popped up since the hype of the VooDoo opened.  I'd go back if the prices were a bit lower, portions were a bit bigger and my food was piping hot!

photos.caption: Photo of VooDoo Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

flVaVGw0P0t3We5NqtoW1w.text: The Black Angus ribeye steaks we ordered medium rare were wonderful and cooked to perfection. Great view, atmosphere and Samuel Nasto was our waiter. Was very attentive and took care of us. Thank you!

ONJmwg7fd5TLOfT5IS0s_g.text: The steak I had was stinky. Super stinky. I eat beef 3-6 times a week. Nice waiter, good service.  I won't dine here again, the meat is trash. I brought mine home to feed to my dogs. I hope they like $59 steak but don't get sick from it.

Z8p86ISBxuuFF5MGPsgRaQ.text: Come here with my boyfriend for a late dinner. We were impressed by the view. Our server was nice (I think his name was John) . However I won't be coming back. The plate they brought me for the complimentary bread was dirty. The plate they brought me for the appetizer was also dirty. I didn't really think our appetizer was that good (fried Brie) but my boyfriend said he loved it. Maybe I was just too preoccupied with the dirty plates.... I got a filet, I think it was 12 oz and my boyfriend got the dry aged bone in rib eye. Both of our steaks were undercooked. I had ordered medium and he ordered medwell. I am fine with a medium rare or even a rare steak... that's just not what I ordered tonight. But since I enjoy rare-medrare steaks just as much as medium ones I decided to eat it anyway. That steak practically melted in my mouth. It was sooooo good. I tried a bit of my boyfriends steak and was surprised at how different the flavor was. It was really good too. We also had a baked potato (kinda hard to screw that up) and the truffle Mac and cheese as our sides and they were both acceptable.   The food was good but the only thing that really wow'ed me was the steak, and for $200.... I expect everything about my experience to wow me. I especially expect all of my plates to be clean. That took my rating down a star. Not worth the money in my book

e4-t8DMxyLFp5vTfY7ySpw.text: My boyfriend took me here for a romantic date and that it was. I didn't know they had a steakhouse. It was seriously the best steak I have ever had. We also got whipped potatoes, Mac and cheese, and baby carrots all were very good. The view was amazing. The staff was great. I would definitely return.

3T7iZcePqzKXki8ZIwjfYA.text: Nice ambiance (slightly dated) and Vegas strip views. The server assistance staff was very kind and attentive. My friend and I ordered the French onion soup ($12), salmon ($38) and crab cake ($20). The French onion soup was delicious. The salmon was extremely undercooked and the crab cake was fried (not seared) and had endless filler vs "lump crab meat" as advertised. Our server seemed pretty unmoved by our poor experience. The food is sub par at a high price. Go to Mastro's instead.

6KJ5E9PXWRPHFHgPj0exGg.text: Omg.. the filet was absolutely incredible! I've never had a steak so tender and didn't even need to add salt.. so so delicious!! My bf had the lamb and that was so tender and flavorful. But what made the night even better was our incredible server Jacinto.. he had a great attitude and even better server skills. What a wonderful experience!! Definitely recommend you go here!!

SXN6NO8WyGYlwg2lCNQs5w.text: Food good. Drinks, meh.  My friend and I split a seafood platter to start, then a fresh tomato salad with burata aged balsamic, and finished with a tomahawk steak.  The seafood platter was fresh. Lobster, crab, shrimp, oyster. Delicious.   Salad: amazing. Burata cheese was outstanding. Tomatoes are decent. Wish they would have used farmer market quality, but the quality of the balsamic burata and fresh salad well made up for it.  Tomahawk steak cooked rare: delicious! Perfectly cooked!   The drinks were meh. My friend had a old fashion then a Manhattan. Both were too sweet for his taste.  Overall amazing view. Food is great. Service excellent. Drinks, there are better places to go on the strip.

photos.caption: Photo of VooDoo Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Creme brûlée
Photo of VooDoo Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tomahawk ribeye: rare. Perfect.
Photo of VooDoo Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seafood platter

sd1yl4j4DVmB47OiiTtw1g.text: We had a reservation for 630 pm. Table had a very nice view and our requests were met for a table along the window. The greeter downstairs was not over friendly but took our name and said go to 50th floor. We had questions about getting back into the lounge after the show. She had no idea the answers to how we do that. But in future you just get a stamp from the security when you come out.   Bus staff was more of an assistance than our actual waiter. We were greeted immediately by her and she poured waters and made she we all were settled.   Waiter can about 15 min after we sat and we ordered drinks and seafood platter. Which seafood platter is basically bar food appetizer with fried coconut shrimp4, crab cake 1, 4 frog legs and some shrimp. Not anything spectacular. We got our appetizer when our entrees were  coming out over 1 wait. When we asked for the appetizer first it was like we were asking for the world. We wanted to enjoy food.   Lamb loin honestly was worst lamb I have ever ate. Didn't taste like lamb it was like a sausage of some sort. Creamed spinach was good just slightly over cooked but all our food probably day under heat lamps to be honest because we waited hour for appetizer.   Other than our bus staff services was not all that great for expensive place. Just paying for the view and many of other great places

photos.caption: Photo of VooDoo Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lamb suppose to be medium. Looks like sausage and taste like a sausage. Never had lamb loin like this taste
Photo of VooDoo Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seafood platter

Ek0Twqh-BptQK44uItjCOA.text: This is one of the better off strip steak options.  The views are great from the time you step on the elevator.  The decor is in desperate need of updating, but the food makes up for that.  Our server was friendly and attentive.  He handled our large group well.  I started my meal with the VooDoo Style Wedge Salad.  It is a slightly different take on the wedge.  You get the standard wedge of iceberg covered in crispy cured lomo, bacon, and Maytag blue cheese.  The twist comes with the orange vinaigrette they top it with.  It is a solid salad.  The citrus makes it a little unique.  For my main course I ordered the 12 oz. filet mignon.  The filet was prepared exactly as ordered.  It was tender, juicy and flavorful.  They did a very good job seasoning it as well.  The black pepper gave it some bite.  We ordered a few sides for the table.  I tried the Confit Fried Fingerling Potatoes.  They were solid.  They may be a bit salty for some, but I was happy with them.  This is not a cheap meal by any means, but it is inline with most quality steakhouses in Las Vegas.  The views are worth the trip at least once even though it is off strip.  If you eat later you can head upstairs to the lounge after and get even better views.

sXdBlFMQ2md6d7VVX1zkVg.text: We had dinner reservations for 5pm for my mom's 57th birthday. Service was ok, we were hounded by the photographer standing over our table waiting to retake our pics. My aunt ordered crab cakes An wedge salad an was pleased. My mother An I order the filet. I return my first filet due to being over cooked. The second filet came out better but still a bit dry. Unfortunately my mother An I both ended up sick (on her vacation birthday night) less then 2 hours after dinner. It had to be the steaks my aunt was perfectly  fine. The remainder of my mothers birthday we both spent  in the bathroom all night. Not such a happy birthday.

1mdm1NskA64OD5WwThYzcQ.text: Came here on a Sunday night.  was pretty mellow.  service was amazing, from the manager to the servers.  everyone was down to earth and patient.  We each ordered the 20oz bone in Ribeye.  That sumbitch was phenomenal!  5 stars for that alone.  This place is a must try if you're in Vegas.

t-TWh3SBLLf5g9c0aiBNOw.text: Spent way too much money on so-so food. My salmon wasn't cooked all the way but I ate it anyway. Pretty bland too. Nothing with it other than a few sliced baby heirloom tomatoes. No sauce. My bf had the chicken. The taste was really good. He also got a side of whipped potatoes--best tasting item of the night. Pretty sad huh?! Waiter talked us into their homemade creme brulee, my favorite dessert. Again, bland. Not much vanilla flavor AND they used Cool Whip rather than real whipped cream! The ambiance is nice except for the table of ten drunk girls who were hooting and hollering all night. It was my bf's birthday and I wanted to take him somewhere nice with a nice ambiance. After all, when you spend $150 on dinner, part of what you're paying for is the experience, right? I really think the wait staff or management should have said something. Either that or put couples on one side and partying groups on another. Also when I made reservations, Open Table had asked if this was a special occasion. I said that it was a birthday dinner. No one said "happy birthday" or put a candle in our dessert or any kind of acknowledgement. Why do they ask if they aren't going to at least MENTION it!!??!!

n8DlxNUE82n8jqTPKHBZKQ.text: I have to say service was great but food not so much. My husband said his steak was good but his Brussel sprouts were undercooked and bitter. I had the Scallops and they were over cooked and over salty leaving them inedible. Leave it to say we will not be returning...

uF78A_x7Su4xPg3nyc9UBg.text: Service was terrible.  Rarely were our water glasses refilled and empty dishes remained on the table for 10+ minutes.  Not what I would expect for a $400 dinner for four people.  The food was good, but not great.  Go for the view but not for the meal.

PSjayVus7OpOL7Apgju6LQ.text: Food was good but it's hard to look past the price tag of the entrees and of course the steaks are a la carte.  We made a reservation for our anniversary because it was recommended but it wasn't at all crowded.  The place could use some updating and a lot of tables had random mismatched chairs.  The view was nice but it wasn't a "take your breath away" view, I think there is a certain side of the restaurant to sit on that has a better view.  They don't put the prices on their drink menu which I hate.  My husband and I ordered the 'witch doctor' and it was huge!  We tried to pace ourselves so we didn't get too drunk because it was still early in the night.  I much admit we were both slightly disappointed in how fine we felt when it was gone.  The drink ended up costing $40 which the waiter of course didn't tell us when we ordered but we heard him tell another couple how much it was when we were done.  The water was refilled frequently but our used bread plates sat for while on the table.  Overall, good experience but probably won't be going back anytime soon.

yfP8GqmRvCsDs2BR4bQ5ag.text: One of the best views in town... and the food is marvelous... (tip go early... like 5:30 when they open and you can get a table by the window....) I usually just show up as they open, have a martini and a couple of appetizers... what a lovely light meal in a beautiful location...

SrxXkT4iTKT0waP932zD5A.text: Such a cool spot! The views are amazing! Seafood platter amazing!!! Drinks amazing! Server beyond amazing! I ordered the coconut shrimp and mentioned that I didn't care for it. The VP of the restaurant came over apologized and thanked me for my feedback. Overall fantastic experience! Can't wait to go back

OQwHFu9Dk35w1dbWrQJXsg.text: The View is amazing, and adds a romantic ambiance to the overall dinning experience. Our servers were very attentive without hovering, we got a bottle of wine, which they kept chilled at the bar for us. We got the lump crab & artichoke dip, which was delicious, and a very ample portion, so much so I opted for a salad and soup for dinner (pathetic I know while at a steak house, but the boyfriend let me try some of his steak). The wedge salad was pretty standard, good dressing, but had 2 pieces of almost whole bacon, not crumbled. The French onion soup was fabulous, cheese was nice and crispy on top, and a good amount of onions. The boyfriend got the Ribeye, perfectly cooked to medium, and nice grill marks and a juicy center. We will be back.

li695rom3esG9qTU43VS5Q.text: I started with the lobster bisque, which had a bit of a unexpected kick, though not great as I look for more creaminess over spice in my bisque.  Apart from the tower view, the aged flavorful cajun rib-eye -- probably the fattiest peice of meat I've ever had was the main reason to dine here.  It was so fatty that I had to cut out some of the thicker marbles which made up almost a fifth of my steak, but every bite was packed with that rich, meaty flavor which I love.   The sides appetizers and desserts were just standard fare.

edMYP-Y_u-U7pZbcp95qPg.text: This is one of our favorite restaurants on the strip.  The view is a spectacular panoramic of the strip!  The steaks are always spot on.  I love the filet and my husband always gets the bone in ribeye.  The Mac n cheese is delicious.  They also have a great wine list.  The service is excellent.

YSDs-orFh_kbV6ZQQ1rLSQ.text: Sad experience, way under staffed, waiter was pleasant but hurried and cared less what you ordering. I ordered the Dry Aged 20 oz Ribeye medium Rare and it was medium well to well. They offered a replacement but given the show start time and slow service there was no time.  Ridiculous for the price and ambiance of this Restaurant I wo.uld suggest go to the lounge and enjoy the view but definitely plan dinner elsewhere as this one won't get a second chance from this Las Vegas Local.

llXhYDXjRZAq7GmQQFS4mQ.text: The view was great, and the food was delicious, but the service was pretty much the worst I've ever received.  My husband and I are young and not big drinkers, so we're no strangers to having restaurants assume we won't tip well, but the staff at Voodoo really took that to a new height.  To start off, we had a 6:00 reservation and weren't seated until almost 6:30.  Wouldn't have been a big deal, except that three or four couples who arrived after we'd already been waiting for almost twenty minutes were all seated before we were.  Not sure what's up with that when they tell you that they can't hold your reservation for more than ten minutes.  Then our server, Christian, came over to introduce himself, and from the first words out of his mouth, he was brusque almost to the point of rudeness and, frankly, just seemed pissed off to be waiting on us.  I tried to give him the benefit of the doubt, since it's the night before Thanksgiving--maybe he was bummed to be at work the night before a holiday--but I could hear him interacting with the tables around us, and he was friendly and talkative to them.  He sounded irritated every time he spoke to us, was flat-out rude when he came to bring us our check and get us a to-go box for the food we couldn't finish, and remained just as rude and impatient when we paid the check and gave him a good tip.  I loved their food, but being treated like I'm an inconvenience because someone assumes that being young and sober = being a shitty tipper kind of ruins the dining experience for me, especially when I'm eating at a fancy restaurant.  It would have been nice to be able to go out on a nice date with my husband without being treated like second-class citizens for being in our early twenties.

WqE9Fa3N0N83W5HmALUvAA.text: Came here for a late dinner. Ordered the tomahawk. It was really good. It's so huge I had to share it with a friend and we still had trouble finishing it. The service was very attentive. The view was awesome as well.

GaHUbPlJMnhuWT1ETeBlZQ.text: Food was pretty good. The power company had an outage so during dinner it was about 90-95 degrees up there which made dinner pretty miserable. The manager said "we can't control Nevada power." Creamed spinach was no good. Lobster   bisque was amazing as was the cream brulee.  The steak just ok.

mfdNEeqQjjSDRA-16HpDJA.text: I was a little worried when I read all the reviews about coming here, I'm not going to lie.  The elevator up was the only scary part as it turns out, hostesses were super nice even though we were about 15 minutes late for our reservation.  Jamal was our server he was so wonderful  and attentive without being over bearing.  We started with some cocktails and the Steak Tartare and it was fantastic, then we had the Dry Aged Rib eye with Broccoli and the asparagus.  It was cooked perfectly to the way we ordered mine was medium rare and my boyfriends was medium! We didn't have more left over for desert so we decided to have another drink and take them outside on their amazing balcony and enjoy the views it was a warm night with a great breeze.  It was a wonderful dinner that much to my surprise ended with a proposal from my now Fiance! I will be back next time we are in town and I hope that we are treated as wonderfully as this time!  Thank you to Jamal for the wonderful service hopefully we will see you next time!

bv3Lep1O6CnJogNdVQyHmA.text: The views were spectacular!  The steak was really flavorful and cooked as ordered.  The biggest problem we had was our server.  Due to a food allergy, we informed our server that we needed our sides to be gluten free.  We inquired about the green beans with shallots and almonds and the lemon aioli asparagus as they seemed like they might be harmless.  He told us he didn't think there would be a problem with those sides, but would double check just to make sure.  He never came back, so we assumed it was fine.  When our food came out, we were served plain, dry, barely warmed up asparagus and green beans.  We asked what happened and he said the almonds in the green beans were brushed with flour and the aioli sauce had flour in it so he had them prepare it without.  While we appreciated that he was looking out for the allergy issue, we asked why didn't he come back and tell us this so we could decide on different sides that were gluten free as the main reason we wanted to try those sides were because of the flavors, not just to be given plain steamed vegetables at $11 each!  His response was to just turn and walk away, never to be seen again until he literally threw the check on our table.  We then called over a manager who comped the vegetables and offered us another glass of wine, which we declined.  We just wanted to be done at that point.

Toci6vKXIM6_ZaYl_DCppw.text: Others have commented on the "oldness" of this place, and I can see that. It definitely doesn't have the swank or hip vibe of other restaurants in the same price range. And it's not necessarily where the beautiful people work or dine. BUT I had the best crab cake there, and the best Chilean Sea Bass. I thought the sweet sauce was going to ruin the CSB, but it was delicious and perfectly cooked and I couldn't stop eating it. Hubby got the menage a trois - the filet was awesome, the prawns were pedestrian and the lobster tail was okay. The view was great - we didn't make reservations so they put us in a booth away from the windows (which was fine), but the window seats had great views. All in all, it was good and I didn't walk away feeling disappointed like other pricey restaurants. Oh, the wine was good (I think it was a Pinot Grigio), but not the best.

8nwQ5z-exP_4yETIxpZQ7g.text: Amazing place to eat!!! Everything was perfect and will definitely be going back.  Voodoo is by far my favorite!!!!

6Godzr0zhT92j1LPrlWuYA.text: Just had dinner after spending a day in 100 degree heat. Asked for water to drink with our meal.  "Just tap water is fine" we said. The bill came and $80 was charged for the water we had with our meal.  For our water. They were probably trying to find a way to get more money out of our group because we weren't drinking enough of their overpriced drinks. Who knew their water was going to be overpriced too. To top that off the filet was dry and the server was unable to answer questions about the menu.  If you are going to spend top dollar for a meal you have much higher expectations than this.

HcqojDNnUKYI7LcQdgxojQ.text: Very disappointed.  Only reason I didn't give Voodoo Steakhouse zero stars is because it has a nice view.  First I ordered a Heineken in a glass.  The glass was not frosty and the Heineken was so skunky that it tasted like it was in storage for months...couldn't drink it.  Then the bread came out.  Nice butter, but bread could cut glass.  No doubt the bread was sitting out all day (2days?).  I ordered the 10oz fillet mignon with demiglaze and asked for 'extra sauce on the side', medium-rare with the truffled macc and cheese, and broccoli with garlic and oil for my two sides.  Meal came out without any sauce on the side and barely any on the meat.  I asked for my side of sauce and they brought out an amount that still wasnt enough for the whole steak.....I gave up on the sauce. Meat was dry and overcooked which is a huge negative for a steakhouse.  The macc and cheese could have been from any mediocre buffet and the broccoli was practically raw.....way too crunchy and tough.    Now it's 2 hours after eating and I don't feel 100%.....a little stomach uneasiness.  I wanted to express my thoughts to the waiter but does that really do anything other than make me look like a jerk?  So I paid my almost $90 bill with a smile....but will not be going back.

OVbQhd65lMtL4qFh9Yt9Xw.text: We went here because we had a groupon for a buy 1 get one steak free.  So glad we decided to give it a shot!  The views are really great of the Strip.  And the best part is you are encouraged to go hang out, outside while waiting for your meal.  Excellent service!  I really appreciated the fact that we weren't rushed and were given really good recommendations from our waiter who genuinely seemed to care that we had a great experience.  I highly recommend making reservations.  We could tell that those who didn't had to wait quite a while for a table.

uOhO0caQTZ7z-RPOAXIZvA.text: Great ribeye! The service was good. There when you needed service but not constantly interrupting our dinner.

plCtsAYnoLhsJMe-ubnSMw.text: Well lets start with the decor. In one word ugly, brown painted wall with a few wire voodoo figures, same old beat up chairs with stains on the fabric and wood that is all chewed up, I don't know who hired the designer , must have gone to home depot and asked for redecorating idea. There is nothing voodoo about it , the old decor was fun and different, this one is just different for the sake of not be the same but very badly done and done cheap. Then the setting, water stains on the silverware and bus boy that pour tap water into my glass with bottled water in it, I guess job training cost too much also. Then the food, well that is the tiniest and worse $48 fillet I have ever seen and the asparagus side dish was so tough and fibrous that only the first inch can be eaten, the rest would make a nice hammock cause it is tough enough to. My so call lobster thermidor was a total joke, I guess they decide what that is, no cognac in the sauce, no re bake in the shell with bread crumbs on top, and two tiny claw meat and the rest is crab!!!! This is the most pathetic Lobster Thermidor I have ever seen covered with a mystery salty sauce that have nothing to do with the dish other than to cover up the cheap ingredients. BTW in case they actually read this stuff at the RIO hotel, this is what Wikipedia's  definition of lobster is. Lobster Thermidor is a French dish consisting of a creamy mixture of cooked lobster meat, egg yolks, and cognac or brandy, stuffed into a lobster shell. It can also be served with an oven-browned cheese crust, typically Gruyere. The sauce must contain mustard.  Then after dinner got even worse, I left my cell phone there so I figure I call the restaurant to ask them to hold it for me. well the hotel computer only wanted to know if I want a room and when I got the operator, she send me to restaurant reservation , they send me back to operator and round and round it took all of 35 minutes...35 !!! then they tell me the restaurant is close and call security, security said call lost and found but they only open till 6 , on a Saturday in a casino they are open till 6!!!! I was more than disgusted with the entire system that have not the slightest notion of customer service in mind, they actually ask me to have my credit card ready when I was on hold for the operator.......this has turned into a low class , customer is just a walking credit card to them kind of a place. I will not be eating there, I will not be staying there and i most certainly will not be gambling there.

TV5svfJvUhejeO3T7304WQ.text: In December I came to Vegas and went to eat here with my friends. The service was exceptional and the food was very well cooked. Knowing this, I urged my friends to come with me here to celebrate my birthday this past weekend. As soon as we walked in, we were overlooked by the hostess and even the bartender when we sat down. Once we got seated, it took a good amount of time to actually be acknowledged. Once we finally were, the waiter was extremely short with the questions we had. It took a good amount of time for the food to be prepared which is fine because well cooked food takes time. However, our waiter did not check in on us once during this time. My friends and I did see him check in on other tables though and even make small talk with them and completely overlooked us. This being said, while the food was exceptional the service lacked the same so I will not be returning. There are many good steakhouses in Vegas with not only good food but good service. Very disappointed I wasted my time spending my birthday here.

7qsqvAOGPWJN77yUot1QjA.text: Overall very disappointing experience.    Visited on Sunday, November 11th, 2018.  We had reservations at a different restaurant in Chinatown.  However, traffic was a mess because of marathon.  So by time we got to the area of the Rio, we just decided to stay and check out Voodoo.  No issues getting right in without a reservation.   We sat down about 7pm.    At 7:15pm, the waiter finally came by.   Had to ask for the wine menu.  Then asked for the cocktail menu.  Finally got drinks and dinner ordered about 7:20.  Salad and oysters came out in 10 min.  No issues.  Not great, but no issues.  That was it for the next 35 minutes.  The waiter didn't come by once to give us an update or apologize.  At 8:05, I finally found our waiter and asked if the food was coming anytime soon.  He said "sorry, let me get the manager".  10 minutes later the manager still had not showed up, so I found another waitress and she got the manager right away.  He said the kitchen was backed up, which didn't make sense as we saw other people getting their food.  I explained our waiter had not been by, but we watched another waitress working very hard.  We were going to just pay for our salad, apps and drinks and take off, since we had a show to get to.    At that time, the food finally showed up.   About 50 minutes after our order.  The manager said he would pay for the steaks and apologized.  I was going to just dismiss our experience as a single bad waiter.  But then we tried the food.   My $58 Ribeye was dry and lacked any flavor. My wife's $48 flat iron steak was like rubber and inedible. Our side of mac-n-cheese was disgusting.  So glad we didn't have to pay for this meal and waste of 90 minutes.  You can get better steak at Texas Roadhouse.

ISEKbCxNLLotKeoUKVppqQ.text: Horrible wait and horrible service. Front staff gave attitude,not good the food took over 45 mins to be served with no apologies.almost 350 for 3 people, what a shame,  never again I'm discussed.

oKLOveCRYPjYV3xqM6tAbA.text: My husband and I had probably one of the best steaks in Las Vegas here.  We have been here a week so far celebrating my  birthday and our wedding.  So we have been to numerous high end restaurants and this for me was the best, not expensive either and to top it all they have the most amazing views over Vegas, our waiter Samuel was lovely, and made us feel special, when he knew of our celebrations, and the cake and candle was a very nice touch.   I would highly recommend this restaurant to anyone who appreciates a really good steak, lovely atmosphere, great service, fantastic views and a reasonable bill at the end of it.  Fabulous evening. Thank you Samuel.

WRvBwxb3Ge5F94sNWeYq9A.text: I really enjoyed my experience at VooDoo. The 20 day dry aged ribeye steak was phenomenal and was cooked perfectly. The view was nice. The photographer who walks around would not accept military or employee discount, but other than that it was a great dinner.

kVm2ZPwvR2U2-dCzpcz-VQ.text: The service , view, ambiance and food were all excellent!  If back to the Rio I will eat here again.  Jacinto was an excellent server.  There when you want him but he didn't stalk you!!   My filet, lobster and shrimp were all excellent!!  I give it two thumbs up. It is expensive but worth it.

VTZs4iQOmezxBoG9iYzxOg.text: My husband made reservations for use to celebrate my birthday and our wedding anniversary on Sunday Christmas Eve. Staff was aware of this special events and did nothing to make our evening special,no cake or dessert! I order the Halibut which was wonderful,5 star food. Wish with what we spent on dinner we could of been treated like we counted.

rDf2CB_9oM4GBhCN4T3z-g.text: Great service , great steak & salmon to die for whatever sauce they use for the salmon taste so good! The price is good also! Definitely would go back. Oh & the beautiful scenery at night LOVE LOVE LOVE!!!

GhjjKlvMEBoOdYbhTDpJRw.text: We had an early 6:45 reservation. Despite many trips to Vegas I had never heard of this steakhouse.  The view is amazing and what distinguishes it from others if the ability to be outside in their rooftop at the 57th floor with almost a 360 view. It was also great to be there during daylight hours, through sunset and into evening.  My GF Ordered the foie gras and said it was perfect. The plate was beautifully presented. We split an order of the Voodoo Menage a Trois which was 6 oz of fillet mignon, 2 large grilled shrimp, a lobster tail, asparagus, and mashed potatoes.  Everything was cooked perfectly and the kitchen split the plate for us, all of which was presented lovely.  Our waiter, Jacinto, was one of the best I've had in Vegas.  And at less than $100, I thought this was a good value for Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of VooDoo Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

-FfD5wyX9rI3SKJOhmekng.text: The rating for 5 stars is solely off the food alone! It's that good! The chef definitely knows what he's doing. Kudos because you have my loyalty at this point. The most delicious lamb and couscous dish hands down, appetizers and drinks to die for and dessert menu is very fun and beautiful to look at. I can tell whoever is in the kitchen really enjoys food which I appreciate because I do too.  Service is meh. Very relaxed maybe even borderline unprofessional but you can't expect great service from a union establishment. Restaurant decor is dated but I'm not that shallow. I'm there for the food. When I went there there, almost everything I wanted from the wine list they didn't have. But a lovely view to have when you do end up getting a drink. I would consider this a hidden gem in Las Vegas.

GvPPp4Zf2PXUVneJJMjxzw.text: Hubby and I loved it. Just getting to the restaurant was fun as you have to go up to the 50th floor via a glass elevator. The view is amazing. The hallways are dark, but well decorated.  For dinner we started off with the short rib bruschetta and we were very happy. Hubby went on to have the prime rib while I had the Jidori Free Range Chicken- we were not disappointed. He prime rib was a True medium and the chicken was juicy and flavorful. As for the sides, we had the lobster mac n cheese, and tempura green beens. I'm not a fan of mac n cheese, but my hubby is and he liked it. The green beans were good by themselves, we didn't care for the cream sauce that goes with it.  They are very generous with their delicious drinks, which is nice concidering the prices are a bit on the higher end. I had the Euphoria and he had the Red October- which isn't red but pinkish. They were both good though.  The view from the top is gorgeous. Depending on which side you're seated on, you either see South Vegas or North Vegas, neither is a bad view. When taking pictures, it's best to go to the patio as the windows have a lot of glare.   The staff was very friendly. The manager went to every table, introduced himself, and congratulated each with their special occasion (birthday, anniversary). It was a nice and warming experience.   We will surely be back to try something new.

ABBn7Kf9EGSSdKqwgaOO7A.text: Dined here for my 11 year old's bday and they know how to make it special for a 11 year old! Our server Samuel (from NY) was the best! He surprised the boys with their signature witch doctor drink, virgin of course!! Was super cool! Food is amazing and so is the view. We had the coconut shrimp, fried Brie, spinach and watercress salad for appetizer. For entree we had their steak and sea bass which was AMAZING. My husband loves sea bass and thought this was one of the best sea bass in Las Vegas. They have good vegetarian options too. Wine list is very good and reasonably priced. If you chose to bring your own wine, corkage fee is $35. Their chocolate bomb cake was the absolute best! The staff is amazing and very friendly. We avoid strip restaurants for special occasions but voodoo steak goes above and beyond for special occasions, special thanks to Samuel. Would highly recommend.

HyWM-yg41TxQDncjm7mIsA.text: Food was excellent as usual but the service was even better. Our server, Sam was the absolute best ever! What an amazing professional. He obviously loves what he does and it shows clearly. He should be used as the model to train all the servers. SO impressed!!

Hfbjz7ZWJmVSInK0iufgbw.text: Amazing amazing food. Jacinto is the best server we've ever had. Even if the food wasn't as top notch as it is we would still come here just for his hospitality.

8g8Jro_-9Xp8KhBL2Vr6uQ.text: Every time my girlfriend and I are in Vegas, we make it a point to go to the VooDoo Steakhouse.  Not only does it offer amazing views of the city, the food and service are superb!  We were fortunate to have Samuel and Nasto serve us.  They are great - ask for them!  Sam makes each experience special and meaningful.  We first had Sam serve us two years ago.  It is great he is still there; we appreciate his attention to detail and polite, professional - yet personal mannerisms.)    We've not had a bad meal yet - and we enjoy visiting fine dining establishments all across the country.  After each meal, we enjoy a few glasses of wine out on the rooftop patio.  On a nice evening, it doesn't get much more relaxing!  Unfortunately, our last visit was on the awful night of October 1, 2017.  As the horror rang out just blocks away, we were finishing our dessert and were headed to the rooftop patio with our drinks.  The staff were amazing by informing us of what was happening (apparently someone had a police scanner there - very helpful and highly recommended).  We eventually had to be evacuated from the roof for security concerns.  The staff could not have been more kind, courteous and concerned for our safety.  Thank you to everyone.  Our thoughts and prayers remain with that city and its people!

xD-hRUsKJ8DbuVYTsD_yUA.text: Visited VooDoo Steahhouse a couple of weekends ago for a friends bachelor party.    For a typical steakhouse charging $50+ for their steaks this place is by far on the bottom end of what you would expect.  Food by was decent but not worth the price.  Reason for the 2 stars is this place had the absolute slowest service I've ever experienced.  In the 2 hours we were there server was only able to come around twice to get drink orders.  Secondly,  it took over 30 minutes for them to cash us out.    The only redeeming quality of this place is the view of the Vegas skyline which is pretty nice.   Other than that there are plenty of other options that I would choose from before going here again.

OiTTMHnZQWVh3tgIn2kGyw.text: We ate at the VooDoo Steakhouse last night, on the last night of our honeymoon. It was an outstanding experience, with incredible food, stunning views, and impeccable service.   We were seated on the strip side of the restaurant, and could see the entire Las Vegas strip lit up and sparkling. Our waiter, Jamal, was attentive, kind, and professional, making the entire experience magical. I had the diver scallops, and my husband had the filet. The scallops were excellent, and the filet was exceptional - buttery tender with great flavor. We shared the Voodoo truffle fries, which were also amazing. We each had a martini, and then I asked for a glass of wine with dinner - it appeared the second the food was delivered, again like magic.   While not cheap, this was definitely an experience worth every penny. If we're in Vegas again, we'll be back.

6GoVUzKczigu7x2FGli4Jg.text: Located on 50th floor at the Rio so the view is amazing. Steak was great, asparagus was great but mashed potatoes were bland, mac and cheese also not impressive at all. It's so confusing why they would serve both these sides that are so bad. The owner would be so mad if he cared or tasted these mashed potatoes which seemed like bad baby food. Steak was proper but I couldn't even finish the sides even though they were tiny servings. I'll be back to try again because I have several friends that like this place so I'll update later. Enjoy

photos.caption: Photo of VooDoo Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Z6yq9bJiYBlp4NTqQVyfkQ.text: Came here to have a quick drink before heading to the voodoo zip line. The IPAs were pretty limited. Well there was only one laginitas. Blah. But we still had one. Kenny our bartender recommended us going outside for the view. Glad he gave us the tip the view was amazing.

MWhliyNGgE64jEKbgCjvFQ.text: This is probably my favorite place in vegas,great view,great food,money well spend. If you like to go out of the strip(i like to) you will love this brazilian stile casino,great service fresh food good atmosphere  The service is attentive and very polite,i ise to go in vegas 5/6 time a years and i try to visit this place everytime

qpeHILw5WbMEyemECdpu9g.text: At the Rio Hotel and Casino Las Vegas. Great night with my cousin and my girl. Good food and an Awesome view!

I6KQ6Zb7jiFUGRhwvb88Fw.text: The food was amazing. The service was a little slower than I would have expected since it wasn't that busy. All of the sides we tried: Mac and cheese, asparagus, and mushrooms (my personal favorite) were great. The Cesar salad had a great flavor and the steak (medium rare) was cooked to perfection

ItQZ2TlH5uxz1jNdf0PyVg.text: Go elsewhere. The Rio is not exactly known for their food and this is no exception, but will set you back at least $50.   Here are the issues.  The host didn't get our jokes. She was kind of a stick in the mud.   There is a holding area for the elevator. There was literally what looked like a gurney for moving people around and weird "voodoo" like decorations on the walls. We got in the elevator of horrors, which was not air conditioned. The view outside was great, but not at 140 F.   When we got into the restaurant, there was a weird lion/leopard/Africa them to the chairs, but a decidedly French/American menu. We had a nice view.  Our server forgot my order of truffle mac and cheese and there weren't really truffles in it (they faked out on me when they finally brought it). My lobster bisque had a skin on it by the time it came out, my sidecar was average.  One saving grace was the basket of bread brought out. It had the parmesan flat crisps and they were quite good.   We were also charged for water. Tap water.  If you want a view, hit this up at night for the club. It seems better suited to that than as a restaurant.

SnXfXlFDxV6kfELA3jCqqg.text: Fantastic dinner option if staying at The Rio, or the nearby Vegas Strip and willing to travel. Absolutely blown away by Voodoo Steak and their level of top-tier food and service. The view from on top was amazing, and allowed for access to the outside deck and photo ops at The Zipline. The braised veal cheek appetizer was phenomenal, and the perfect lead to what was one of the best 12 oz. filet mignon steaks I've ever had. My wife's lobster was spot on, and served with a drawn butter which could undoubtedly be described as glorious. Every dish was cooked to perfect medium/med-rare, flawlessly seasoned, and paired brilliantly with complimentary accoutrement. A side of the intoxicating truffle mac 'n cheese was the perfect (and only) way to complete what was for us a fantastic dining experience.  Our dinner plans for future Lost Wages trips have instantly been compromised, as Voodoo was one for the memories.

Jab5o6rwkqZkQYDYWi0P8A.text: Menage A Trois would have been an awesome dish.  However, I ordered the steak Medium Rare and got it Medium Well.  I was going to order side dishes, but just as I was about to, the waiter cut me off and informed me that the dish already comes with smashed potatoes and 1 carrot and 1 asparagus.  I had to get the waiter's attention as he did not give us any steak knives either.  Although we got seated immediately for our 6:30pm reservation at a wonderful table with a spectacular view overlooking Vegas, we immediately notice that the restaurant did not have any A/C on.  Our waiter did not even inform us about it.  We looked around and notice fans situated at different areas of the restaurant.  Because there was only 2 of us in our party, we were not privvy to get a fan at all.  With the hot halogen lights shining on us, it got even hotter and uncomfortable.  The table next to us also complained.  To top it off, their waiter forgot about their side dishes.  We would have stayed to order and eat dessert, but opted to leave immediately after our dinner to go downstairs and enjoy the cool air and show in the casinos.

aQINB-X4WJ1i9irsrYUD1Q.text: My wife and I ate dinner at VooDoo on Monday March 21,2016. Views of LV were great.  Service was poor due to lack of staff.  Waiter was friendly but maybe he had too many tables, My $48 pork Chop was dry and overcooked, and green beans were under cooked.  How hard is it to cook green beans... For the price, I will not return.  but maybe a bad night, so judge for yourself...if just for the views.

vORgrpvxVSpvbvCA_S_78A.text: We went to VooDoo Steak for our Fourth of July dinner with another couple.  We were seated immediately at our 6:30pm reservation at a wonderful table right next to the windows overlooking Vegas.  We were so excited that we would be able to have dinner here, then head up to the lounge to see the Fourth of July fireworks (that never happened...I can't believe none of the strip hotels had fireworks on July 4th...WTH?).  We started with the Witch Doctor Sampler which we inhaled....my favorite was the zucchini beignets.    We had the sea bass, braised veal, pork chop, and the bone-in ribeye.  We had no complaints...they were all equally delicious.  We had the dessert trio and a chocolate mousse cake for dessert.  They were fantastic too.  The only complaint we had was that we were not informed beforehand that we were limited to 2 hours for our dinner, and that we could get discounted prices on our dinner by presenting the rewards card for the Rio.  I think they should inform patrons when reservations are being made so that we're aware.  Other than that, we had a great time...fireworks or not.

XLaCwWrZj4aUUH9gbAuDWA.text: This was our first and last visit to Voodoo Steak.  Although they receive a star for service and the view; the food was horrible for this type of price tag.  Seating: Upon arrival they told us no tables were available but had booths. No problem since we didn't have a reservation. Once we entered though there were over half the table's empty.   Service This is one of the stars in my review. The service was exactly what you would expect. Very knowledgeable about the menu and made sure we had everything we needed.   Food Appetizers were good. We had wedge salad and lobster bisque. Other people in the party agreed that they were well thought out on presentation and taste. Main courses were steak, chicken and salmon. All three were over cooked with almost no flavor. The crackers on the table had more taste and didn't cost $50.00 a plate. View This was the reason for the other star. It was perfect and they have an outdoor balcony that looks over the Las Vegas skyline.  Great for pictures and a little romance!  For $300 plus meal this was a very bad experience. Any of the casino hotels have better food at their buffet and it will save you some cash for the casino's.

AO72M6cCTcGFhbzWNR5PKA.text: A friend and I went to dinner their it had to be the worst meal we have had in vegas. The ribeye was not cooked to order. and tough and stringy. I almost ask for a saw to cut it up! horrible service waited 20 minuets for our server to take our order. Was treated rude by the staff. But when we ask for the manager he was very helpful nice and took care of the problims and the bill. I think he was the only one who had a clue of how to treat customer's.  Won't go back.

N_1hxsZnjVDqUwdtkzypzg.text: Went here the day after the 4th of July. My cousin had never been to Vegas before and I thought what better way to get a view and a good dinner all at the same time. We bought a voucher at the 1/2 price tickets booth that gave us 25% OFF the entire dinner incl drinks.  Our reservation was for 7p and we were seated promptly at that time. We got the prized table by the window as well. Too bad a storm rolled through the night before, the windows needed washing.  When we called  to make a reservation we were told the attire was "smart casual". I guess that means, in America, anything goes but "wife beaters" and swimsuits. I couldn't believe the liberties other diners took in the  dress department. I'm not faulting the restaurant, that's just the way it is these days.  Anyway, we started off with the Witch Doctor Sampler, included were rock shrimp, mini beignets, coconut shrimp and a lone crab Cake. The portion was just right for two to share. The quality of the shrimp was decent, cooked just right but nothing about the sampler stood out, the dish was served surprisingly cool.  My Scallops, on the other hand, were perfectly cooked, tender and succulent! Yum factor quite high. My cousins 8oz Filet was a real treat as well, ordered med rare (as it should be ordered) came out just perfect. She almost didn't need  a knife to cut it.  We ordered the side of Ragout of mushrooms, fingerling potatoes, asparagus and bacon. Another good call!  All in all, we were quite satisfied with the service as well as the meal, and blown away by the view. (Only with this was a revolving restaurant).  We saved $45.00 by using the voucher and that also got us into the Voodoo Lounge upstairs for free. You have to wander upstairs even if its just for a few minutes to take in the rooftop view.  Next time I would love to sample the buffet, I've heard it is also very good.

7THJgceRubedGHKi931ZKA.text: I was lucky enough to go to the voodoo steak twice on this trip to Vegas.  First was mothers day.  Although there was a special menu, we picked our favorite items off both menus.  We had crab cake.  These are the best of the best.  No filler. Only 100% crab meat with light crumbs to fry them lightly.  WOW. These are the real deal.  I had the black cod.  It you can't get to Nobu, the cod at the voodoo lounge's just as good and probably even better.  The rib eye was perfection.  Perfection--perfection temp, perfect seasoning and tender as you would hope for.  Then came the presentation of  the bananas foster..  The rum and carmel sauce when lit on  fire and poured over the bananas and rum raisin ice cream was so impressive.  If you have the change To eat at the voodoo steak,  grab it. You won't be sorry.

d01gQuVkltbGVlQ4rd4m4A.text: Ate at the Voodoo twice over the first weekend in May. Considering it was the weekend of the Kentucky Derby and Mayweather fight, we thought it would be a bit busier. It was Actually half empty and the service was average at best. The food is good, naturally a bit over priced. The service is average. The ambience is GREAT and benefits from the after dinner access to the rooftop nightclub. Great way to end the evening. So despite average service and good but overpriced food, when in Vegas we come here for the dinner views and apres-meal rooftop experience.

GxWptwD4NUzOMV421jhdhA.text: This is a great place! Staff service was excellent. Lobster bisque was excellent. They even split our meals, we had ordered 2 of the filet, lobster and shrimp dinners and the portions and presentation was awesome ( served 4 of us ) we also had the oysters the best I have ever had so fresh!  We had bone in ribeye it had to be  over a pound, huge and excellent grill flavor and very tender. We also had a chicken pasta dish which we all loved. We added mushrooms for the table again very good. We started with a cocktail on the outside deck over looking the city awesome views!  We were party of 6 so tip was added at 18% automatically, well worth it we added a bit to it, the service was that good! It is a tad pricey but the food quality and the service was excellent would highly recommend for a special event !

qrOelRz3o6IJXpELN98jDA.text: Best oyster shooters!  Get the lobster bisque! Service and view were amazing! Waiter went out of his way to retrieve my Rewards Card!  Complimentary champagne since we were celebrating two birthdays!  We had a great time and a lovely meal!

XXeS9Ukrr91BcXJmvzjUFw.text: Awesome view of vegas. Ribeye steak was great. Drinks were good and waiter was good. They took our picture or our group. Hit us up for $40 but hey it is vegas. We will definitely go there again.

U4XSVuZkjcnGKe6O4vr_JA.text: This delicious restaurant is located on the 50th floor of the Rio. The view was outstanding and service impeccable. All 3 of us had the French onion soup and filet. We were all raving about both of those items. I enjoyed the broccoli, but there was nothing special about it. The truffle Mac and cheese was a favorite of the other 2 guests in my party. After dinner, we walked outside to take pictures of the beautiful scenery. Great spot!

pZJvwNkXIAjE5PFbCt80Dg.text: Came here for my Fiance's birthday. The dinner was pricey because we decided to get a bottle of wine. The food was delicious and the views were great! Get the bananas foster....you wont be disapointed!

WaPxTB63T6mZ9colKEVc-Q.text: Since we were starving having been in the road for a few hours, we called for reservations before getting to the steakhouse. Upon our arrival at the entrance was some dense attendant who acted like he didn't understand what "reservation" meant. After getting past him, everyone else who waited on us was pretty friendly. Our meal was good overall and I'm sorry I don't remember everything we ordered but if I could suggest something, it would be to pass on the frogs legs as they were a bit bland.

3LBSblUzOaQwLZqiQKfJVQ.text: Service was wonderful from the hostess who not only let us in earlier than our reservation, but recommend we sign up for free total rewards card just to get a percentage off our bill, to our kind server and bussers.    I bought a great Groupon Deal from here for my guy and my anniversary dinner - mainly because I saw they had foie gras and it's illegal in out state of California now.  Loved it!  With the jam, bread, and greens - GAH.  We strategized our dishes to try steak, pork chops, shrimp, and lobster tail, 'cause we're cool like that, and everything was cooked and flavored perfectly.  You also can't beat that 50 floor view and the option of getting into VooDoo Lounge for free if you bring your dinner receipt later on in the night.

oD43sQn4PsXVwqmoaw3b4Q.text: At the top of the Rio.  A/c was out so it was a little muggy. Service was pretty good.  I ordered the Rib eye 20oz. medium rare.  It was on the lean side but pretty good.  The only thing that was disappointing was the wine list.  The first cab we selected was a 2007 and they brought out a 2008.  If we didn't catch it they wouldn't of said anything.  We continued through the wine list and found at least 5 other bottles that had the incorrect year printed on the list.  This combined with the broken a/c was almost a dealbreaker for our group.  Pretty sad in my view.

7-BlLEzOfis7W0XBVYBFdw.text: Showed up at Voodoo Steak for my birthday dinner. Imagine my chagrin when I found out I'd made the reservation for another day. Well the hostess was cool enough to find a table for my party even on a busy night. When then had a delicious dinner with great service. Special praise for Jamal our server.  The filet mignon was delicious. We left happy and smiling. Full marks.

mIt9g4gy795o8Gg3xDO_JQ.text: After reading the reviews on here, I almost cancelled the reservation that I made for dinner. Many complaints stated that the place was overpriced. I'm not sure where their previous experiences at fine dining steakhouses were based. This is not an Outback or Texas Roadhouse. Upon opening the menu, the price point was exactly what I expected. When I made my reservation, I requested a table by the window, which was honored.  We started out with the oysters. I personally do not eat oysters, but the other three people in my party do and they were so impressed that they ordered a second dozen. I ordered a crab cake and it was wonderful. It had a crispy breading around it and inside was wonderful shredded crab meat. Delish! I will say that we brought two bottles of wine from our wine collection at home and the corkage fee was an extremely reasonable $25.  For the entree, we all ordered the Land and Sea Menage a trois.  Filet mignon, lobster tail and grilled shrimp. Amazing. We all cleaned our plates and also had a side of creamed spinach that made the "non creamed spinach eater" eat his words.  We ended our meal with the chocolate cake and carrot cake. I was skeptical of the carrot cake because it contains walnuts and pecans and I do not care for them, but they were almost undetectable and the cake was perfection.  Voodoo is such a wonderful experience with the best view in the city. It's a shame more people don't have better things to say. Until next time...

HAHIox5aVkE96xmmotvIIg.text: Been here many times. Never disappoints. Great food with excellent service! The view is amazing!

OJYDPGYdXDiU9qjxLMy2Qg.text: Had the pleasure of dining during my stay at the Rio in November and it was definitely an experience.   Dining at the top of the hotel gives you a really nice view of the strip to share with your SO or by yourself, no judgement.   I had the chicken and it was very delicious with bacon and mashed potato puree.

SIhONLY8-stBgAzXQLDONw.text: Great view and decent service and food.  A bit cheaper than the other prime steakhouses in Las Vegas.  We ate at Voodoo after the Rat Pack show, so we just ordered appetizers for our meal.  Started with the Steak Tartare -- good, but a bit too much truffle oil.  Braised short ribs were great.  Foie gras plate was well done.  Decent wine selection, a bit cheaper than Prime or Delmonicos, with some nice mid-price bottles.  Waiter wasn't particularly knowledgeable about the wine selections and didn't offer to send over a wine steward or sommelier.  We knew what we were looking for & selected for ourselves; but if we would have needed help, we would have been stranded.  Probably won't go back, but we don't go to The Rio.  So, I wouldn't take a taxi to get there.

NI2ED9vfwVUDbjAOslpqaQ.text: Let me preface this with the following; I am from Calgary Alberta. We know a bit about beef in Alberta. My butcher in Calgary hangs meat for 14 days then wet ages it for a further 14. I then buy an entire Canadian Prime strip loin and they hang it for an additional 14 days for me. This is perhaps the best beef on earth. We do not have corn fed beef, we have grass fed, barley finished beef that is amazing in quality. The fat is white and these steaks are marbled almost to a Wagyu standard.    I know how to cook a steak. I lightly season the beef and then sous vide cook it for at least 2 hours at 130 F. I then sit the beef for 20 minutes and finish it a cast iron pan that is nearly glowing with heat. These are fork tender steaks of the most astonishing flavour.   I have eaten beef all over the world and honestly think this is the best. That said, I acknowledge that U.S.D.A. Prime is also awesome beef.  The steaks at Voodoo don't come close to this quality.  While the room is nice, the view great, and the ambience very good, the kitchen and service are nowhere near where they should be for this level of expense.  And expensive its is. Four of us racked up a 600 buck tab with a fairly good wine selection. We did not order the standard issue 'American' giant slabs of meat, just nice 8 or 10 oz fillets. We had Lobster Bisque and a Caesar Salad for starters.  The Salad was pedestrian at best. The Bisque however was truly great.   Of the four steaks two were very over cooked, one was very undercooked and one was missing a topping. Zero for Four is not a great way to start a meal.  After refiring the meat and sorting out the topping the cook was fine. The meat, less so. Two of the steaks were dry at medium. The rare steak was bland and the medium rare was mushy.  I was amazed that a place billing itself as a steak house could be so incompetent and cooking steaks. The joint wasn't all that busy, the service was uninformative and lax. The kitchen is a bit clueless.  The wine list is unimpressive and overly expensive. Almost zero good Bordeaux to be had.  I will not return, nor would I ever recommend Voodoo to anyone else.

fR8OHqurYkrONVYZ-CwVSA.text: Crab & Artichoke dip - 10 New York Steak - 10 Mac & Cheese with Truffle Oil - 10 View - 10  This is an amazing place. Bring your Rewards Card and if you know someone who works at a Vegas hotel - discounts!

WxNOHGv-ircgL18fgvoOPQ.text: Such an awesome place.  Beautiful views and one of the best meals I have had Vegas! I ordered the filet and it was cooked perfectly. So juicy. The asparagus and mushrooms are also the best we have ever had. It is definitely pricey but worth it!!

KvvoX4R9ojKFRybD0fomNw.text: Her Majesty and I had tickets to see Penn and Teller so we decided that the easiest thing to do would be to find a nice restaurant in the Rio to eat at before the show.  After looking through their website, we selected the Voodoo steakhouse and made reservations.  Ambiance Mixed bag here.  The restaurant is reasonably nice and the view from the 52nd floor is outstanding.   The only real negative I have is that the restaurant's website clearly states that they have a dress code but the restaurant seems to make no effort to enforce it.  Seated next to us was a group with backwards baseball caps on and next to them were 4 guys in shorts and t-shirts.  I realize that I am old and so stuff like this probably matters more to me than to most people but my feeling is that if you are going to advertise a dress code then people will use that information to help make their decision whether or not to go there.  If you have no intention of enforcing it, then that seems like False advertising to me.  Food We started with crab cakes that were dry and burnt to the point that The Empress did not want them.  We then moved to bisque for me and a salad for her, both of which were average.  The main course was lobster thermidor for me and sea bass for Milady.  She said hers was just okay but I was really disappointed in mine.  There was no thermidor sauce that I could find and it was really bland.  Dessert was also pretty average.  Definitely not the quality of food you would associate with the kind of place they are trying to be.  Service Bad.  We perpetually could not get drink refills because our waiter would disappear for long stretches.  Even then, simple things like offering The Empress some pepper to take away some of the blandness of her salad were overlooked even though he did it for the table right next to ours.  Overall As you can see from this review, we were pretty unimpressed with the place.  One thing I will add is that I thought it was very low value.  We each had only one drink (because we could not get anyone to get us another one) and still ended up spending almost $200.  There are too many good restaurants in Vegas to waste time on this place.

P1HpiUWH92fMvSnFkMFmHw.text: What a view.  At the top of the Masquerade Tower at The Rio Hotel and Casino.  The menu is a little more than you see at a typical steak house.  Very unique drink menu.  The foi gras was extremely well prepared.  The Menage e Tois  (filet, lobster tail, Shrimp) entree was excellent.  The bone in NY Strip was perfect.  A go to restaurant

MpyL6rtg37iq2lCebZU2ew.text: My family and I ate here just last night, and we had a fantastic experience. They were very accommodating as we had my 10 month old daughter with us. The food and the service were great! The view and the atmosphere made the evening quite enjoyable. The only reason I gave it 4 stars instead of 5 was because I had been here years ago and the decor was incredible! They really played to the "voodoo" theme, shrunken heads and black lights galore. However this time around they had obviously redecorated and I was really disappointed in the new decor. Very plain, nothing special.  But besides that I would definitely recommend this place to friends.

photos.caption: Photo of VooDoo Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

HfS87KK7tKkwVW-Wc8ufeg.text: Bad location and food! I am terrified of heights. The hostess refused to allow us to sit anywhere but looking directly out the glass 50 story Windows, even though there were many tables available. She kept insisting there was no where else we could sit. Food lacked flavor. It was bad, bad, bad and exp naive. Find sinewy else to eat

ZTCSVeplAuhecQa-gX5Wmg.text: Didn't know what to expect really. Being off the strip on on the roof attached to a night club I expected over priced and average at best food. They have this signature drink that is kind of cool because it comes out all smokey. It is way over priced though. That being said, they have this $70 waygu steak that could be the best steak I have ever eaten. I have eaten a lot of steaks and it was really phenomenal. That combined with the views make it worth the visit

Bt8XA657BgXPaD6m7JN25Q.text: Thank you Karen (our wonderfully incredible hostess) for an amazing first night in Vegas!!!  Came here before seeing Penn/Teller (fantastic show...a must-see for sure!) and had one of the best experiences of our lives...    The view was spectacular!  The service was over-the-top perfection!  The food was to die for!  That's a lot of superlatives but there are times when you come to Vegas and are ready to spend money for the "Vegas treatment" and are disappointed.  That was NOT the case here at Voodoo.  Everything here was just what we hoped for on our 1st night of our trip.    She had the menage e trois and I had a seared tuna special and their lobster bisque.  Everything was cooked perfectly and tasted amazing!  ...and just to top it off, we walked to the outside deck (incredible views.....incredibly scary looking zipline) and got to meet and get pictures with the just-crowned MMA champion Misha Tate who was there with friends, sporting her freshly minted belt!  Thanks again Karen!!!

WPQ-LopBXwpBaVi2z9KIAA.text: What a View!  Take the elevator to the top!  This is a good choice for dinner before the Penn and Teller show which is also in the Rio.  View great, Service Great,  Atmosphere Great, Food Very Good.  I will come here again when we're in the area..  Nightclub upstairs opens at eight.  Flexible attire.

Rpj21SFP5gAO-7QRsw4vJg.text: Nice view, inside was decorated very nicely, has the upscale feel. Balcony connected to restaurant that also is the balcony of the voodoo lounge club I ordered the filet mignon it was the best steak I've ever had, very soft my wife had the manage a trois wich is steak shrimp and lobster very good

HBz4adggtKCv32nK0QPLxw.text: I should have known better that when I walked in on a Saturday night the place was dead, except for a table of 8 with a loud mouth at the helm making sure  the entire restaurant heard his conversations.  Let's start off and say the place is overpriced, and has sub par food. Service was OK, had to return a portion of my wife's steak as it was bland and did not taste right. The waiter was clearly trying to do his job by apologizing and offer a replacement dish, but the damage was done and killed her appetite.  The only savior of the night was a  good bottle of wine along with my wife by my side. Also the view of the strip was very nice.  Save your money as there are better places to eat steak in Vegas. Being a betting man, I would bet this place will not be around too much longer.

SjwUD4yFVm6BPe3--wkKVw.text: not cheap but delicious food - medium portions - good service. Its a special place but the view spectacular. I had the seared scallops on short ribs with gnocchi ...amazing my husband had the special steak...I had a bite it was good but not $75 good. Ive been twice and had a great meal both times!

i-hhqI-RGm7wtTtKoAmJwA.text: My husband and I had dinner on March 15th.  The view is great.  We arrived early for our reservation and were seated immediately.    The service had a lot to be desired.  I ordered a glass of zinfandel from the wine list.  The server made a point to (rudely) make we aware I was ordering RED zinfandel.  I'm 42 and was dressed appropriately for a nice dinner, so am not sure why he felt the need to let me know my $20 glass of wine was red -- not pink.   The fact that he thought that I he apparently thought I looked like I should be ordering pink zinfandel was insulting.    My husband asked if they served any mocktails and the waiter gave us a completely blank look, even after we explained what those were.  At the restaurant we went to the prior night, the waiter had an entire list of mocktails available.    When I ordered a 2nd glass of wine, I asked for the house cabernet.  The server corrected me -- saying they don't have "house" wines.  I clarified that I wanted the featured wine that is on the front page of the wine menu.  In my experience the "featured" wines by the glass are generally considered house wines.    In other server notes, our water glasses were never refilled, my empty wine glass (1st glass) was never removed, and our dinner was delivered before we were done with our appetizer.    The food was very good.  My husband had the trio and I had the scallops.  Both were great.  While the food was very good, the poor service makes this a restaurant I'd not recommend again.  There are plenty of other upscale steak restaurants in Vegas with great food and better service.

GMAF2B4arOnRhtO2zwEhzg.text: the steak was ok...not great... the view was ok. everything was ok.... so do you pay higher prices for ok? 2 stars... sorry.

1SKzUCt_hhwNS-cK-UOisg.text: Had dinner tonight and everything was fabulous! Sam our server was so friendly and attentive. I had some friends in town and had them come meet me here for dinner and they loved it too! Will definitely ask for him next time I'm here!!!

J3kxfK8RFHkFviN2O0l4BQ.text: Prior to seeing Eddie Griffin, we opted to eat here.  I was super on the fence about it because the reviews were really mixed, but we needed to be conveniently located to the show for when doors opened.   The view alone is worth dining here, as it was really nice to see the city while eating.  But the bar had a lot more people at it, which doesn't enjoy the views that the dining area does.  They also have a patio you can enjoy your drinks on.  I enjoyed a glass of Prosecco and the complimentary bread that came out.  I ordered the Sea Bass or something, I honestly don't know but everything was tasty.  Hubby's steak was good, too.    Don't like that this is in the Rio, as that to me is a dive, but it was worth it for the convenience of the show.

er-Wa00DlNo-SjZ2sYI7PA.text: Ask for Sam.  The food is delicious and the view is wonderful.  I come to Vegas as often as 12 times a year and this place always impresses me.  There is a zip line if you want a little adventure with your dinner.  The patio is a nice place to sit and have a drink.

0HROTw3AWcaKLnHFqp10Zg.text: We had great and attentive service. Samuel, John, and rest of the team made us feel incredibly valued. It may have been the best meal I have ever had, with the best service I've ever had. The drinks were fantastic and definitely pushed me out of my comfort zone. The special dessert they presented was truly one of a kind.

d5NLI6kx0r3I6SVzk3l6Vg.text: This steakhouse is delicious! The service is impeccable and the food was perfection. The jumbo shrimp cocktail is fantastic, and we also recommend the filet mignon, lobster tail, Mac n cheese, and risotto. The wine list is wonderful as well as the view. Be sure to step outside and enjoy the view on the patio after dinner! What a view. We'll be back, this is as nice as Eiffel tower or many other steakhouses on the strip. Very good!

bkwFM7ErzrBeHfIyAZSLYA.text: I'll keep it short, I'm very upset  I purchased New Year's Eve dinner and entertainment tickets at the Voodoo steak house. I planned my New Year's celebration two months prior to New Year's Eve securing my spot and paid upfront! Today 3 days before New Year's I get an email from voodoo saying they're refunding my money claiming they had the wrong amount posted on their website .....bumping up the price $80 extra per person!!! As a business if you make a mistake it's your responsibility to correct it!  They're many ways to make a customer happy but you choose for me to cancel my New Year's dinner instead..shame on you for canceling days before New Year's Eve and not give me any options or say so.. bumming up the price $160 it's just a scam to get more money and it makes you look really bad !! This was supposed to be my first time visiting your restaurant and I will never consider visiting it now! You ruined my New Year's Eve plans!

kZRSvgra6Sn8kFfF7_m1WA.text: Hmm... we chose to go to Voodoo Steakhouse because it was in the same Hotel/Casino of a show we were catching after dinner.   Made reservations a week in advance and was seated fairly quickly when our group arrived. I noticed it was pretty dark in here but I guess that's the atmosphere they're going for.   Selection was decent. I didn't do family style with others because I knew there would be at least half meat choices so I ordered a crab cake to eat alone, something light before a night at XS. Lol.   While we waited for our food, we went outside to the rooftop lounge and took pictures for quite some while. I came back to the table twice to check the food but it wasn't out yet. I guess the servers were waiting for our party to return to serve our food so that it was nice and hot.   My crab cake was okay but I wished I ordered a second dish or a side dish to eat but the side dish was too large of a portion for just 1 person (it says it serves up to 4)!   I don't remember how much my meal came out to but I agree to the 3 stars rating. Probably won't be returning because it isn't anything spectacular, just average.

og4gqah8kU1viVQEGgSyeQ.text: I was nervous to go here because the reviews were very inconsistent but I'm glad I went! Food was amazing, views were beautiful, and our server John was so great!

photos.caption: Photo of VooDoo Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

9c4_fwWTT1w7PjWIgeu99w.text: Wasn't  sure about this steakhouse based on the inconsistency of the reviews; however, the food and service was absolutely SUPERB! While extremely pricey, it exceeded my expectations. Ribeye extremely  tender, scallops melted in my mouth. Asparagus seasoned well. Other guests enjoyed lobster, filet, rack of lamb and chicken.   Great view of strip although it is an off strip hotel. Waiters tended to every need.   Dessert was top of the line as well.  Check it out

kAJMfLBwFnDrPICktOF21g.text: Ordered the surf and turf, nothing was bad but nothing was great either. Very expensive prices for mediocre quality.

d9WGOk7SF5F9h7L9-5G2Eg.text: Below average steak. Tempura green beans were awful. The only redeeming thing was the asparagus. For $105 I expected way better. Bonus: getting to watch four Vietnamese guys pour A1 sauce all over everything and group eat 3 steaks.   Never again.

bGdaZsRfowwVMdbpzUaUUw.text: It's just OK. The steak was a little rough. They charge you a $10 split free for splitting your steak. I simply said we are going to split a steak I did not ask him to split it and he did not inform me that it was a $10 charge. It's not the money it's the principle. Was not impressed at all. Will never return.

KZozHVJnzRxVXT8pQJB7cg.text: This steak house is kind of terrible, the oysters seems not really fresh. The 28days dry aged steak were over dry. Seems aged more than 2 months. They service are unprofessional, steak don't come with the steak-knife. Also no salt and pepper on the table.

DfcqUmj160Kl5v-nbKS8GQ.text: Here's the thing: bread - excellent, Caesar salad - spicy, tangy, delicious. Wine choices - very good. Salmon and accouterments? Nice. So why two stars - ordered 8 oz filet mignon - cooked right. Served cold. Asked for them to heat it up? Came back charred black. Wtf? This is a steak house and they can't get steak right? For the price ($50) for 8 oz - and the competition in this town for steal houses - I'll pass next time. Not worth it.

yTUspNn23dq-a5l8k9wR1w.text: This used to be a wonderful place to enjoy amazing food with friends and family but their spark has gone downhill. Unfortunately the food and service doesn't live up to the price. The wedge salad was very disappointing and the macaroni even worse. The New York strip wasn't nearly as flavorful as we expected but the filet was delicious.  There is a huge positive which is the view and that alone is worth dining for. Sometimes people have to pay to go to the club upstairs but if you eat at the restaurant, you can walk up there and enjoy the view. The drinks are so strong they are almost worth the $15 they cost! The experience here is great but the food is lacking...
