Oej_i-kA5Xnerc6RZl_0sw.text: Took the wife here for our anniversary dinner. The hosting staff was all aware of the note I made on the reservation and made sure to congratulate us. Our server, although I can't remember his name, was an older Portuguese man. He was fantastic and very friendly. The food was next level and appropriately priced. We spent nearly 3 hours over dinner and loved every moment. I highly recommend it and we will be back

NO5hBqwBeTXxjagBULdjng.text: What an amazing experience. Not just a meal. An EXPERIENCE.    From the moment we were seated, we were surrounded by PHENOMENAL food, OUTSTANDING service ( thanks John & Manny) and entertainment as we watched countless brave souls cross the zip line.   John knew the menu like he had designed it himself (I think I overheard him say he has worked there twenty plus years).    The lobster bisque was DREAMY.   We enjoyed our meal and then spent a few minutes in the cool night air on the roof of the 50th floor taking pictures for ourself and others.   Destined to be a favorite memory.

rF6wSZOzDZVIaTfdnPq1Zg.text: I ate here after attending a conference in the Rio Hotel. The staff and food were all fantastic. The presentation of the food was impressive and tasted just as great. Our waiter was very attentive and aimed to please.

photos.caption: Photo of VooDoo Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beet Salad

NhEnHZQ5ZBpwMIfMB7IV0Q.text: For starters, the view is amazing! Don't miss the opportunity to have a cocktail on the outdoor patio of this restaurant on the 50th floor of the Rio! Our waiter was solid and made our evening enjoyable. I had the filet, lobster, and prawn combo (the Voodoo "menage a trois") and it was as good as any other steakhouse in town. I've been to places with an amazing view where you end up sacrificing on either the service or quality because management figures they can get away with it because you'll be staring out the window. Not here! All around great experience. View, service, and tasty food is the real Voodoo "menage a trois." Loved it!

or0MOrLPQEEUqFqCNXF86w.text: Steak was over cooked, medium well instead of medium rare.  Asparagus had hard ends.  Server had a terrible attitude from the moment we first met and then tried to make up for it as the chief kept screwing up.  Quality of the in comming meat is high and is the only saving grace.  Eat their at your own risk.  Manager tried to comp part of the meal, and screwed that up as well.  You can get a much better meal for the same price at Bouchon on the strip.

r6zdPCdLf09bC_Rdiu-12w.text: Great atmosphere - we only had time for appetizer & soup but staff was very accommodating. French Onion soup was good but we all felt we had better. The lump crab & artichoke dip was outstanding. Definitely will make time for a full fining experience next time we're in Vegas.

uEc0iJ9_aABR9Bz3ngejww.text: We love Steak Houses and are willing to pay Top $$$ for a great Steak! This Place has a great View from Las Vegas and OK Service, ..... BUT.... the aged 20oz Steaks were tough and totally bland! We had better Steaks at the Black Bear Diner for much much less! The Servers think they are doing you a favor and it seems like they all think what a sucker of a customer is coming in! The side dishes had no flavor! 2 Stars for the View and the Deco...but really? 400 Dollar for a lousy Steak Dinner with a Bottle of Wine incl. Tip??? Don't waist your time and money, this Place needs Chef Robert Irvine for a Restaurant Rescue and the present Chef needs to go or chance his talents! I make better Steaks than that at home on my BBQ Grill! The reason we go to a "out of the ordinary Steak House" is to experience something great and something you can't do at home!  What a waist of Time and Money! Sad Sad Sad !

EWYbY0cmPn3txhMoDP1nSw.text: Went with my husband and daughter and overall, had a good time. The view is spectacular. The food: it was good not excellent. I have had better steaks in other places. Ordered a rib eye medium, it came medium well. This surprised me since places that sell steaks at $50+ usually cook them perfectly (you know, they are expensive). Anyway, told the waiter and he tried to insist that the steak was medium - excuse me sir, I KNOW the difference between medium and medium well. If I'm paying almost $100 for a meal, I also expect, at least, good service and attention. He hesitantly took the steak and went to the kitchen. They brought another rib eye and this time it was cooked perfectly (medium rare they said). I didn't like the mashed potatoes, lacked flavor and seemed too starchy. The salad, meh....not good. One good thing, the cheesecake, it was delicious. The price, this place is expensive, really expensive. More expensive than Morton's and other good steakhouses in Vegas. Will we return? Nah, don't think so. The view is spectacular and you can enjoy it from their lounge which doesn't require you to attend the restaurant.

FB0YfXrdCaR2pT2gKb6bXQ.text: I went to  VooDoo Steak with 3 others. It was a Wednesday evening (around 7) and the place was relatively empty. But, we were told that to sit at a window, we would have to each spend a minimum of $100. [This really isn't hard to do with their inflated prices--we actually spent a bit over $400 for the four of us.] What disturbed me was that everyone dining there could have been seated at a window table but instead they insisted on this antiquated and insulting practice. The food was adequate, nothing more. You have to read the menu with the server's flashlight which was also annoying. All in all, one star is more than adequate.

NkKTtLsmCouPGk6AEn09Sg.text: We had a late dinner here on December 30, 2012. We had just drove into Vegas to spend NYE here. We were tired and didn't want to to go anywhere else after a 7 hour drive, so since we were staying at the Rio, we tried the steakhouse. All I got to say is that it was amazing. We enjoyed the food and drinks. Everything was awesome. The best part of all, you get to go up the stairs inside the steakhouse and into the night club on the roof for free.

CCNrHkR_nRqx-NHcovP_3A.text: amazing steakhouse at the top of the rio where there is a nightclub with a gorgeous view of the strip.   Get the bone in Rib Eye (my favorite cut of steak and best thing there) and a side of mac and cheese.   steaks are about $60 but worth it

i5A60kHK0_jrh4eUzgWogA.text: AMAZING! The view was beautiful, the service stellar and the food was delectable! I had the lobster thermador. It was absolutely cooked to perfection. It was scrumptious! I would definitely go there again if visiting the Rio hotel! YUM!

d08MjCnzF10kdI_Yc3y9aQ.text: This was the most pricey restaurant I've been to so far and I'm sure that's due to the location (beautiful view overlooking Vegas) and the quality of food. I went with a group of 6 other people in celebration of a friend's birthday, and we each shared a taste of what we ordered. Everything was delicious and cooked well. My favorite was the lobster bisque because the flavor was perfect. Now that I've explained what I enjoyed, it's time for the bad news. The service was the absolute WORST I have yet to experience at any restaurant. It was a Tuesday night and it wasn't busy at all so one would think it wouldn't take too long just to get our order in, but it literally took 20 minutes just to order our drinks. Then another 30 minutes to get those drinks and order our food. Then it took about another 50 minutes to get our food. On top of the ridiculous wait times, I would put money on our waiter being stoned. Whenever he came around the table it was just to talk to us about the same thing each time, which was his friend who is from the same place as us. When we finished our food, and made it obvious we were ready for the checks, it still took another 20 minutes to go through the process. My friend used her card and the waiter said it wasn't working and didn't suggest any alternatives or anything. My friend had to go to the nearest ATM and withdraw cash which charged a 12 dollar fee so she could pay in cash. The card was obviously working and it was just a big inconvenience the waiter put her through. We had made plans for later in the night and those plans were cancelled due to the horribly long service. Overall, I would not eat there ever again. With the prices being what they were, I was expecting a lot more than what we received.

Jh_z9thIFRie8tJS2FS2sQ.text: Short Version:  Atmosphere is great along the view of the strip from the 50th floor.  Our waiter, John, was extremely nice and attentive. Food was excellent.  Star entree of the evening was the dry aged rib eye steak cooked medium.  Nice redness to it, buttery texture, and VERY flavorful.  I also liked the Chilean sea bass, with its soft texture as well.  Filet Mignon was good, but just not great.  Lobster tails were cooked nicely.  I would recommend the lobster bisque as well.  Extended version: Rio's automated reservation system was frustrating.  After trying multiples times to get through, we figured no one would man the phone until 5 when they open.  We called back and asked for a Saturday 6:30 pm reservation for 6 plus a baby (kids definitely allowed, so that's a plus) but were told only 6 pm was available, so we took it.  The dumb thing was that at no time was the restaurant more than half full, even by the time we left.  And two of the big tables next to us remained empty the entire time.  You get to see the view from the elevator ride up.  There's only three available stops: ground floor casino, 50th floor restaurant/zip line, and 51st Voodoo Lounge.  You can go on to the balcony while waiting for your food to look at people riding the zipline (purchase your tickets before coming up) and the beautiful view of the strip.  You still have a good view from your seats though.   The wine by the glass selection for a steakhouse wasn't good at all.  I counted three cabs total available, one of which was Kendall Jackson.  That's the one thing I don't like about Vegas restaurants.  It's not about what wine goes good with your menu, it's more about who's giving you the best deal.  I would've loved to order a bottle of Honig cab for $86, but there was only one other casual wine drinker.  I ended up with a glass of Stags' Leap Petite Sirah for $17, which paired well with steak.  I wish there were some better cabs available by the glass. For starters, we had the cocktail shrimp (it was good, not easy to mess up simple shrimp), artichoke dip (also good), and coconut sugar cane shrimp (I forget the name of the sauce it came with, but it was excellent).  There were no entrees really for a kid, so we ordered a bunch of sides to split: French fries (minus the Cajun), Mac & Cheese (hold the truffle, oh well), asparagus (good), and potato puree (hard to mess up mashed potatoes).    The dessert menu was a little disappointing.  We saw online before we got there that they served a dessert fondue and chocolate lava cake.  But they recently pared their dessert menu down to five things and ice cream.  We ended up getting cheesecake (definitely below average) and bananas foster (presentation was better than it tasted).   One drink ($4-20), one starter ($15), one side ($8), one entree ($40-$76, ribeye is $46), one dessert ($10) will set the average person back about $100 before tax and tip. I'm taking off one star (and a half?) for the wine list and desserts.   Here's a tip:  Sign up for a player's card in the casino.  Rio (part of Harrah's) offers $1 or $2 off most menu items in all/almost all of their restaurants for members.

miq1IwA0CxsLoOHEfOLz5g.text: A near perfect meal. Our waiter was a bit of a jerk. The food and the chefs were great.

5uHZwIc2FfjKtzJrXAKxzQ.text: This place is a must if you want to impress and get some action from your guest while in Vegas.  They serve prime steak so enough said the food is great no matter what you order.  Sides, desert all good, just what you expect in a prime steakhouse. Here is the real treat.... The roof top lounge on the 51 floor of the Rio, the steakhouse gives you access.  The Las Vegas Blvd views are breathtaking especially at night with all the lights, there is a great DJ and bar up the with dancing, what a great finish to a great meal. Definitely a comeback place.

teBppwx8cCPLrfs_B99I1Q.text: I always eat here when I visit.  The food is great, and the view spectacular, but the service is outstanding. At our most recent visit, it took about ten minutes to be waited on....not a big deal to us.  However, the manager immediately came over and apologized and told us our meal was on him.  Wow...do they care or what?  Will I continue to eat here?  Absolutely!  Will I recommend this place to everyone?  Of course.  All high end food establishments should care this much!

hRr7klNC-IbnmiGfEdbqLg.text: Dinner for three at the Voodoo steak in the Rio Hotel. . Waiter was amazing. We all had a fillets, salad and sides. Salad was good, as were the baked potatoes and Mac and cheese. The disappointing part of our meal were the steaks. They arrived on a big white plate with a couple Brussel  sprouts.  My small filet looked lost. No bother, I was hungry. The steak ordered med. rare was overcooked and absolutely tasteless. It was not charred, or juicy.  Just a bland, no color, no taste steak. I was really disappointed, and when we got  the check for just over $300, I decided they needed A review on yelp. We usually eat at the All American downstairs in the Rio, and will go there from now on. They have great steaks!  The Voodoo has the view of Las Vegas, and the atmosphere we all want, but I give them only one star for the steak. The waiter on the other hand, was five star excellent. Try the steak house downstairs.

qvEkI-QmRUW71nsqyzC5AQ.text: The views are amazing first off. The food was very good. The crab and artichoke dip was delicious. I got the 20 oz steak and it was cooked to perfection. Our waiter was very friendly. The atmosphere here is cool and you get free admission to the rooftop lounge which has amazing views. Check this place out if you are in Vegas.

pkT9wdtX50e25jd_jgdpjg.text: Wow... Awesome experience! Me and my wife had the best steaks of our lives here T the voodoo lounge! Great service and the food was far beyond our expectations. And the prices were not that bad being as nice of a place as it was! Highly recommend for anyone wanting a special night to remember while having the best steaks I've had in Vegas period!

yB7gdKWFINEG6ckbGzEuTg.text: One of the 3 best steakhouses in the city.  But the view beats them all!  We've eaten here about 5 times now, and only had one problem...eating everything.  Good portion sizes, and the smells from other tables made me wonder what I'd missed!  Our waiter was excellent, and they are very personable, with great stories to tell about the city.  He made use laugh out loud three times!  It is a bit of a wait for the tremendous food, though.  But last time we got the Tomahawk which probably took 30 minutes to prepare.  The drinks were also excellent!  Although it's a bit pricy, it's inline with other restaurants that don't have a view of this magnitude.    Well done, Rio!

_QQ3VhfpFJtZrk9KV29lYw.text: Lobster was amazing, but had to send the steak back as apparently they have no idea what 'medium' is.  Also, HUGE problem with splitting the tab.  Jamal (the server) wouldn't help split it up - he wanted us to pay for jamal together.  ;-)

EtsTKbv5x65X4ivuE3QS8g.text: First, you need to know that the view from inside the restaurant is unbelievable, but there's also a balcony overlooking the strip- it is STUNNING. The service was great and the menu was appealing. I had the roasted chicken breast, which was very good, but hard to justify $40. The truffle macaroni and cheese could be a meal in itself, so at least split it! The best part of the meal had to be the French Onion Soup and the Creme Brulee! Skip an entree, order a side and desert and enjoy the view!

V1Glem5YhWC2AzKS-2rq0A.text: Nice view and atmosphere!! steak is OK. scallops are a little bit too salty.  asparagus are perfectly cooked! sorbet with dry ice has very impressive presentation.

GDkzuppF2Ozr8l1HnAOzQQ.text: Over priced food, nothing special. All the sides suck.   I ordered the NY strip steak which was huge and delightful. My boyfriend ordered the $70 Waygu ribeye and it was horrid! All of the sides we ordered were extremely plain. I could cook it with more flavor with my eyes closed. Its supposed to be the best restaurant in the Rio but honestly there was nothing that stuck out except the high prices.

PDMxGQl5IoMLVkFkN3WUXA.text: The food was very good a bit pricey but not unreasonable. The service could use some work. Our waiter wasn't very attentive and he took a long time to retrieve things we asked him for, also never refilled our drinks.

photos.caption: Photo of VooDoo Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 32oz 32 Oz. Tomahawk Ribeye*
Photo of VooDoo Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

kA-ukUJjItWABUO8snH9Ig.text: Ok, more like 3.8 stars. I ordered seafood at a steakhouse so that was probably my mistake. :-( My boyfriend and our other friend both ordered steaks and were in loooove. They tasted pretty good! I just wasn't in the mood for a slab of meat.  I ordered a lobster pasta, and it was just.. bland and a little disappointing for the price that I was paying. It wasn't bad, it just didn't taste amazing either. Some of the lobster pieces were overcooked and rubbery feeling. The pasta itself had little to no flavor... Again, my mistake for ordering seafood at a steakhouse.  The view though --- gorgeous panoramic views of the strip. They have a patio area that you can go out to and just enjoy the view, take some pictures, and hang out with your drinks. That was probably the best part about dining here.   Our server was also great and very friendly. He was quick to get us the things we needed and to correct any mistakes. He brought out the wrong side dish for my friend, and quickly remedied the problem (and let us keep the extra dish at no charge). The filet mignon that my friends ordered were yummy from what I could tell, and they were super satisfied with their meal.

photos.caption: Photo of VooDoo Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gorgeous view!
Photo of VooDoo Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pasta didn&#39;t have much flavor, lobster was a little overcooked.

8zJq74CW--4q_nJRMYnNvw.text: The view was great, the service was good, but my halibut was way too over done. There were 3 people in our party that ordered the halibut and each of us thought it was over cooked. It surprised me that they think this is the way fish should be cooked. The other 3 people ordered steaks and they were all happy with them, I've never had to specify how to have my fish cooked but after this I might need to start specifying not to over cook. You would think that with a $700 meal for 6 people, it would be properly cooked. Anyways, everything else was wonderful.

Qa31AYXcUC-4ZIvUtf8sBA.text: My goodness this place is amazing! Awesome cocktail bar to wait when table isn't ready! The view is AMAZING and their food is great! Our waiter was very attentive and the staff was friendly. The atmosphere in that restaurant is fabulous! We had 3 different kinds of steak and I had the top sirloin and my husband had the rib eye! All was cooked to perfection! We had the side of Mac and cheese and that was very good as well! Check this place out because overall, the food and the view from atop is spectacular! Will definitely be back again!

photos.caption: Photo of VooDoo Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of VooDoo Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of VooDoo Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Top sirloin!

uxapKf3LyonUiEentu2gmA.text: Food and view are incredible. Service was good, our waiter was attentive and knew the menu. Only reason I'm giving it 4 stars is the bartender and other wait staff were talking and laughing loudly while watching a video on their phone in the middle of the restaurant, very unprofessional.

mvvueJipnhRcHtYhOiV6xg.text: Went here for drinks last night and it was just okay.  The view is fantastic but the old fashioned had a lot to be desired.  Too sweet and not enough bourbon...btw they don't even have rye.  This is supposed to be an upscale place but it misses the mark.  I have heard the food is good so maybe you will have better luck.  The staff was very friendly....better cocktails needed though please!

Xw5FWq-l_fBWGPI3JDPyBQ.text: This was an amazing experience. The view from the 50th floor was spectacular! The Tomahawk Ribeye was hands down one of the best steaks I've ever had. I did not give 5 stars because our server, although polite, paid much more attention to his other tables than to us. Also the food took unusually long compared to others around us. The food was worth the wait.

photos.caption: Photo of VooDoo Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tomahawk Ribeye, Cajun Shoestring Fries &amp; Garlic oil broccoli. YUM!

Ho2-GouasGmSZThtcSTK3w.text: The elevator ride up to the restaurant was scary and questionable at best. The service was good inspite of  the restaurant being very hot and uncomfortable. The air conditioning seems to be out of service or not working efficiently.

9B6ZRGuGElMuaBgSbQ3Xlg.text: So the main thing that this restaurant has going for them is the panoramic views of the city. The view is absolutely exquisite. Sadly that is where the selling point of this restaurant begins and ends.  I will make this short and sweet.  I understand we technically got there when the restaurant was closing but they still decided to seat us even though they initially turned us away but since we were a large party I guess they saw dollar signs.   Our server seemed annoyed by our presence and barely checked on us during the meal. For the prices of the meal I expect to receive 5 star service and it was more like 1 star. I've had better service at Chilli's. All the food i ordered was just ok nothing out of this world and definitely does not match the prices that go with it.  Please be aware that if you dine here you are basically paying for the view above anything else. The upside there is a rooftop lounge above the restaurant, which seemed to be playing pretty good music.

photos.caption: Photo of VooDoo Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster bisque was ok. Ive had better.

bOJZTT2VrGz5wkVLotMN7w.text: We made our reservation and they asked if it was a special occasion. It was our 20th anniversary. The prefix menu was good and we enjoyed "The Spell" dessert though the presentation would work better with a short story to ramp it up. The price point of the restaurant is high so it was surprising that, separate from the view, the place has zero ambience to entertain Voodoo in its title. They need a total make over. "Antique" might be there decor design but it looks flat and uninspired. It's Las Vegas right?! Also ordered the signature drink that comes in a smoked box. That was a fun idea but the drink was undrinkable. From look to taste it was bad. Again, push Voodoo! Color and taste should be off the chart. Following dinner, we went up to the nightclub. It was early so the place was quiet but what a dive. The staff up there was off putting in attitude so we passed up the opportunity to buy a bottle of tequila for $400 and pour it ourselves. This place could be amazing and the food was good but all the other pieces here are missing. Can't really recommend it. They need an overhaul on several levels.

LhzgtcGQhGrsnJXZb_Uziw.text: The Rio looks and feels like an old hotel, but I was pleasantly surprised by the voodoo steakhouse, Great view and ambiance from something like the 50th floor. The food and service were also excellent.  I had an excellent frog legs appetizer followed by a wonderful Chilean sea bass.

photos.caption: Photo of VooDoo Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chilean sea bass - very good
Photo of VooDoo Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. One of the 4 farm raised frog leg sets in an order - very good

pfrmgQsCMVR9QYu48V4HFw.text: This is an outstanding place to have dinner. The food is great. Although the steak is fabulous the scallops are incredible. And the view from the balcony is incredible.

KOKi3RBZD7Uy08WQrN6Q4Q.text: Great food and great service for starters, I'LL Definitely go back ~ taken care of in every since of the word, hung out and watched the game , a very laid back atmosphere and was treated like a Queen

elQDzTE3u7AvTz4scYLpFw.text: Awful.... Not classy at all. First off, you are not greeted in a professional manner. No, instead they automatically assume you are going to the club on the 51st, level even after checking on your reservation.   You then have to take an elevator. Where another hostesses asked if you have a reservation. I'm confused did the hostess downstairs not just call?  Then we were told to wait, so we did....... plenty of open tables, plenty!  We were then ushered to our table underneath a fluorescent flood light. Where the rest of the restaurant is dim like the nature of a steakhouse. I did asked to be moved to a not so spotlighted table. We were given menus and told our server would be with us shortly. Now, at this point and time it has already been 30mins since we arrived.  Our table attendant came over and asked if we would be drinking wine, I replied I do not know yet. Which at that time he then sighed, and removed all the stem wear from the table. So no I guess the answer is..no we will not have wine. And poured us water, then hastily left.  During this whole time our new table was by 7 boys, yes boys not men. 7 boys in shorts t-shirts and baseball caps. All loud, and eating with no home training  Our server finally made his way to our table. We both placed orders to start with the steakhouse French onion soup, and we would order after looking at the menu some more. He came back not 2 mins later. "So what else will you be eating". I replied, that we were still deciding.   During our soup wait our server was so I'm patient and impolite that he kept bombarding into the back of my chair like a bull.   Finally 1 hour after our reservation started we finally get soup. Burnt over salted, tasted like from a can. French onion soup. I refused to eat mine and sent it back. My husband starved at this time ate his.   I wanted nothing more than to go!!!!  Asked our server for our check, my soup was still on it....  We have enjoyed many steakhouses from coast to coast.   I really hope this is not their standard.

4ZNT1wree5_lsNqM-QQPCA.text: If you haven't been you need to go. What a great place for date night. The view is out of this world!  The olive tapenade they bring with the bread is to die for!  Lobster bisque that is truly the essence of Lobster squeezed into a bowl!  Melt in your mouth Filet Mignon. Sweet Lobster tail and Prawns!  Sides big enough to share. And a wait staff par excellence!  What more could you want on date night?

photos.caption: Photo of VooDoo Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Voodoo Ménage à Trois - petite Filet Mignon, Prawns and Lobster tail
Photo of VooDoo Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yummy Asparagus
Photo of VooDoo Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Baked potato with the works

Whckxnm2CGsTcO7vgqguOA.text: Dinner was great, drinks were great. Received Togo food in aluminum foil.... just tacky and not at all FINE DINING

photos.caption: Photo of VooDoo Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Never ate at a high priced restaurant and received food wrapped in aluminum foil as a &#34;togo box&#34;. Not impressed, very tacky.

AWLnDyQLS1z7JlGNzacA9g.text: With Groupon in hand, we at last made it to VooDoo Steak with another couple,  Bread was good, but butter had to be requested twice.  Classic French Onion Soup was exactly that, with a thick cover of melted cheese and well-caramelized onions.  Initially our server mistakenly brought Coconut Shrimp to our table instead of the Shrimp Cocktail we ordered.  But when the switch was made, the Shrimp Cocktail was excellent, with large shrimps resting on a bed of lettuce.  A Caesar Salad was peppery but good.  Appetizer, soup, and salad all came together, but we had enough time to eat all the preliminaries before our entrees arrived.  My entree of an 8 oz. Fillet Mignon with Red Wine Sauce was medium rare as ordered, and very tender.  Additional requested Bearnaise Sauce was not listed on the menu, but was cheerfully supplied, and very good.  The large Baked Potato accompanying the steak was properly prepared but did not contain enough chives to my liking, so the manager brought me more.  Sauteed Wild Mushrooms further enhanced our enjoyment of the meals set before us.  It was somewhat noisy near the top of the Rio's Masquerade Tower, from conversations at adjoining tables.  But our excellent view of the Strip far below easily compensated for this.  And, a delicious slice of creamy, old-fashioned New York-style Voodoo Cheesecake served with fresh berries topped off a fine meal.  A bountiful assemblage of fresh blackberries, blueberries, raspberries, and strawberries was strategically placed on top of and wedged around the generous portion of Cheesecake.  4-1/2 stars on this lovely night!

photos.caption: Photo of VooDoo Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Berry-Covered Cheesecake
Photo of VooDoo Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 8 oz. Filet Mignon
Photo of VooDoo Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seafood Menage Trio

DkiMk_BwUTBxJlaY2gWTmw.text: Party, party, party!!! We were here to party for a friend's bday. Saw the reviews but hey, it was the best thing at Rio. Had over 20 of us so we really didn't want to complicate things migrating elsewhere for dinner. After all, after party was here at the hotel.   Okkk. The food. Expected decent... Whatever food. That's what we got. Not going to elaborate too much bc there's really not much to tell.  Everything is OOOOKKKKK!  Ooooookkkkkk with a price tag that should be beeeeeetttttteeeeerrrr.  Steaks and seafood were all on the dry side.   Check out my photos.  Food looks much better than it taste. Presentation was fab but I rather get something that looks like shizzz but tastes great. Just sayin...  Right outside the rooftop, they got that skyline zip thing. Handful in the group went. Think it was $30 a head. Two in a seat and you get zipped back and forth. The whole actual zip time was about a minute.  An experience.   Final thought... If you are stuck here, this is probably the best restarant in the hotel.  Came out to about $120/per.  Personally, I rather go elsewhere paying the same for better food. Dahhhh!

vhTvnOiOZMhVW6aDMxZrew.text: There is no denying the views are amazing. This and the wonderful service are what makes this place great. The bread was rather blah. We started with the steak tar tar which was quite delicious along with the crab cake which sat in a tartar sauce and was also delicious with a great crunch on the outside. I got the filet medium rare and it came out perfect. He got the dry aged ribeye, but he was rather disappointed by the lack of flavor and surprised how tough the steak was. Keep in mind it was cooked medium rare so should have been much more tender. We got the mashed potatoes which were average. We also got the asparagus which was undercooked and topped with sauteed onions throwing off the flavor profile. We did enjoy the outside deck with breathtaking views and free entry to the upstairs lounge.

8Rrc-D6_BBZ6GSsacSXEdw.text: Took almost an hour just to order food, then took another 45 minutes to get our order. Our steak was ordered well done and we received a medium rare steak. We were in a party of 8 and asked the server to split the bill. The server huffed about it and said "that will take me a really long time so you will need to wait".

photos.caption: Photo of VooDoo Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

0GuLJNOR3FKJeVICnOwsww.text: The atmosphere is awesome here! Such beautiful views every seat in the place! Service was decent, nothing to really rave about but not bad enough to complain. Food was good.

364hXkk42ylEqWiTeK3V6w.text: It had been a couple of years since my last visit and I was glad to find that the food and service are still excellent at VooDoo. I mostly chose this particular steakhouse because of the rooftop bar with a nice view of The Strip. It's nice when friends and family are visiting to find a place with a nice meal and also a nice view.  We all started with a drink to enjoy with our meals. I ordered a red wine that was very good and my brother loved the IPA he ordered. My husband's Sauvignon Blanc was not good. The bread basket had salted rolls and pretzel bread. The bread was okay, but not great. The tapenade served with the bread was very good.  My meal was the Voodoo Menage A Trois. This included a six ounce filet, lobster tail, two giant prawns, and mashed potatoes. Everything on the plate was great with the filet being the stand out. Next time I'd probably just get a filet. My brother ordered the filet and really enjoyed it as well. Our side of Whipped Potatoes was creamy and delicious. My husband ventured out with the Duroc Pork Rib Eye and really enjoyed it. This meal looked more like a platter with a large serving of pork, mashed potatoes, and some roasted peaches. We were all very happy with our meals.   Our waiter was friendly and attentive. He was on top of drink refills and making sure we had everything we needed. The waiter also encouraged us to check out the rooftop bar area with the view after we placed our orders. It was a nice spot to take some photos and take the view of The Strip in.   After making my reservation I remembered hearing that the Rio has a locals discount for some of their restaurants. I checked out the website and found that VooDoo is 25% off with a local ID, Total Rewards card, and the printed coupon from their website. What a deal! This was the icing on the cake to a lovely meal.

photos.caption: Photo of VooDoo Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bread Basket
Photo of VooDoo Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tapenade, oil, and butter for the bread basket.
Photo of VooDoo Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Duroc Pork Rib Eye

p8j5mu852L-0z5gsffYi-A.text: We got there and the place seems very nice and elegant, food was excellent but a bit price, worth it though the steak was good and well done. The serving portions were about right. Food took a bit longer than expected but the company was good so we didn't care. The only thing I didn't liked it was our server, he was a bit rude as he brought the menu and we said no alcohol drinks then later on we changed our minds and seem to be a bit upset about it as the restaurant was full and seems that he was quiet busy.. not excuse anyway. Overall food was good prices high, wait okay.. but the view thought completely change the whole game it was beautiful and worth it I'll be coming back for more in the future hopefully we will be treat better this time without a rude service!

VtExN7esBPhT8MyQMp_yQQ.text: Amazing food, amazing views and amazing service. I was alone on a work trip, although there is no bar seating, I was sat in a very nice booth with an amazing views of the city and the voodoo zipline.  The servers all came by and talked with me, it didn't feel awkward sitting alone in such a nice area.   I had the menage -- surf n turf - steak, lobster and prawns.  I ordered the steak medium, it came out perfect.  The lobster was succulent and the large prawns were fresh and great with the dish.  Mash potatoes and veggies were also cooked to perfection.  The bread the serve at the table is wonderful and the olive tapenade and oils are one of the best iv had.  I am so happy I went up to the 50th floor for dinner.  I was then able to take my drink outside onto their huge outdoor patio.  Food isn't served out there but there are lounge seats and tables to mingle- or head up the stars to voodoo nightclub.

YZzarI9zMjdd-uegGkI-gQ.text: We ordered the short rib bruschetta for appetizer. After the first bite- it was amazing how all the flavors came out. It was delicious! For our main course we tried the surf and turf( 6oz steak, tiger prawns and lobster tail) and 21 day aged rib eye! The food and ambiance was perfect. The lighting was a tad dim. The view from where we sat was romantic. A must try and I'll def be back when I'm in Vegas!

3E_d2YVX4csrvGHiC0Eh0A.text: We went to dinner for my brother in laws bday. The view is amazingly beautiful! The drinks very delicious! I had one of the specialty drinks that came in a lantern with smoke coming out and lit up different colors!!!! I can't remember the name of it The dinner was delicious.  MY husband and  my steak were made to perfection! Big portions enough to share. I met Kai'noa in the restroom while she was helping a young lady who was having a panic attack not knowing she was having dinner so high up we both helped calm her down. Kai'noa offered to help us take a beautiful picture of our group outside she was a perfect hostess she was just so helpful and friendly. And went above and beyond. I will definitely be coming back to voodoo for the food and GREAT service in June  for my birthday.

BaIyw8oJKHs_ZSeogLYibA.text: Came here for dinner with the hubs before going on the VooDoo zip line. Beautiful views of the city while dining! We ordered the New York strip steak with whipped potatoes and the lamb chops entree. Both were delicious. I was a big fan of the crispy potato cake you get with the lamb chops but my husbands whipped potatoes made up for it. They were delicious and definitely could serve two people. It took a little bit to get our food and our server gave us complimentary glasses of champagne for being patient. - nice touch! Service was great and everyone was attentive. I would definitely go back on our next trip here!

bfGs21IKioxlxzZYxh77Dw.text: Nice location, great service. The steak I ordered (24 days old ribeye recommended by waiter) was less than stellar though - not all "crust" was removed before cooking. Wild mushrooms side was okay but not great, to my taste.   We have ordered a table in the morning for 6pm, and ended up being seated next to the door to the balcony - it was quite drafty due to constant traffic.

cTLjykBiRruoEThJ91eNKQ.text: Had an excellent evening & dinner last night!!  You definitely need to eat here!! Now to bring hubby with me next time!

AIp2l-z4JWDz7MsAaq8ofQ.text: Worst Vegas dinning experience, no ac and the bartender really needs  refresh on how to make drinks, one star for the great server we had. Food was ok but had better on the strip. If it wasn't for a time restraint would of left. Let the hostess know in the beginning but no follow up until leaving the venue. Noticed a store bought fan on he way out.

photos.caption: Photo of VooDoo Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

95ojzX_hhwI9TY6tFMAooQ.text: Came here on an off weeknight for early dinner with mom and dad for their anniversary (48 years!) with high hopes.   We were one of 2 tables in our half of the dinning room and were still seated adjacent to an older couple who didn't need to hear our chatter anymore than we needed to hear them... I don't want to make the servers run marathons, but a little space (1 table!) when you're dead please?  Our server was a very nice man and very capable professional, I am sorry I do not recall his name.  Our drinks: Mom and dad have this sick affinity for a monstrous concoction: a Midori Melon vodka martini. It has a signature green hue and icky taste but they love it. they also KNOW that most bartenders drop sour apple or sour mix of some kind into this so when they are away from home, they always say JUST MIDORI MELON AND VODKA when ordering... We could see the drinks were wrong from across the room as they had a different lighter green hue and god knows what poured into them although the bartender SWORE he did it right. We're not stupid. The color was off, the taste was off. Thankfully our wonderful server took them back and got them fresh martinis with no green ooze and we moved on.  For the food, the short rib bruschetta sounded awesome and it wasn't. I was hoping for the meat to have the "fall off the bone" quality but it was more of the "overcooked Korean BBQ boneless shortrib" variety. I ate what meat I could rescue from under the pile of our of place citrus salad and ricotta and left that and the bread behind.   The lobster bisque was pleasant and contained actual lobster bits in it.  The heirloom baby beets were fantastic and I highly recommend this dish. I'd pay more for a dinner sized version an my entree. Great flavors all around. There was a disproportionate amount of goat cheese to the rest of the salad ingredients that could have been better mitigated by having more salad but that's not a complaint... well done with this dish and the high point of our meal.  the flat iron steak was ordered med rare and came out unevenly cooked, in part because of the tapered shape... the edges were easily medium to medium well and the inner portion had some red in it. This resulted in about half the $44.00 steak being overcooked. This is regrettably pretty decent since the $47.00 petite filet was completely overcooked and DRY. It was ordered medium rare and had NO PINK much less any red in it and was the TOUGHEST, DRIEST FILET I have ever seen in my life. I didn't even know that cut of steak could be ruined but here we are.  I asked mom and dad to send the meat back but that's not how they roll and I wasn't about to make a scene or embarrass them on their special day.  Voodoo... you're supposed to be a steakhouse. Please start cooking like one for the future guests.  A small saving grace to the meal was our server overhearing it was their anniversary brought out a complimentary dessert for them to share which again pointed to his professionalism and helped us end on an upswing.  Our bill was well over $200.00 for the 3 of us and we tipped over 20% so it was a nice chunk of change for a very disappointing meal overall. I'm a tourist but mom and dad are local and none of us will be coming back.

Sb5zjpfAa0tPTnxVnr5IHA.text: This was our best meal by far during our trip to Vegas! If you're looking for the perfect steak, this is the place to go.  We will definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of VooDoo Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of VooDoo Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of VooDoo Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

N8jxMT-SF5fzx5TbO-Pasw.text: Had a great time on July 4th. Service was spectacular, and the food was amazing. Surprised at how much we enjoyed the food.

7dqKemoFbbVTjy8IhChgYw.text: We Had the dry cured TBone with a bottle of machete (red Californian).   Excellent meal.  Polite efficient and funny staff.  Great ambience as the sun sets and the city lights up.

c4dU6LtMk-3vJfa_F-jTEw.text: Love this place.  Staff is great.  My wife and I started with the Bayou seafood sampler.  It was huge and could be a meal in self.  I enjoyed there Lobster Bisque and their Angus Ribeye.  Both very good.  My wife choose the French onion soup and the Scallops.  She share a taste of her scallops and we both agreed it was the Best scallops we ever had.  I know it is a steak and it was good.  My next trip to Vegas I will come back for the Scallops.

ekCsW2zY-XXNe7HbLJC3XA.text: My husband took me here for my birthday while we were in town on vacation. The food here is delicious and the server was very outgoing and friendly. I ordered the sea bass, which was delicate and very flavorful. My husband ordered the filet mignon, and it was cooked perfectly. We also ordered the asparagus, the baked mac and cheese, the beet salad, and the blue lump crab cake. All were magnificent. For dessert we got the chocolate cake; it literally melted in our mouths.  Usually, chocolate cakes are too sweet, rich and dense but this one was light and a perfect end to our meal. The best thing was the view of the strip as the restaurant is on the 50th floor of the Rio. There is an observation deck for breathtaking photos.

photos.caption: Photo of VooDoo Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious sea bass, filet mignon, asparagus and baked mac &amp; cheese

rgVE2MSdqckCe0jGbCnHdw.text: Food - 4.5 stars (everyone enjoyed) View - 5 stars (cant beat this rooftop view)  Decor - 3.5 stars (a bit dated but still fun)  Service - 3.5 stars (a bit on the slow side, had to wait a while, ask for refills, missing sides, confused servers) Checkout - 1 star (charged several people the wrong amounts, took a long time, we were late for our show at the Rio which was the only reason we were eating there at the Rio, this was a really bad experience)   Brought a large group here for dinner for my bachelorette party. Everyone enjoyed the food and drinks. We had sea bass, filet, risotto, mac and cheese, asparagus, beet salad, wedge salad. Tiramisu dessert was to die for. Warmed bread at beginning was yummy. Presentation of drinks was cool. Some came out in special box cases with dry ice smoke "release" as you get drunk.   So many "rules" took away from our group's overall experience. Must spend $30 min a person, can't split you meal or you will be charged $10 per person, if you use your players card to get a discount, it must be on all one check, but then the checkout process was a nightmare.   We spent about $100 a person on average here. It's not cheap. So the service should be on point.   We had a smoother, much better check out experience for another large group meal at the yard house (another casino) the night before, no issues whatsoever! Fast good food, fast service and sharp waiters, constant drink refills, fast checkout, all separate checks. And the food there was a fraction of the cost of our Saturday meal.

7GfDa3wfnt3CTSyeNQtjOA.text: Our dinner was amazing and Sam and Efran were very attentive to our group. You won't be disappointed. The only negative I would say is the time it took to serve us and drinks need a lot of work especially for the price. We did get some free drinks and an apology since the regular bartender was on vacation and they had someone filling in. I would return since the Menage a trois meal was to die for! View is breathtaking also.

Photo of VooDoo Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

1vPHq_VuTESFfI-9l4v5rQ.text: On top of the incredible view of Las Vegas from just about every seat in the restaurant, the food was spectacular. The lobster bisque is a MUST. After dinner we did the zip line. What a great place. If we're ever back in Vegas, Voodoo is the top of our list for dinner

photos.caption: Photo of VooDoo Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. View from the patio
Photo of VooDoo Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Prime flat iron and diver scallops
Photo of VooDoo Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster Bisque

rbaIdS-59opghFQSZIp4ew.text: Husband and I came here for dinner prior to seeing Penn and Teller.  This wasn't our first pick in places to go but due to logistical issues we thought it would be best to eat at the Rio before the show.    We made a Wed night res (that morning) via open table.  The res was early, due to the show time, maybe 630 ish.  We did get a window seat with a wonderful view without requesting it.  We arrived on time and were seated promptly.  We started with sangrias and French onion soup.  The soup was ok, little too much meat flavor (maybe lamb?) for my liking.  For dinner I had the lamb dish over pasta.  It was ok, but very fatty meat.  Husband had the filet.  He requested it med rare with horseradish crusting.  It was cooked more to med well.  The horseradish was really not a crust as much as it was a thick horseradish sauce on the top.  We shared the fingerling potatoes - they were fantastic.  Took a bit of time to get the check but the staff seemed very busy, so I give them a pass offer that.  Other than that, service was good and servers were pleasant.    The best part was that we got a surprise 25% off the check when we showed out show tickets.  Overall, great view, ok food, good service, and the price isn't so bad if you get the 25% discount.  I would not recommend for dinner, but you should go to the bar, have a cocktail, and take in the view.

09SoC-KbaOdKpr1PmcQNRg.text: Christian is on point. Food is amazing. When I am impressing people, I bring them here.

kwrfcp95iMdEGm5rWkYrKA.text: Amazing views of the strip from 50 floors on top of the Rio.  The Rio is off the beaten path and showing it's age but this restaurant and bar held up well.  Stopped here for dinner before seeing Penn and Teller one night this week. Was not as expensive as some of the strip hotels and the food was better than I expected.  Service was top notch.  You can walk out onto the roof bar and see all around the tower - great views!  They also have a zip line between the towers, fun to watch but be warned they shoot you over and then have to pull you back, two rides for the price of one!  Anyway, food was good, prices were good and services was stunning - worth taking a trip off the strip to visit the Rio while you're in town.

uxg5DwoIB2aMDkq3M7JRQg.text: I eat here all the time. My favorite steakhouse in Vegas hands down. Great service and the bartender is fantastic. Now here is my complaint. The security from the club and the hostess downstairs are really starting to change my opinion of the Hotel as a whole. They tried telling me I couldn't go to the restaurant for a drink and I had to pay to go to the club instead. I spend quite a bit in this casino and don't like this sort of treatment. In my opinion the club upstairs is really downgrading the overall experience I've come to expect.

ueGcFs2UZBLid6Xt5gOJDA.text: i was here long time ago, and i still have good memories. we went to the roof top club after we had dinner... but... the dinner was excellent... i had the special that night, which was half a lobster and 8oz filet... this was the best for the taste, and also for the pocket. thats my two favorite combo. however, one of own friend did not get his plate almost 15 minutes later, he ordered same thing i did... other then that, the view of the strip is awesome as we were dinning  on our dinner and the service was excellent. i would come back here again

73fyfQSH_DYhg3Yu4bDbjQ.text: Service was great... "Candle light" dinner was a small votive on the table. Ordered the menage a trios -filet, shrimp and lobster. Food was cold... Favor mediocre...very disappointed considering how much we paid. Husband faired a little better, ordered the special. At least his food was warm. Wouldn't go back or recommend.

mT4xq7NTOYf06ky3JlUuTw.text: Last night I ate at the Voodoo steakhouse. The staff was exceptional. The food was amazing. The prices were average for that type of meal.  The view was beautiful. You could see out the windows over the whole city it was dark and you can see all the lights I really enjoyed it.

qi9AUVSIPv0wIaSL6a3A_w.text: My first vacation to Las Vegas and I was taken to the Voodoo Steakhouse AMAZING! The service was great and the Voodoo Doctor Sampler and the Maine Lobster and Crab Pasta was to die for and the view is breath taking!!!

qHEtgXdQLxgcjlr-r-vkmA.text: I came here on a Saturday night for birthday dinner and the food was excellent. I had the steak tar-tare as an appetizer, an 8oz. steak with truffle mac and cheese, and then a piece of the chocolate mouse cake for dessert (complimentary for my birthday). My table shared the witch doctor drink which was fun for us because of the fog coming out of the goblet. Everything tasted really good and fresh, but the service was kind of slow. 4 stars for the great food and friendly server (even though he was a bit slow).   PS: If you choose to eat here while the night club is going on, I believe it is free to enter after dinner. I didn't really like the music that they played (top 40 from 2009-2013) when I checked out the club, but there were a lot of people there.

T99Mru44M8zoLoJra82M4Q.text: More like 4.8 stars. The ambience was great with an amazing view. The Australian Waygu ribeye was cooked to perfection and melting in the mouth. Worth the $$. Sides were ok, but too big and a bit overpriced. The food took long time to come out.

AfBJypeHZ_RbWebVA2U-xw.text: Beautiful view from the 50th floor of The Rio. We went around 7pm and the servers were nice enough to seat us by the window. I had their amazing Giant Crab Cake... no fillers, it was all crab meat... every bite was amazing. Their pan seared scallops on top of braised short ribs just melts in your mouth! My husband's steak was "the best" he's ever had! Portions were good. A fine place to check out!

photos.caption: Photo of VooDoo Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crab cakes were amazing! No fillers... its all crab meat inside! :)
Photo of VooDoo Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pan seared scallops are to die for!

qzzBZB0PUhYlzb8nQuc_OQ.text: This has a 25p off locals discount available that is factored into my review. If paying full priceI wouldnt have been quite as happy. I have eaten here 5 times in the last year. I have never had a bad meal, the atmosphere is fine, service is spotty and can be slow. I cant complain about any of the sides or steaks thatbI have ordered, Wine isnt a bargain, as others pointed out.

3sltgW36kZovt4lcCwz76g.text: On on 1/1/2016 - we checked in at our hotel and decided that we were starving. Met up with a good friend of mine from high school with her hubby. We didn't want have to leave our hotel & drive or have to deal of getting a cab or Uber so we decided stay put and picked this place. We ordered Ceasar Salad, Shrimp Cocktail as appetizer. The Shrimp Cocktail was yummy - the sauce was perfect. Both of my girl friends ordered their scallops with grits and mushroom. I ordered the crab and lobster pasta salad with cream sauce. Jay ordered their Filet, another friend ordered Rib Eye and Salmon. Jay's filet was overcooked - he asked for medium rare and it came medium. It was more cooked than he and I liked. The scallops were delicious - melt in your mouth! Loved the flavor. Our friends liked their salmon and Rib Eye. Mine was disappointingly ok - the crab was cooked a little too long so it was a little rubbery. There wasn't much cream in the sauce and just needed more flavor. We were starving so no one bothered to complain. We also ordered sides - asparagus, truffle Mac & Cheese and French Fries. The asparagus was too al-dente for my taste, loved the Truffle Mac & Cheese and of course, you can't possible go wrong with Pomme Frits!!! Their selection of bread was good as well. And love the view! I just wished for the price we paid for dinner, it was perfect. Can't have it all I guess.

photos.caption: Photo of VooDoo Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dinner with Friends

PirTCFF-XDwAARSitxIUrQ.text: I can't speak to those other reviews where they were down on this place. Maybe it was just a chef having a bad day. But my experience was off the charts excellent! I had the 30 oz steak with the garlic crust and it was AWESOME. My buddy had the 20 oz ribeye, also excellent. He had the french onion soup and it was special as well.  Now, maybe it was because both of us are diamond players but the service, atmosphere and food were impeccable.

78YwyixJ0srCSaufyMez3A.text: made the reservation for our last night at Las Vegas, got there early, dressed and waited an hour at the Casino only to find that the elevator has technical difficulty and the restaurant won't be able to serve us. of all these time I am waiting, not a single phone call from them notifying us, and what they can offer in return is 10% off at their American bar and grill? forget it, I am not coming back, my time is much more worthy than that. I spent half an hour going to planet Hollywood for their buffet and another hour waiting in line, over dressed and was starving by the time seated, fortunately the spice market buffet didn't disappoint me and made my last night at Las Vegas a total nightmare.

jqYMcZs4PX_8tU-F3LPVUQ.text: BF decided to go here for his bday dinner. I originally had reservations for 10pm but because we had a tickets to see KA we called and moved dinner to 8 which was no problem.   The atmosphere had a cool vibe that led up to the name but none of the decor wowed me. It was a panoramic view of the strip (well ours was part of the strip). We were seated right by a window which was great, but the beauty of  seeing the strip was ruined by a huge glare.   We both ordered the Filet Mignon. I ordered mine medium and it came out more medium well, which i didn't mind too much. I could eat steak everyday if I could, but theirs wasn't as tender as filet mignon should be. Their filet mignon was decent. I also ordered their truffle mac and cheese and I must say that was rather delicious! I would come back for the Mac & Cheese alone.   As for service goes... it was probably the worst I've received from an upscale restaurant. I agree with another reviewer about the service being terrible from a certain waiter. I know my BF & I are young but come on, don't make it obvious that you don't want to serve us cuz you think we won't tip well! We actually tipped more than we should have! We were rarely checked up on,it took forever to take our order, & we actually had to get up and find him to get our check. He didn't sound happy to be there or anything, we felt as if we were a bother wtf.  Would we ever go back? Possibly. If I had a different waiter, I would. I would def go get a Total Rewards card tho, saves you quite a bit of money.

dVY-0RGksezgT4p8BIdHfw.text: Not bad. Have had better. It's pretty pricy. You mostly go for the view?? I think Gallaghers is a much better steak house but thought we would try something different.

photos.caption: Photo of VooDoo Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tomahawk steak

xaJ__e_MuLapwTCRizrFtg.text: For the prices you would think the quality of food would be at least decent. Had a large party and ordered many things. EVERYTHING on the menu was bland. The popular dishes like the lobster bisque, was just plain salty. The mac&cheese looks great, but taste like hard noodles in a queso. The shrimp had no seasoning at all. Great view,, but there are other restaurants in the area with a great view and much better food!

pJjjjCCieFE78pchrtnPXg.text: Well lets start with the fan favorite, the view! Incredible view. We where there for the right time, 630ish with the sun setting and the casinos turning on all there lights. So I read some reviews, and one caught me, it talked about dress code. And I agreed with the reader. If youre suppose to dress up, dress up. I dont want to see people coming up in shorts and tees, But thats just me.. First impression of the place. It was fun, the art was diffferent. Got the hostess, and she directed my girlfriend and I to my parents, where they where at the bar. Decent size bar, the bar tender was nice. We then went to our table, and was greeted by our waiter. Our waiter was okay, but wasnt the best. For the amount of money you spend there, he should on his game. But lucky for us, he was a nice guy.   The food came out in a timely fashion. The steaks where cooked to what we asked for. Everyone enjoyed there food, was quite delicious. We where to full to have dessert. But they looked amazing. Instead we had coffee and tea..Also before I forget. Get yourself the Total Rewards card, It definitely helps saving some money. So if you want to save alittle money go check it out..    Afterwards we decided to head up to the voodoo club. And that was a whole different story on its own.

P9SL38yyQVJ7kGVwGda--A.text: The restaurant this is a great restaurant. There is great steak here. The service is excellent. A beautiful view of the zip line. This is at the Rio Hotel. I really enjoy eating here.

fdr9kcL5zSDBXtoOc8K_uA.text: Amazing food and service!  The waiters are beyond belief, excellent Pinot noir wine, super awesome heirloom tomato salad combined with a menage trois filet, lobster tail abs jumbo shrimp!

photos.caption: Photo of VooDoo Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Awesome Pinot noir
Photo of VooDoo Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ménage trois
Photo of VooDoo Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Heirloom tomato salad

FDLppxn-TeFKUlP3V1QCCA.text: A friend recommended VooDoo Steakhouse and I decided to check it out while I was in Vegas for a conference. It's located at the Rio and has great view of the Strip. Food is great and definitely worth the price. Will visit again next time I am in Vegas.

a461Z-7qbHnpyOCT3katzQ.text: We ordered the lobster bisque soup, pan seared scallops and mac and cheese. The food was mediocre, nothing amazing, definitely not worth the $40 - and up prices per dish. I've had better. The view was nice, the service was ok. Nothing fantastic, matches the rundown hotel experience. At least no bugs in my food. Can't say the same for our hotel room.

WlNlAVAhcyG6sMA3FCWZVA.text: We decided to give this place a try before seeing Penn and Teller. The view was awesome and our dinner was delicious!! The service was steady and we never felt rushed.  The bread basket was full of a tasty assortment, and refills came easy. We all ordered various steaks which were cooked and seasoned to perfection! The seafood pasta was also rich and delicious. We loved all the sides we tried: the truffle Mac and Cheese (the best!!), creamed spinach, mushrooms, sauteed broccoli, and potato puree. To top off this amazing meal, when we mentioned to our waiter we were seeing Penn and Teller we got 20% off our bill! Awesome all around!

SU_aFnjlbP_QtiJnmfFrKg.text: Awesome view and you can see all the zip liners going off the side of the building.  The drinks are fancy and have dry ice to make them smoke.  We were there for a business dinner and the atmosphere is perfect and not too noisy.

7YMOmQF61i3hZ7rU2TkAhg.text: Thieves!  The dinner was good, the service wasn't bad until I got my charges back from the credit card company. Someone, waiter? manager? changed the tip amount on my bill doubling it, hence the reason that I caught it. Watch your charges here! Certainly leaves a bad taste in your mouth.

qZF8Nx0SLlAR1rImVeOKcA.text: 3 1/2 stars, but I'm feeling friendly because it was a nice experience. The 3 1/2 total rating is incredibly accurate.   Had a really nice dinner here. The service was solid, view was beautiful, and while the food wasn't memorable, it was really good.   PROS: As most say, the view of the LV Valley. They have a nice deck where you can go out and lounge and take in the view.   The service was nice and efficient.  Everything tasted good, but nothing rocked my socks so much I would have to come back for it. My husband really enjoyed his ribeye, and he's hard to please. So you get a whole star added to your rating for that.  Truffle Mac and cheese was also tasty.  There is a 20% discount if you show your Penn & Teller tickets.. Which you'll need because...  CONS: it's much too pricey for the quality! This is fine dining prices but Outback Steakhouse quality dishes. Yes, it's plated nicely and yes the restaurant is pretty, but you're not going to get a unique flavor explosion here. It's good, just nothing to write home about.   The Witch Doctor is a giant and cool looking drink but it's $31! Buyer beware. The price is not on the menu... That should have been our first clue.   My $13 salad I could have thrown together at home. It was mediocre tomatoes, bitter lettuce, crumbled soggy burrata, and a light drizzle of balsamic. Ehh. If you're a fine steakhouse, please use high quality produce, cheese, and balsamic.   The bread had potential but was rock hard.   Overall, a nice meal, a nice view, and other than my empty wallet, nothing substantial to complain about not look forward to for next time.

lTuUvxiGTPuirXT43PyqJQ.text: Jose from Nevada was very warm with us. He was very polite and very good in service. Keep up the good work Jose! Thank you for the awesome service!

2EEautQfHg95z_Nq_21H-g.text: This place was great on all of the above, service, food, and atmosphere. The view is phenomenal. They have a patio that you can walk out on and have a drink, take pictures, check out the view etc.   The waiter we had was lovely! Very attentive and friendly! I had the French onion soup, filet, and we split two sides Mac n cheese and the broccoli. Everything was wonderful! French onion soup was my favorite I loved the peppercorn taste it had. Broccoli was just that, broccoli but nothing to complain about. My steak was cooked perfect and we couldn't stop eating the Mac n cheese!   I will go back next time I'm in Vegas!

appQD7m7a3OND8WSr0juzQ.text: Went to VooDoo Steak for my birthday because we were staying at the Rio, got a small discount because we were part of the Total Rewards program at the hotel.  When I made the reservation on Open Table, I told them that it was my birthday and that we wanted a table on the window, which we got, but not the best view of the strip.  We both had a chance to get up and walk around the restaurant and saw at least three open tables on the window with an amazing view of the Strip, kind of disappointed about not getting one of those tables.  Other than that, the food was great, the Lobster Bisque was AMAZING, we both got the Voodoo Menage a Trios (fillet, lobster tail & shrimp) which was also delicious. They brought me cake with a candle for my birthday, service was good as well.    After, we went up to the Voodoo Rooftop Lounge, was nice that we didn't have to pay a cover because we had just had dinner.  Views were awesome, music was good and the crowd was right around our age which was nice since we are not 20 or 30 somethings!

aMizehQ6816qhBw-mS8saQ.text: I have been too VooDoo a few times and the experience has been nothing but positive. For a Steakhouse in Las Vegas, it is not badly priced. The wait staff has been nothing but friendly. My steak, which I like medium rare, has been cooked to perfection every time. The nightclub above adds a great atmosphere the restaurant along with the amazing view of The Strip. As a local, I have recommend this place to many friends visiting.

photos.caption: Photo of VooDoo Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The view is amazing

TbHFJ8thdmY9Ln2peOX4tA.text: I gave this place 1 star for the great view. If not for that it would have received a zero. I ordered the coconut shrimp for appetizer and that was good, 4 prawns fried well in a mango sauce. I ordered a 20 oz Ribeye on the bone. Of the 20 ounces, there was 5 ounces of meat and that meat wasn't even that good. The rest of it was fat and bone. Seriously guys? what kind of steak is that to serve to a customer? When I pointed it out to the server he was like yeah thats a lot of fat. Not sure what kind of customer service that was. Good thing I had a coupon for 25% off. They were lucky I was not hungry due to the previous evening's amazing food at Andre's, which charged the same price for their steak yet it was a 1000 times better.  Guys do not serve inferior steak, you just lost a customer for life and I will tell everyone to avoid Voodoo Steak.

7OymAthymiYt1peAOi4_eg.text: This is a fancy steakhouse and you should expect high prices.  The presentation is fantastic they managed to make salads into art.  The flavors are great and Louisiana inspired.  This place has some of the best ambiance in Las Vegas.  I love the very dim lighting and the amazing views from atop the Rio.

yG6wQP-rtzD1CDhrbDYwOg.text: Had the lobster seafood pasta. It was great. Others in my party had the filet and the baked chicken. They were good, but nothing special. The truffle Mac and cheese was a little over loaded with truffle, but tasty. We also ordered the asparagus. It was very good. We never ordered drinks because we were not offered a drink list. Overall the food was very good, but the service didn't warrant the $45-$60 price that we paid for entrees. I don't think that I would go back due to the underwhelming service. However I might get the pasta to-go. It was yummy.

u6BSNKLO7ckEb90c2u3mUw.text: We arrived with a 5:45 reservation but could not sit by the window due to staffing. The view is the point of this place. Our booth had the most annoying light overhead that killed the ambience. Food was so overpriced. Ordered a Caesar salad that was mediocre at best. Steak just ok. When they  bussed the table they stacked every plate on top of each other, on the table in front of us. Gross! Then left all the crumbs and never came back. Two people, $175 with one beer and one glass of wine. Shared a steak. Fine dining price with Appleby's service!! Will NEVER go back. I do not recommend this place-save your money.

annInIlRyKiRiz7pCTUlkQ.text: No stars.. We just walked out. Terrible service. Different menu than online by like 10-15$.. Just not very good.  Have to give discount ticket to EVERYONE before even ordering.. Suspious...  Probably never do back

QzoZQHqzO3NIOcsBnCZfyg.text: Complete scam!! Got discount food tix from tix4tonight! I have done this before with good 25% off whole check. This time we were required to show our coupon to hostess and server before being seated or served. Confident we were given an over priced menu!!!!!! Able to compare online menu; as service so slow full 8$ more on our menu!!!!!  Beware!! Complain!!

gUeoImtnHXEPy3QVacSJLQ.text: What a great restaurant, there's a great view of the full Las Vegas strip and the service was awesome too! I got the Maine lobster with crab meat on top, it was amazing! And the truffle Mac and cheese is one of the top give Mac and cheeses I've ever had. I will definitely have to return next time I'm in Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of VooDoo Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sea bass
Photo of VooDoo Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster tail with crab meat
Photo of VooDoo Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster bisque

yDhTl6QAtc_dw7yKER8WVQ.text: Oh so my first time here and I was starving upon arrival so I ordered the platter for app and raw filet mignon with quail egg... The platter consisted of fried frog legs, a big crab cake in center, friend shrimp and scallops (I think) it was soo much but I was hungry so as a entree I ordered stuffed lobster which I did not eat all but it was good, I was really stuffed, I can't do all the fried food, it irritates my stomach so the platter wasn't a good choice but if was not nasty, quite good.. I went Luton the rooftop where the view was beautiful and they had a zip line there which I didn't get on due to dear if heights but my tummy was satisfied but def over priced in a way

Tzhlz4MeHhgjAZkM-lDXXA.text: We had reservations for 7:00pm last night.  I can't say enough how fantastic of a night we had.  From the wonderful elevator ride to the top.  To the hostess that greeted us when we walked in.  To the beautiful table we had (we were on the West side so we looked out to the mountains)(if you want to see the strip views - ask for the East side or a view of the strip) Regardless ALL views at the top of the Rio are fantastic! Well JOHN our waiter was WONDERFUL.  He was tentative, funny, informative about all items on the menu and I am so glad that we had JOHN as our drinks, bread, salad and our main course was served superbly!  After we received our drinks (and before our salad) JOHN suggested we go out on the balcony of the Voodoo Lounge and check out the view.  WOW it was amazing!  we sat out there with our drinks for about 20 minutes.  Taking photos and just enjoying the spectacular sights!  JOHN let us kow that if you eat dinner you have access to the Voodoo Lounge all night.  We told him we had Penn & Teller tickets - so he told us to come back after the show and enjoy the night in the Voodoo Lounge.  How cool is that?  Free entry to a club in Las Vegas.  WOW! As soon as we walked back to our table - JOHN served our salad.  JOHN was on the ball!  Boy, I sure hope Voodoo Steak realizes what a gem JOHN is to have as an employee.  We finished up our meal.  All unbelievably cooked to perfection.  I had the salmon and my husband had the rib eye.  Baked potatoes for our sides. Well we knew we had to leave soon as the show was soon upon us.  We didn;t want to go.  We just wanted to stay up there all night.  So back down that fabulous elevator and onto the show. What a great night!  Penn & Teller we great and a huge THANK YOU to the RIO Hotel for entertaining us! Cheers!

Ou8CUc9ArAiyQxdKdHMhxA.text: We made reservations for 8:30. As you check in,  You're led to a glass elevator that shows you a spectacular view of the city as it leads you to the restaurant! We notice that not only is it a restaurant but right above the restaurant is a rooftop nightclub. We peeked and knew we would entertain the idea of an after dinner cocktail! VooDoo Steakhouse is very fancy!  Our waiter Samuel was absolutely extra! He presented himself very knowledgeable but most of all he was very professional. Absolutely 5 Star customer service.  Our appetizer was the  Short Rib bruschetta  Our meal was Scallops  The Menage a Trois (Surf and Turf) steak  lobster and shrimp! Omg Delicious!  We checked in with Yelp and were given a free Dessert !! I had never tried Creme Brulee's so what the heck, it was a Yelp gift and it was delicious! Scrumptious Deliciousness! When we left we were Thanked for Dining with a friendly handshake and invited upstairs to the Voo Doo Rooftop which had an Amazing View of Las Vegas!  Absolutely stunning view! Definitely recommend Dinner here!

photos.caption: Photo of VooDoo Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of VooDoo Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of VooDoo Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

R_z61fwGxrFWf1L6nMUoPg.text: What a wonderful dining experience. First off, our server, John was excellent. Very personable and funny. I would definitely ask to seat at his table again. We are locals and received a nice discount along with our players card  We started off with cocktails which were very tasty. Apps included the meat and cheese board along with steak tartare. Our sides were mushrooms, whipped potatoes, Mac and cheese, and the risotto. The risotto was a bit under cooked and stiff but all in all they were very good. The four of us split two meals. Yes, they charge a "split" fee but what good restaurant doesn't?  We had the tomahawk steak the the "land and sea". Filet and scallops. I love steak, and the steaks were fantastic but those scallops were to die for. We will definitely be back to try other menu items. Thank you John for a wonderful dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of VooDoo Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Meat and cheese app.
Photo of VooDoo Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak tartare.
Photo of VooDoo Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Filet and delicious scallops.

PQRCvBQokz7wlLJxzhSwGw.text: After going back and forth between a few different restaurants, we finally made a decision to dine at VooDoo Steakhouse located on the 50th floor of the Rio.  The ride up to the top was in a glass elevator with a great view of the strip on your way up.  The view only got better when we were seated at our window table.  The candlelit atmosphere of the restaurant paired with the bright lights of the strip were beautiful. Once we were seated, ordered drinks and dinner, everything was great.  My husband ordered the Menageatrois  (filet mignon, lobster tail, and jumbo shrimp) while I ordered the miso glazed salmon.  My husband loved his dinner, mine was good, but not enough miso glaze, and the bok choy was a little salty.  We also shared a crab cake and Caesar salad appetizer as well a the chocolate cake for dessert.  Everything we ordered was served fresh and we did not feel rushed during our dinner.  In fact, everything was spread out as to not be rushed to finish or too much time in between.  The service was great too.  Once we were finished, we were also granted free access to the VooDoo Lounge and Nightclub one floor up.  Great views, but at 10:30/11, it was dead in there. All in all, we had a great date night at VooDoo.

photos.caption: Photo of VooDoo Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Photo of VooDoo Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

N97WhWR1Y2Td8cf8GeVhJw.text: We had purchased a Groupon for the 5-course tasting menu. Upon arriving we were told there was an issue and that the tasting series had been cancelled. What could have very easily been a horrible turn of events ended up being literally one of the best dining experiences we'd ever had. John, the manager; Sam, our server; and the rest of the wait staff that assisted during our meal were all spectacular! While the tasting event had been cancelled, they didn't skip a beat; our Groupon was honored and we were treated to the best 5-course experience ever! The food was delicious, the wine pairings were perfect, and our whole table walked away completely satisfied.   Voodoo Steakhouse will be a constant on our list whenever we return to Vegas. The entire staff made our evening absolutely amazing and it was the perfect way to close out our vacation.

f4jt5sDww39k5bJuArov8Q.text: Thank you for making our daughters 21 st birthday-an absolutely amazing dinner experience-the food -the service-the absolute best!!!

qQ7-FQE8fXgK80Y1oKRETA.text: Let me start off by saying the food here over all was incredible. The steak was cooked perfectly and melted in my mouth, and my husbands meal was equally great. We also ordered a drink that wasn't on the menu but came in a lantern with dry ice, it was pretty cool! The drink itself was delicious and strong. Despite this I'm giving them 3 stars for a couple of reasons. The lobster tail that came with my meal was tough and stuck to the shell, I hardly got any pieces off of it and I gave up trying to eat it because it was impossible to chew. The lady who was handing out the bread was so sweet and gave us great service but our server was awful! He was not attentive, short with us, and when we asked him questions he didn't really care to answer them. We wished our tip could have gone to the bread lady because she gave us better service than our server! For the price that we paid here we expected better service.
