aZ80FgqHKj0uV-dpUDmN7Q.text: Everything was delicious and the service is always great. Even though the hotel is not very nice, I always enjoy a nice steak dinner at the  rooftop restaurant. The scenery is so nice. Just so happen we got to experience an earthquake while dining and the servers were very kind about ensuring we were okay. I had two small children with me, and a very frightened teenager, but all was well and the food was brought out perfectly.

pjh2gUZrQbHj2roCNclgCA.text: My friends and I were on vacation to Las Vegas and we wanted to have a special dinner. We chose VooDoo Steakhouse because of the view on top of the Rio and because the reviews were very good. We started out with the "witch doctor" cocktail, which we shared between the three of us. It was delicious and very cool to see the dry ice "smoke" when the server poured it into the glass. Next, we each ordered filet mignon and then all picked a different side because they're big enough to share. I've never had a better steak in my life. It's a little pricey, but it's to be expected in a tourist city. I'd absolutely go back!

photos.caption: Photo of VooDoo Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Filet mignon and sides of whipped potatoes, truffle potato wedges, and macaroni and cheese.

H7LEXr4zFY4jZSZffaJLpw.text: Great place!! DINER WAS FABULOUS! The scenery was awesome. I would recommend this restaurant.

921OST19bGfYaVnREhqqQw.text: A business colleague took my fiance and I there for the first time a few weeks ago and we've been back three times since.   The food and service is exceptional. Try to get a window table on the Vegas Strip side for an amazing view.

YvEEQuN0Y9yex9nBkJr9kQ.text: Place is excellent. Amazing views, food, and hospitality. Makes you feel at home in a truly spectacular restaurant. Will return every time I'm in Vegas!!

hvC4tkFT0FJs1aeA1hXGLg.text: Voodoo steakhouse was my #1 experience during my time in Las Vegas. The manager, John, and our server Samuel made the experience phenomenal and welcomed us as if we were family into their restaurant. The view on the 50th floor is breath taking and every moment was positive. The food is worth EVERY penny. The steak melted like butter and the sides had exceptional flavor. The scallops were seared perfectly and paired well with the sauce. I left that night feeling as if I made two genuine, long term friendships and a full, happy belly. I expect to be back every time I am in Las Vegas. Thank you John and Samuel for the wonderful service, food, and experience.

XreThOc5092L_lhKxZI_pQ.text: This place place is very good. Excellent view. Excellent service. Thank you Sam. You did a great job. The meat was prepared as asked for and the drinks not pictured were spot on. Not too strong and not too light. All in all. Very good experience.

1ZnaeYR_MUnzfdiL6vWrcg.text: This place is amazing. Been to other steakhouses in Vegas and this place beats them by far. The food is great and the service is incredible. The 51st floor rooftop views are spectacular. The manager (John) always makes us feel special. Been there twice on my last two visits to Vegas and will no doubt be a stop every time I come to town. The steaks are great and their house creamy mash potatoes are the bomb.

J_3520auXaNkzJKS6dSC7A.text: Amazing dinner.. almost similar to the top of the world with panoramic veiws. Step outside and watch the daredevils chair zipline from hotel to hotel. Great ambience and very romantic

photos.caption: Photo of VooDoo Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

CoJ2CMuns-FbYaF4aQRlEw.text: The two best things about this place were the banana dessert and the views. The access to the balcony/roof top lounge is worth eating here I'd say. The food was okay, not terrible but not amazing. The filet mignon wasn't too bad, it was cooked the way we like it. The lobster bisque had a dalop of cream in it which threw me off and I feel made it have a slightly off flavor. The best thing we had was the Banana pudding cake or whatever it's called. The presentation as it's being served is really neat and then it was really tasty since the sugar carmelizes from the heat of being on fire from the presentation. Honestly the main reason we came here is so we didn't have to rush out dinner before watching Penn and Teller. Would I make my way just to eat here again, no. Would I recommend eating here for the view, maybe, probably if you do the zipline too. Would I eat here again when I go back to watch Penn and Teller, probably.

wHI3LJkbR7yEuPuuanOu0g.text: The Australian Wagyu steak was very good. I'd also recommend the Lobster Mac & Cheese. Great view of the strip.

QH3_sUN1w85F8eSIIxrWOA.text: Wow!  Amazing tomahawk steak (32oz) and the french onion soup is a "don't miss"  The view is extraordinary and the service was great!  The prices are not cheap but soooo worth the splurge.  Be warned... the Witch Doctor drink WILL KNOCK YOU ON YOUR BUTT!

yrULD_59HnIwZ4KK8uZHNA.text: We went to dinner here on Saturday night the place was all the way up to the 50th floor. The ambience was nice, The servers were polite we have Raul and he made us feel welcome. We started with crabcakes which was delicious. I tried their margarita and that was on point. Or our entree we ordered the grass fed beef. It was very chewy. The view was phenomenal

w0vM2Ta-Kn0TKix7z63Bqw.text: We made reservations here for a birthday celebration on a Sunday thinking that we might get better service as it's usually a slower night for restaurants. Boy, we're we right! We were seated 20 minutes later than our reserved time. Then waited 1 1/2 hours for our food. When asked to see the manager he came over and was the rudest person I've met in Vegas. When he asked what I wanted him to do I said nothing I just wanted to let you know for the rice and reputation we expected better service! He walked away and slammed the kitchen door.   The manager should be fired! We were no way looking for comps or freebies.

uSN2zDsm0Y6SVxiKcGtxZA.text: Great view, nice & dark, the way I like it. Cocktail list is a little too sweet for me, but they've got a nice wine list & about a dozen beers to choose from. Wait staff is super chill, attentive, accommodating & professional.  Dry aged ribeye was okay, really tasty, but had more tough cartilage than I've had in other dry aged ribeyes. This was my first steak in a long time, about 6 months, so I'm sure my senses were heightened to it, nonetheless, it was still really flavorful.  Tip, as soon as you get a basket of warm bread, put a piece of it over your cold butter to soften it.   Overall, great spot, would definitely come back.

oUEQnAFvHcwBwA0cbC2rHA.text: Excellent food and service. The view is amazing. It was a great place to spend our 10 year Anniversary.

Yy1WbOo9QYeHuvgPKIqiTg.text: Absolutely worth the price!  Let's face it, prices in Vegas on the strip are high and this place is no exception. However, this place is totally worth the price!  Upon our arrival we asked for a window seat. They were fortunately able to accommodate our last-minute request within only a few minutes of our arrival. The views were amazing and we had the added bonus of watching the strip lights come on once the sun set. Beautiful.   A bread basket is standard for all parties and service was friendly and efficient. I noticed a party next to us of over-sized drinks that looked fun but I wasn't drinking that night so I can't comment on the alcohol.   My friend had the filet mignon and I had the scallops. Both were perfectly prepared and plated. I was very impressed with attention to detail. We also ordered several sides large enough for sharing. The lobster mac and cheese was okay although not as good as other posts suggest. However, if you're not worrying about carbs, worth a try. We also tried the green beans and the spinach. Both were good as well.   If you're on a budget and would still like to try this gem, I would recommend a salad and side. Probably just as satisfying at 1/3 the cost.  Don't forget to go out on the viewing deck before or after your meal. It's beautiful to say the least.

l7y45hY-OVLOI_TxtxjSTQ.text: I loooove this restaurant!  Amazing city views, great food, reasonable prices, and very unique cocktails!  My friend ordered one that was frothing with fog from dry ice.  Very cool spot.  Live music upstairs.  Highly recommend!

vVzeRU2CsRTi1W2XGU6n3w.text: Spectacular steak. Incredible atmosphere above average sides.  Meal includes entry to the night club.

wpxN3_9m3-bGtdqW1GQqcw.text: You simply cannot beat the view from this restaurant located at the top of the Rio! There's a great view from almost every table and you can go outside for an even more amazing view. The service was also amazing - very attentive! The drinks are pricey, but pretty much what you'd expect at a steakhouse in Vegas. If I was just basing this review on the view and the service, it would easily be 4 or 5 stars. Unfortunately, I wasn't very happy with my steak, considering the high price. I got the Filet Mignon, medium. It was flavorless and a bit dry. I didn't even finish it! Luckily, I got the truffle mac & cheese on the side and THAT was great!   My friend was happy with his steak, so I do think I would return and try something else from the menu. If nothing else, you should make a reservation here, keep your expectations in check and just enjoy the view.

FzMe0dlpjOFQ3WlYolrxYQ.text: I had been to the VooDoo Nightclub before, so I knew the view at VooDoo Steak would be wonderful.  The view was delightful.  Everything else was just okay...yet over-priced.  I am not a fan of overpaying for just okay food and a great view.  Go to VooDoo steak if you want a romantic or memorable dinner.    The food is not bad...the average Joe may even appreciate it.  But the foodie in me was not impressed by anything we had.  I tried the Lobster Bisque, The Scallops, and the Sea Bass.  Of the three the Bisque was the best....with a nice touch of small apple bits mixed in with the lobster chunks on top.  The apple played nice with the sweet lobster bisque and even nicer with the lobster chunks.  Other than that nothing was memorable enough to warrant a return tasting.

XpFFgEScFzfdTXX5z8ZUOg.text: Great view & that's where it ends. Ribeye steak no sides$58.00 tough. With all the great food Vegas has to offer, this is one to pass on. Huge restaurant was almost empty, that should have served as a warning!

jEZI9ZRQknHFdzt-6cRcoA.text: I will give this restaurant 5 stars! Atmosphere and music were great! The waiter was nice and the photographer was pleasant. No wait when we were checking in for dinner. The views were amazing. As far as the food- we had the Mac n Cheese- yummy. Asparagus was tasty and we had the Australian Wagyu Steak (we shared the steak and the side were family style) OMG it was delicious, flavorful, well seasoned and cooked right. We shared all 3 items and were stuffed.. Forget the desserts, no room. Yes it is pricey but the quality of the food was well worth the money- you only live life once so enjoy it!  We will be coming back!!

photos.caption: Photo of VooDoo Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gooch and I

aHPGd4nW_TjqkzQzQlsUyA.text: I don't normally give out negative reviews, but this case warrants it. My fiance and I went here to celebrate our engagement. We had saved for awhile and decided to splurge here. We should have chosen differently. The service was decent, our server was fairly attentive. The food was disappointing...for the price of the steaks, I would have expected something a little more on par with Gordon Ramsay Steak. The real issue came after we got home and later that night. We both became quite ill, with signs and symptoms indicating food poisoning. We called and informed the restaurant and were brushed off, stating they "would look into it." No apology or renumeration was offered.  So if you're looking for excellent service and superb steak, go to Gordon Ramsay's!

uc4-Vf3EIT4aUrX_3dVHPQ.text: This place is far from fine dining as you can get. The wait staff is poorly trained. For the prices our silver was never changed between courses. Our side plates were never cleared. By the time we finished our meal our table was a mess of plates uncleared from the starting bread plates. You pay big bucks for poor service and low quality food.

K6YuazppOtg0hllDmPDdCw.text: The view is beautiful, but the restaurant is not worth the money.  We ate here October 19th at 6:00pm, the night my boyfriend proposed. It was a Sunday night and not very busy. We were told because we did not have a reservation they could not sit us by the window, but throughout our entire meal there were at least 6 window tables open, that were never seated. The staff was not friendly and we had better service at the casino buffet. The nicest person there was the photographer who was so kind and took our picture out on the patio, and to my surprise caught my boyfriend's proposal as well.  We tipped him better then our waiter. The food was average. I had the free range chicken, and my fiance had the Ribeye. If the service had been a little better, I might consider going back.

lfS_0hVk9UqtUmCgABWlMQ.text: Went there early and on time for our reservations last night.  We we're a party of 4 so we should've had dinner and made it to our show on time, NOT!  Over an hour waiting for our dinner and the couple next to us who arrived much later, received their food. Our waiter acted offended that we called this out and tried to tell us to wait a little more.  Bottom line,  the menu looked good,  we are happily anticipating a nice experience but that never happened.  Very- very disappointing! Oh and this was dinner on a wed. By 7pm.

he9K9jk2958TDmCntcIOYw.text: I like the place by itself , it's nice restaurant on 50th floor with Las Vegas view . But the food meh .. And overpriced .

RkGZmv4KqYeT_UfUxYrgWw.text: We enjoyed dinner here on a Saturday night during Superbowl weekend.  This place is awesome!  The views of the strip are incredible from your seat but with dinner you get free access to the club level where you can go outside and experience the views from their rooftop bar.    It's a steak place but all of their food was great!  We started with the crab artichoke dip - it was just OK.  The heirloom tomato salad was scrumptious.  In our party of four, we had the veal, sea bass and two different cuts of steak - one with the horseradish crust.  Every entree was awesome!    The service was very attentive, friendly and helpful.    We will definitely eat here again!

AIzXjzrXWnpy2ybvffEsHQ.text: The food was great! We had booked through a full girls night package and all expenses were taken care of in advance. The Waiter seemed to have the attitude that we were not making him any money and he did not want to be serving us. We tipped well over the bill price if we would have had a bill. The view was great once you went outside to the balcony. The windows on the side of the restaurant were so dirty that you could not see the beautiful view from the inside. Overall great food, clean inside, and perfect at sunset.

X6exsVNNPVW4tTF7kFXpaw.text: I barely log on to Yelp but had to share.  This was by far my favorite place on the strip - I ate here with my points at least once every few weeks for over a year.  It's been a couple months since I have been in and they have since changed the menu.  Although I am deeply saddened they eliminated the Heirloom Tomato salad which was the best in the country, I understand things have to be changed up sometimes.  However, the bread was insulting enough to log in to write about it.  When you pay $60 for a steak, you want more than prepackaged dinner rolls and a pretzel roll.  Not comparing to the amazing bread they used to serve, but a pretzel roll puts this at the "bar food" level not the $60 per steak level.  The steak was fantastic as usual (though mine was served medium rare not medium).  The service was still great, though he was uninformed of the yelp promotion.  (The Amuse was AMAZING!)

SL7CELE-LjKAJGZ9xxzSAQ.text: My bf ordered the 32oz Tomahawk ($79) and I ordered the 8 oz filet mignon ($47). Alongside our truffle Mac and cheese and asparagus. I usually don't eat all my food but when it is so good, everything is literally licked off my plate. The only steakhouse I've been to in LV and is now my fave. If you have a Total Rewards card you get $2 off each. To add to this review, we had a party of 11. Service was great.  Our bill was approx. $900. Be sure to have cash if you're splitting the bill.

pyo3uQYmw-MvRaBNtdFgkw.text: Most of the other reviews are pretty accurate. cons: The price doesnt match the food quality.  The prices on the link to the menu, dont match the actual prices. Its around $10 more. The servers are a little rude.  Pros:  The view from the 50th floor rib-eye was pretty good

bnqx4KWKZw3XNlYRJA-Aww.text: I had the menage a trois combo which included a 6 ounce filet mignon, jumbo shrimp, lobster tail with mashed potatoes with a medley of vegetables. I also had the lobster bisque soup which was excellent as a starter. The restaurant was not very busy so I was a little surprised at the poor attention to service. When the waiter checked in to ask me how my meal was I mentioned that the carrots were undercooked and so was the lobster tail. He did not offer to fix it and just looked at me and walked away. Overall I would say the meal was better than average but certainly not worth the hundred dollar price tag for one dinner!

jn7UHgOlO7NkYhZ7om7TyA.text: Amazing view. Amazing food. Just absolutely amazing. Myself and 5 other ladies were here to celebrate a bachelorette weekend and wanted to have a nice dinner. This was the perfect place!   First off the restaurant is on the 50th floor. Yes you read that right. 5-0! The elevator ride is crazy fast but once you get to the top and see the huge glass windows and the Las Vegas skyline your breath is taken away.   Before we sat down for dinner we went outside to their patio area to get some fresh air and of course take lots of pictures. Beautiful background.   On to dinner. I ordered the salmon with Mac and cheese and broccoli and it was so mouthwateringly good. Each bite was better than the one before. The other ladies opted for the surf and turf. Now I'm not a steak girl but that lobster had me wanting to order a to go meal and I was overly stuffed already. The portions are generous. Yes, this restaurant is pricy but it is absolutely worth every penny.   If I ever make it back to Las Vegas I will be stopping by here again.

lmMwuWcHc-2THPA93ROFPQ.text: This place is truly a hidden gem. I am a frequent visitor to Las Vegas and never considered anything in the Rio before, just because it was off strip and not that "popular" compared to the newer hotels.  We ended up trying this place because of an offer we had through Caesar's and it blew Ruth Chris and BLT steak away!!  Service was very good, the steak had so much flavor and the portions were huge!  Tip - if you check in on yelp, you get a free amuse (small appetizer) which I think is the chefs choice. We got the short ribs and it was very delicious!  We ordered a 3 course special. Choice of Caesar salad or lobster bisque, choice of filet or rib eye with diver scallops, whipped potatoes and asparagus. It finishes off with a creme brulee. When I hear 3 course or preset meals, I automatically think smaller portions... this was NOT the case. The cost per person was about $95 per person, such a great deal!  The Caesar salad was full portion and delicious. Very strong on the anchovies which I surprisingly liked. We ordered two bone in rib eyes, both cooked medium rare. My steak came over cooked and looked different than the other steak (maybe a different grill?) but the other one was perfectly cooked and had so much flavor! That's truly the only reason why it's not a 5 star review. The potatoes and asparagus were delicious too.  We also ordered the lobster Mac and cheese. Oh, my, goodness! It was a HUGE portion and had so much flavor with large portions of lobster in it!  The creme brulee dessert was also spot on with a nice sugar crust on top, not soggy at all.  I HIGHLY recommend VooDoo steak house!

photos.caption: Photo of VooDoo Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ribeye with whipped potatoes, asparagus and diver scallops.
Photo of VooDoo Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Caesar Salad

FT_frWbi-BYGxbImpd0jsw.text: This place was fantastic. From start to finish. Getting off the elevator, the reception greeted us by name because the downstairs doorman called up.  Going up to the 50th floor was a fun and fast elevator ride.  We were seated by the window as requested and had a gorgeous view of the city.  Every single staff member was accommodating, fun and knowledgeable.   We were taken care of by Jamal as our server and Effren bused our table. Neither of them missed a beat and both had a witty sense of humor that further complimented our experience.  We did not drink wine, but the cocktails were excellent.  The sommelier did pay us a visit and she was also friendly and knowledgeable.  My husband and I each had their three-course special which was a fillet mignon with sides and dessert. The steak was one of the best I have ever had and was cooked to perfection. The lobster bisque and creme brulee was delicious.  However the show stopper was our dramatic appetizer called Fire and Ice.  It is a hot and cold seafood tower that literally features dry ice and fire.  It's not cheap, but it would feed a table of four.  We ate it as an entree and ended up boxing up a lot of left overs.  It was an exceptional meal experience.  Highly recommended.

photos.caption: Photo of VooDoo Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fire and ice appetizer. Dry ice on the bottom just before the server lit the fire.
Photo of VooDoo Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fire and Ice appetizer at Voodoo Steakhouse, Las Vegas

_4Igdc--V7JKIa_qts1EqQ.text: John and Sam are the best! Very pleased with our bday dinner! The food was delicious and quick! Complimentary drinks for my bday! Yay!

cOKwKh_n2Vj8JgVZQQ8PkA.text: Really great food. View is incredible. Servers are awesome and friendly. Always a must for trips to the otherwise decrepit Rio.

ebYpFjr8X1kk3ALdu-3e9g.text: The food was EXCELLENT! and the view was spectacular!!!!!  Great service and friendly wait staff.   Our steaks were a little under so we had to send them back to bring the temperature up and the chef brought them back out to us with apologies.   Absolutely recommend for a nice night out!

photos.caption: Photo of VooDoo Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The chocolate surprise comes with the check
Photo of VooDoo Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The entrance

NDC5-p0HoTfJgL2OON3F2A.text: Absolutely incredible from start to finish!!  We were there for a family member's 75th birthday, and the staff at Voodoo Steak could not have made us feel more like family!  The manager (didn't get his name but he's explaining the birthday drink in the posted photo) greeted us and immediately wished Carl a happy birthday (he knew due to a comment that was left on our Open Table reservation).    Our server, Billy, was outstanding.  His knowledge of the menu and attention to detail were literally second to none.  He offered suggestions to compliment what was ordered.  He was extremely friendly and treated us like valued personal guests.  This is my second time eating there, and the steak is still something that legends are made of.  I had the dry-aged rib eye, and it was hands down the best steak I have ever had in my life.  Other members had the lobster bisque, prawns, 8 oz. filet, and beet salad, and there was not a single suggestion on how to make anything better.  We even had a "food sensitive" person in our party and the staff was able to make sure her needs were tended to.  After the unbelievable meal, we ordered after dinner drinks and were able to enjoy them outside on the patio, fully taking advantage of the breathtaking views offered from the 50th floor of the Rio.  Of course, all of this decadence comes at a price, but if you're in Las Vegas and aren't spoiling yourself, then you're doing Las Vegas wrong.  Do yourself a favor and add Voodoo steak to your list of "must-try" restaurants.

photos.caption: Photo of VooDoo Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

nywg0x6bT7Uz1m8QoCQg1A.text: Jose was splendid server .. he made my bday dinner magical.. I couldn't have asked for a better dinner..

photos.caption: Photo of VooDoo Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ewFQFcY5wi1HYhqgL5EimA.text: Want a nice place for dinner with good food and service?  How about a place that gives an amazing view of the Las Vegas Strip?  VooDoo Steakhouse is one solution!  Located at the top of the Masquerade Tower of The Rio Hotel & Casino, the view are great!  Steak and seafood is their thing.  I've never had a meal I didn't like here.  Steaks that I've have always been perfectly cooked and the lobster tails and shrimp have also been great time after time!  They have an outdoor observation deck for before, during, or after dinner.  After dinner, you get free admission to the VooDoo Lounge- which also has its own outdoor observation deck.  (FYI- it gets windy up their!)  My only issue is that the kitchen will eventually close, so if you go late for dinner, you may not get to order desert.  This has happened to me a couple times now when I've had dinner after 9pm.  However in each case the waiter found something sweet to finish off the meal anyway - just not ordered off the desert menu.

tBumSK3dpY3PzGnoSVrRTw.text: My girlfriend and I popped in for a quick drink right at 5pm to check out this place thanks to a friends recommendation. Antonio, the bar tender, was so pleasant and humourous we decided to stay for a light dinner. Couldn't have asked for a better more engaging bartender with a great personality! The crab cakes, ceasar salad, and charcuterie board were just enough to help fuel us through the night!

B4AmmQUAKidLaGH7XAFDsQ.text: Fantastic food and fantastic service! The view from the 50th floor has the best views of the strip. Sam provided our group a great experience we will never forget. 5-stars!

ylDqIkgT8yuJXEv3lirJKQ.text: I would absolutely recommend coming here for the view of the city skyline and probably the best view of the east side of the Strip.  However places like Eiffel Tower restaurant will give you a better view from inside the Strip.  That said, the food is very good but not quite the top tier for Vegas.  The aged bone-in ribeye is divine and worth a visit alone.

photos.caption: Photo of VooDoo Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Banana Bomb
Photo of VooDoo Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Banana Bomb

GPOtzWq9zxIZvsjzz-YEZA.text: Great food. Beautiful views. I've been here twice. The service is amazing and the views overlook the strip from a Birdseye view. Would highly recommend.

v_ozsEcPCZiJVhMumCU0Tw.text: What a great place! Great atmosphere and the wait staff was friendly. Our table offered us a great view of the Las Vegas strip.  We started off with the artichoke hearts, again a winner. We had ordered a wedge salad, but it never arrived. We are not sure what happened. In order to make it up, our waiter brought us a free dessert.   The steaks were fantastic....juicy, savory rib eyes!

SFRb5-uhRx49yp4IrX8qoA.text: I went to the steakhouse for my 21st birthday and I'd never felt more taken care of before. It was arranged for me and my best friend to go on the zip line free of charge before dinner. When we came back the food was to die for, I highly recommend the lobster Mac. I was given a witch doctor as my first drink by the restaurant and the dry ice smoke had me breathless. At the end of the night they brought me out a piece of birthday cake while everyone sang. I don't even like chocolate cake and I loved this cake. The steakhouse made me feel like a princess on my birthday and then the club up above didn't let me down either! Would highly recommend for special occasions.

zBTs4fYQlJTihw4FQEi5Zw.text: Had an amazing time with my friends.  The manager John Cerqueira was so welcoming and attentive. Amazing experience...  A most have is creme brulee and the NY strip with wild mushrooms.

K0v_RUJLhxpxqTKdlo7W-w.text: I looked up "best steaks with a great view" in Las Vegas. What popped up that interested me was Voodoo steak house.  I immediately made a reservation. It was worth every moment from meeting the bartender from Portugal to walking outside and looking at the 180 degree view from the 50th floor. Spectacular. Dinner was fantastic. Lobster bisque, a 28 day aged steak prepared properly, Mac and cheese enough for two and asparagus. No room for dessert. I was in heaven. Great meal, great view and superb service by Sam. Good stories, regular attention and lots of knowledge about the menu. Just what you want. Love the mystical decor. Matches the name. Put this restaurant on your list. Free parking or you can valet. $$$$  but worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of VooDoo Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Voodoo
Photo of VooDoo Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sky high views
Photo of VooDoo Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The city at 8:30pm.

FbhiTVkFxN3YikV9d6AmYQ.text: Antonio was by far the best bartender ever! He made us feel so special and made our night! We'll always be back!! Food was great and the service was absolutely amazing!! Definitely a must when in Las Vegas!!

5xKq7SrQWnRLq2D0AuC5rQ.text: I love the service at the Caesars properties. They are really going for that Forbes 5 Stars rating. The food was amazing as well. Best salmon I've had in a while. The view is good but I wish it wasn't as dark inside.

photos.caption: Photo of VooDoo Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon &amp; scallops, mushrooms and mashed potatoes sides.

GAxwtBksdJagE_RfUfYQuQ.text: So I have been to the nightclub a few times but never been to the restaurant.  So I was excited to try it.  The location is awesome and the view while eating is incredible.  The service was awesome and the server seemed very knowledgeable.  The food left something to be desired.  I had lamb chops and my lamb was great.  My wife had the surf and turf and hers was not as good.  Especially the steak, for it being a steakhouse we were expecting a much better tasting steak.  It was very bland.  I saw other people needing to use A1 steak sauce which is usually a no no in a steakhouse if this caliber.  But for the price would have expected a much better tasting steak.  The drinks are great the service is great and you can get right into the night club without paying, so that's a great perk.

ycJIDpRib0EnhkBrCcgoTA.text: Awesome dining experience.  The view can't be beat & I love the eclectic New Orleans music scene vibe.  My favorite menu items are the Ora King Salmon & Bananas Foster!

WRw-2TtkqU86cwylh4mtgg.text: We were there on July 5, 2017.. This was our first time visiting the Steakhouse..We had reservations but we arrived early, and went to the bar for a drink.. The first thing we noticed was the restaurant was very warm and they had fans to take the edge off. The bartender was very friendly and advised us that they could sit us whenever we were ready.. He recommended walking out onto the rooftop for the views.. Once we were seated the waiters were very attentive and helpful with the menu selections.. We ordered to share the lobster Mac and cheese, and we both ordered the filet.  The lobster Mac and cheese had no flavour of cheese and only tiny pieces of lobster. Our steak were not juicy and also no flavour.. I must say we were both disappointed with the food, but the service was excellent...

GgOi2r0kbbzNoYdDGwzsSA.text: Spectacular view and excellent service. Everyone had steak they were happy with. Wedge salad was less than excellent. The beef was of very good quality but not quite to the standards of say The Capital Grill. Bar service was outstanding with a generous poor. Very good selection of bourbon. Overall a good value with a professional service staff. Worth the visit.

70XLM8DvPL2_nCWODljaQQ.text: Like so many before us, the view is killer. And being a Diamond Player assures us a window table each time. As a bonus, the evening we dined,  the outdoor patio deck was the perfect temperature wind no wind whatsoever.   My wife and I ordered the lump crab and artichoke dip with boursin cheese, pita chips (was very tasty and loads of crab) and I just had to have the seared foie gras which was seared to absolute perfection, beautiful in texture with that buttery rich flavor I so miss since California, the nanny state has outlawed foie gras. making it easier to score crack cocaine on a Saturday night out.  My wife had a glass of wine which she stated was very good, sorry, I forgot the brand but believe it was Ferrari-Carano Merlot and although our families favorite is their Cabernet Sauvignon, it has been impossible to find the Ferrari-Carano Cabernet Sauvignon lately.   We ordered the menage a tois, a filet mignon, lobster tail and shrimp for our main course and were not disappointed. The steak was cooked perfectly to a medium rare, and the lobster tail was sweet and delicious. The shrimp were large in size and equally delicious with a sweet aftertaste. We also ordered their truffle mac and cheese and it really was rather delicious! The broccoli sauteed in olive and garlic oil was very good and cooked to our liking.  Our waiter, Jose was spot on, attentive with a healthy sense of humor and seemed to go out of his way to please not only us, but the other guests in his station. The timing of the meal was not rushed and each course arrived in perfect timing.  I did not find the bill exorbitant for the experience and quality of food and a quick scan of the dining room proved that there certainly everyone was having a good time. We will return again and again for sure.  As a side note, in the past we have enjoyed a most incredible New Years Eve party here on the 50th floor of the VooDoo Steakhouse and Lounge, one my family constantly remembers as an amazingly great time, as a result, this location will always hold a special place in our hearts.

photos.caption: Photo of VooDoo Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of VooDoo Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

DeUACt4HtMCMn3nUAHplUg.text: Thought I'd put this one out here... Your dollars can certainly be better spent. Regardless of the Vegas premium you pay for some of the finer restaurants, this place is straight up not worth it- period. Yes, it's 50 floors up and looks great at night but all of that is haunted by below average appetizers, over priced wine (seriously over priced..), and some of the saltiest fare one can purchase. I'm not going to rail every dish but some notables or warnings would be to avoid the coconut shrimp (laughable..could bounce all the back up from 50 floors), lobster bisque (I've had better from the grocery section), and the Voodoo Caesar salad. I will say that the Caesar reminded exactly of the tray of salad you can get at Costco with a little siracha mixed in, might try that at home..  In short, pop in for a cocktail and a picture then bail.  Cheers!

4j13VPi0UMXoB26uvdqo-Q.text: So incredibly disappointed in this place and their service. We made dinner reservations for 6:45pm when we arrived to our room yesterday afternoon. At 6 we decided to go and sit at the bar until it was time for our reservation. I ordered a corona and my fiance ordered a margarita on the rocks. Upon receiving her drink my fiance noticed something floating in it. Once we were able to fish it our, we realized that it was a HUGE bug. She immediately brought it over to one of the managers to show him, and what was his response? Basically nothing. He comped her drink and that was it. I'm sorry but I expected much more from such a "high class" establishment. We opted not to eat there after this, so they lost out on money there. Shame on you voodoo steak for not handling this the right way.

gpbFinXv1vL8oGg2gUHmEQ.text: The steak was one of the best I've had, cooked to perfection.  The sides and starters we're great too.   I was disappointed with the creme brulee. After the quality of good put in front of me at dinner I was expecting the best.....  The view is second to none as you look out over Las Vegas.  I'm looking forward to my next visit so I can take the zip line (wasn't open yet).   Be aware, their 'shots' are a little bigger than most!!  Price was average for a Vegas steak house.

photos.caption: Photo of VooDoo Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The view at Voodoo
Photo of VooDoo Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The smaller of many &#39;shots&#39; at Voodoo

O97CNf2RS2191qfg_GOXOQ.text: On the 50th floor with amazing views of the whole city ! I've been here once before but appreciated it much more this time, the ride up in the open elevator was great. Greeted by our hostess we were seated at the window with a great view just at sunset as we we're eating before the show. We made reservations on the open table app and it was super easy.   I ordered a nice Malbec and my sister a Merlot. Our waiter was very helpful and informative about the menu. Good size restaurant, with a nice size bar and a very good wine list.   I had 1/2 dozen oysters and they were on the small side but very nice. (My apologies can not remember where they were from). Came with horseradish, lemon and seafood sauce. Not the toppings I would have preferred, however it was very tasty, and 10 out of 10 on that choice, My sister ordered the onion soup. It was very cheesy, lots of onions and was made with a nice beef broth, also delicious. There were about 10 appetizers on the menu and it was a tough call which to order, they all sounded great.   Bread basket of LOTS of assorted warm rolls arrived with a great deal of butter arrived at the table and I hate to admit it, but I tried a couple - yummy, they were good!   Great menu selection and it was hard to choose, but for my entree I had a 8 oz filet with a side of creamed spinach, it was rare, just the way I ordered it and it melted in your mouth it was soooooo good. My sister ordered the "Trio"; steak, lobster and prawns. The steak was a nice 4oz, the lobster was a nice size, but the "prawns" looked like shrimp....they were certainly on the small side, she received two and I was lucky enough to get one. Very delicious and buttery tasting, even though they were on the small side.  It came with potato and vegetables and they were kind enough to eliminate the potato and add some more vegetables.   For dessert sis had the creme brulee and said it was just great, I did manage to get my spoon in there and taste it, and yummy was that good!   We received our discount using total rewards which was outstanding, and my great sister picked up the tab! It is a very pricy menu and the majority of entrees come a la carte.   All in all, service was great, food just wonderful and view from the top was stellar!!!! Even got to hop out on to the patio and it was really nice, small breeze and perfect for some photos of the city.

k2YFXat0SSLnBCIMzmttxg.text: Been there , done that, got the t-shirt, etc. location, view, bar, etc., is  nice. Patio with zip line is nice. Food is nice. Exceptional? Well, the popovers are really good. Dinner was not as good as the popovers, frankly. Went for a good steak on the recommendation of friends. They raved about it . When I next saw them I told them  we didn't go rather than tell them it was not very good. Service was average, something I notice happens in the better restaurants in town if you don't order drinks or a bottle of wine to start. As for the steak..? I think the term is ?..fuggedaboudit. Wife's filet ordered medium was really rare, sent back to return well done. She couldn't eat it. Mine was medium rare but  nothing I would go back for. If I remember, bill with tip was about $170.   We DO really enjoy their recipe for popovers, though. With a steak on the grill from a supermarket nearby.

xzDBHUtfIKKINn04WRCZ0A.text: Uncertain what a compelling reason to come here again would be. The view from the deck is very good at night - but you could accomplish that with just a quick expensive drink at the tiny bar. Waiter running around and apologizing quite a bit. Staff looked like they wanted to do better than they were. The Caesar salad was terrible - pre-made and wilted with what had to be bag croutons; at $16 it is a crime. The filet with garlic & horseradish crust very good. Had to wait a long while to get a beer and a large time gap between wilted salad and steak. Not to mention the Rio feels a little tired and less clean then I would like; feels like a Kmart that does know they are about to go under.

aafBWY2T17F0IIH5k12pxw.text: I enjoy the VooDoo Steakhouse and I would say that the bartender Kenny makes it extra special.  We love to sit at the bar before dining and watch Kenny in action.  He can maintain a great conversation, a talent of a True bartender, while mixing up a lot of drinks for the wait staff and other guests.  Years ago the InterContinental in NYC had a famous, long-term bartender, I think the Rio could brag about having Kenny!

QF_REb4101V6kS1zlCQkfA.text: I thought the dinner was really good! Good beer selection and the waiter was on it and friendly. We had the sea bass and lamb chops plus a side of French onion soup. Plenty of food and delicious.

xlhjXe7IWchIOOUFw1tflQ.text: Hey, hey, hey now. . .. This place is AMAZING! Our reservation had us seated immediately by the window so we could have a lovely view of fabulous VEGAS!    We started with the Veal cheek. We've never had it before and decided to give it a try. Although it was slightly greasy ( I think that is how it is supposed to be) it was pretty damn good.    For my entree, I chose the VooDoo Menage A Trois which consisted of a 6oz petite filet, 4 oz lobster tail, jumbo prawns and I chose mashed potatoes. SERIOUSLY, oh my gawd! The whole meal just absolutely blew my mind. The steak was perfectly cooked, seasoned, tender & juicy. The lobster was prepared in an amazing sauce & was hands down the best I have ever had!  Pricey? Yes. BUT in this case you get what you pay for. Amazing service, food & ambiance. Thank you VooDoo for making the whole trip worth it!

Gr5BDwR-O504TZdKhtRm7g.text: enjoyed dinner during company conference.  Food was on point, menu offered all that could be expected.  Waitstaff was attentive and knowledgeable.   Overall a very good experience and beef

16fESNOCVhsag8J50hbfTw.text: For our party of six; Food was cooked perfectly and thoroughly enjoyed by everyone. Yes it's pricey but it's a premier Vegas steakhouse and you get what you pay for. The view is tremendous for fifty one stories up also!   However the service left much to be desired. On a slow day, our server seemed to do the bare minimum and say as few words as possible. The back server was excellent though.   In the end, very good place but besides the view, Ruth Chris is better in taste, price and service.

V2YU49-aZAOmWCDwHGP--w.text: Staying in the hotel on business. I stopped by the restaurant desk last night and specifically asked the man at the desk about table availability for a single diner tomorrow, on Valentine's Day. No problem, they will have open tables, no need for a reservation. Today at 6:45 I showed up and was told no, reservations only,  no walk-ins. More great service from incompetent staff. I'm in Vegas almost monthly. This is my first and last time at Rio. This was the last straw.

fHhcfx5weQAf-3Wt-oJ_Ig.text: Food was ok . Service was ok . View is what makes this a great location the sunset over the mountains is very romantic and  when your done eating you have to go to roof top to enjoy the view of the strip .

photos.caption: Photo of VooDoo Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of VooDoo Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of VooDoo Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. View from out side . ABSOLUTELY Gorgeous!!!!

tdHFEs-kIOdZlSmZZF1J_A.text: We come here with some degree of regularity.  The view from the 50th floor of the Rio is INCREDIBLE! The restaurant is quite pricey, and everything is ala carte, but it's all good and very nicely prepared. The service is good, tho we went early before the crowds arrived. We have tried numerous dishes and were always pleased. I usually have Salmon and find their's quite good. Their lamb was also quite good with generous serving sizes. Bring your camera and join the crowds taking photos of their group overlooking Las Vegas;  it's quite impressive!

Koqa3Cn-IcPsmOmNlVUMLg.text: Great view of the Strip, a little pricey but the steak was great so were the deserts. It's worth a try.

photos.caption: Photo of VooDoo Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The apps are solid too !!!
Photo of VooDoo Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of VooDoo Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

JhprckHuwowI5lD8EY1uww.text: We're convinced this restaurant is the reason anyone ever returns to the Rio. If only their hotel provided a comparable quality.  My wife and I were lucky enough to visit Voodoo Steak on the night after our wedding. It was our first dinner out as husband and wife. We also had the good fortune to be seated in Sam's section, and Sam provided exceptional service all night.  To start, we ordered an appetizer and a bottle of wine. After Sam brought over the wine and poured us each a glass, he invites us to go hang out on the outdoor balcony, overlooking the Strip, while the pork belly with apple and caramelized onions was being prepared. We did, and Sam came out about 5-10 mins later to let us know our first course was ready.  We came in and ate our delicious pork belly, and some tasty starter bread.  It wasn't long before my 8 oz. filet mignon with garlic buttery scallops came out with my wife's seared scallops.  We also ordered truffle mac & cheese. All i can say about them is "Wow."  My mouth is watering just thinking back.  As we finished up dinner, knowing our story, Sam provided complimentary champagne flutes. Classy move, much appreciated. We ordered some tasty coffee ice cream to finish the evening, and we left full, extremely satisfied, and impressed.  As we told Sam, we'll be back for our anniversary next year.

_LwHiR00zqx44jzur9q4MA.text: Great view, but you pay for it. Service is ok. We came for drinks only so I can't speak for the food. We had one and left. Wait staff was non attentive and it wasn't busy. I guess they were prepping for the night. I may come back just to show someone the view but based on other reviews I will probably only have drinks again.

raaeVCWt3_KunXWtUDdDXA.text: Great service, good food, nice views - especially from the patio/deck, strong drinks.  What more could you ask for?  The lighting is romantic, the service was very good, the food was certainly good.  Not an extensive menu and maybe a little overpriced, but all in all I would go again.  If you show up early, do the zip line with the local discount, it's a fun 2 minutes.

hvTSw1Qx-qwZj4zGT9Vm6Q.text: Voodoo Steak was ok. The best thing is the view from the top of the Rio (50th floor) of the Las Vegas Strip. We had a window table and the view was stunning and we got there before sunset and there to see the sunset, very cool. To start we had a Cheese and Chanteuse plate. It had salami with black truffles that had a great salty, earthy flavor. Also include chorizo, Gruyere, blue cheese, sharp white cheddar and kalamata olives. Also a cranberry toast with 3 jams that were plate licking good! Next was a rich, flavorful lobster bisque except the pieces of lobster were chewy. For a side the Hericot Vert with onions was seasoned well and had a good snap. The bone-in ribeye was a bit over cooked from the medium-rare I ordered. It had a bit to much pepper and overall just an ok steak for the price. Service was good but overall probably wouldn't go back for the food.

mnKaaDLPcS-V-nSSx8ExlA.text: The hostess had an attitude...but our waiter was great. The food was pricey but amazing and the views are phenomenal..unlike anything in Vegas! The elevator view going up was worth the prices alone. Totally worth going, especially if you're staying at the Rio (we were).. the French onion soup was delicious & my friends loved the rib eye.. I would definitely recommend it!

Gne2g2FBQnKeWPmHDcjvPw.text: YUM YUM YUM!!!  Terrific!  We had reservations and they were expecting us when we arrived, gave last name and they didn't even look down at the book, called upstairs and announced my full name for them to be ready for us.  Very cool.  We ordered the Trio of Filet, Lobster Tail, and Shrimp.  My husband and I each have had Gastric Bypass so we always share and they split the meal for us.  The filet, cooked perfectly rare.  The lobster was a terrific amount of meat.  The shrimp were large and good.  Beautiful presentation on the plate with small amount of mashed potatoes, baby carrot, lemon wedge.  We also tried the bone marrow.  Excellent.  Always wonder why they make it so salty though?  Every restaurant, not just this one.  We also ordered mashed potatoes not knowing we'd have them on the other plate so unfortunately we spent a bit too much with that order.  We had the shishito peppers which were great.  As an appetizer we split the wedge salad - again, absolutely delicious!  After, we went out to the rooftop bar lounge area.  Great view of the strip!  Anyways... didn't have a high expectations of the Rio in general, but we had a great meal experience, the Penn and Teller show was awesome, and we had fun gambling.  We'd go back!

d6NilPyyl9JcHgoNoSbxyQ.text: I'd probably say 3.5 stars. The food was pretty average. The lobster bisque despite the hype was merely OK. The crab cakes were good. Our steaks were cooked properly, but again, were really nothing special.  They couldn't serve me a witch doctor (supposedly a specialty drink of theirs) because they were all in use at the nightclub. What, special glasses or something???? I didn't understand that very much. Anyway, that was a con and we both felt the prices were too high for the quality presented.   We did walk out on the roof top and the view is amazing so that was a plus.  Overall is was a decent experience, but except for the view nothing was even close to spectacular.

C8QOAG0h0iU4i5B356toUw.text: Reservations were time consuming and just tried to get sales information for rewards card.  Food was decent but a little tough on the Tomahawk cut.  However, at end, the water boy threw away wife's food we asked to be boxed.  As we waited for replacement it was clear we were being ignored so we left.

eJwCELA93I39wvKMDiAVbw.text: This was my first visit to Voodoo Steak, and quite frankly will most likely be my last. The hotess we encountered to start our evening needs some work on her attitude to say the least. We were a few minutes early, so we decided to go on the outside deck and enjoy the amazing views over the city from this 50th floor restaurant. Once seated we had an amazing view again. We were given bread to start. It was very plain, but did include some raisin rolls as well(blah). We ordered the wedge salad($13) and really enjoyed it. The Lobster bisque soup came next, and had an excellent taste and left us wanting more ($12)!!  My wife ordered a Lobster, seafood dish($52) and frankly loved it. I ordered the 20oz Ribeye$(49) cooked medium Rare and this led me to my average rating. This is called Voodoo STEAK!  Well my steak was not even close to high end quality. I swear Texas Roadhouse steaks blow it away! It came out well done too! I showed the waiter, he then says "that tis really off and I will go put in another steak for you." I said well we are meeting friends at 10pm so can you rush it, "sure no problem. I apologize." After 20 minutes I decide to keep nibbling on the steak left with me. I nibbled till it was almost done and we finally see waiter again. He says kitchen is behind and its gonna be longer. I go forget it,  I finished steak(which I think was their entire goal anyway) and the $14 martini's and we left. If your wanting nice ambience, nice views, and decent service this place is fine. If your looking for premium grade steaks that are worth the expensive price, avoid!

9gsP_WpdedeDtTpjcL53LQ.text: Extremely nice view and very good food. Went to voodoo and mon Abi Gabi in Vegas and the voodoo was so much better in all aspects, except for price

UhczUu945-BQIYih1EicYA.text: Our waiter was great! Jamal. Impeccable service and really decent food. It's a bit pricey but quality seemed good. My girl had crab legs and filet  and I had a  ribeye. We shared a side and a lobster bisk. Like I said pricey however, locals and rewards members may be eligible for a discount so ask. Waiter was personable and I hope he's there my next time. Food good quality.... Portions ok, sides ok, & view is great as its on the roof. Good occasion spot!

agSamILG2v_D_uoFacGUMQ.text: This place is a for sure must hit while your in Vegas. Best F-n food anytime night or day. Thanks for the best service ever. Will be back for sure.

r1OtEDdCYhdy8C1ujDo1vw.text: VooDoo Steak was the best dining experience I had on my recent trip to Vegas. Service was 5-star plus. Here's what happened - we had made a reservation to enjoy a group dinner before the Penn & Teller show on Saturday night - only we mistakenly made the reservation for Friday night. When we showed up on Saturday, the hostesses never doubted us and they tried really hard to find our reservation.  They were super polite about it, no attitude whatsoever, but there was no reservation anywhere on their system. We checked our email, and there is was - for Friday, the night before! We had a fairly large party and it was a Saturday night and very crowded, so we were slightly panicked. The staff moved things around, did a little magic and pulled a rabbit out of a hat! They found us a great table with a view and up we went --- the glass elevator ride is part of the whole experience and once we were seated we still had plenty of time before the show to enjoy the excellent service, terrific cocktails (some of the best in Vegas!) and amazing food. Perfect steak! Sidebar-  its fun, though a bit unnerving for me, to watch brave people ride the zip line while you're eating. I highly recommend VooDoo Steak for a nice evening out, delicious food and amazing service. You should also definitely check out Penn & Teller while you're there, theshow is a blast!

myrdPOmnvNivywFXZ39O7w.text: Had dinner here with 5 other friends this past Friday. Ambiance was ok, a little on the darker side and there was quite a bit of noise. Not just from the diners and hustle n bustle from the staff. A quite bit of noise was emanating from the upstairs lounge. Great view of the strip if you look out the wall-to-wall windows overlooking this 50th floor restaurant. Service was very good all around. The prices were similar to other steak houses. They gave a basket of breads: a raisin wheat roll, sourdough roll and some parm lavosh. I had the prime 14oz flat iron steak which was nice n juicy. Some sides like broccoli, fries and some mix consisting of potatoes, onions, asparagus n bacon. Everyone ordered different items and it seemed all was good. A few got desserts and even a witch doctor cocktail. The witch doctor and sorbets, they all came bubbling like some hot cauldron thanks to dry ice. After dinner everyone went outside to the balcony to take pictures of the strip then left overall satisfied.

upVr8UJ_TrIXARS9hiVIzA.text: If you are in to salt, salt and more salt, have had a lot to drink and need something to pull you down so you can start again or into paying Morton's prices for Sizzler quality, then this is the perfect stop for you.  The only thing Voodoo offers is good service.  As someone that was sober, enjoys a great quality steak, this was a bitter disappointment.  As for their veggie sides, stay away from the broccoli unless you want it as hard as it was delivered, you can't even call it al dente.  The mushrooms were laughable and drenched in salt.  Then we're onto the baked potato.  It is coated with sea salt, I mean coated.  So pay up to sober up, but if sober, I'd give it a pass and run to CraftSteak, Morton's or Charlie Palmers.

i5u9CJ6xhVC4laAHSfQguQ.text: This steak is amazing you could literally cut it with a spoon Service is always wonderful The staff everybody is so friendly and they great you like your friend or family member

s3UISc1j-8rMdUImmIhN4A.text: The view from the terrace is nice. From the tables in the restaurant however they a bland. The drinks were serviceable. I had a margarita and my wife had a mojito. Neither could be made to order. I wanted blended but was told rocks only. My wife wanted a pomegranate mojito like she'd had downstairs. Nope, no pomegranate. The onion soup was delicious. Not too salty. The bone-in ribeye needed something. Can't put my finger on it but the flavor wasn't there. Same for my wife's halibut. For $250 for a dinner for two I've had a lot better. The table was a little dirty/sticky. The chairs were mismatched. Just all in all an expensive so-so meal. Can't recommend.

6IYQNDMai0fN22OgBkRCJw.text: It's 9:30 place is empty, still waiting for our food, we ordered it 45 minutes ago. I would NOT recommend or return.  It is also $$$$

Enbk1tx6X2rhOna47i9GEA.text: Had dinner here last weekend at the Rio.  The view was nice,  ordered the oysters and they weren't bad.  We ordered a couple of Prime Ribeye steaks for $58 each and some green beans,  I wasn't expecting Nirvana but what they actually served us appeared and tasted like like large cheap sirloins I'd pay about $7 for at the market.  Another peeve was that they were barely seared.  I would have been happy with a properly cooked mediocre grade Ribeye.  We left very disappointed.

awTsFUCCxp-UGQlY5yBK2g.text: So so sad. As a local here I was reminded of this restaurant and we decided to stop in to celebrate just getting married. The ambiance is amazing an beautiful views. We order two glasses of the red blend wine & the short rib bruschetta which was amazing. We were so excited for our meal to come. But that's where it went all wrong. . We both ordered a steak with 2 sides.  I ordered my rib eye medium well (warm pink center) and my husband ordered a medium rare New York strip. His came out cooked correct however I was brought out a fully well done steak. I told our waiter and instead of fixing it he went on to argue and say every one cooks differently. Lol. Ok. No. He finally offers to have another steak cooked and brought out. As I sit and wait for my food he finally bring out a now fully bloody rare steak. Obviously now we know they only know how to cook a well done steak and a rare steak. I sent it back again ! Finally it comes back correct after my husbands food is completely gone and I am over the entire experience. I had such high hopes for this place. We will not be back again. Not even a comped anything for this inconvenience. Just here's your $200 bill that I had to argue for my $60 steak to be cooked correctly. Money isn't an issue for us and we frequent tons of steak houses in Vegas. Sadly could not leave this place with a good review. 2 stars because I did enjoy the flavors of the baked Mac & cheese and the bruschetta.

dKHe5X6LELJGS7Tg0Sl5uQ.text: In summary the best way to describe this restaurant is mediocre @ best, and I am not one to celebrate mediocraxy ;(    The food here was just okay - we ordered the spinach salad, lobster bisque, 12 oz fillet, lamb chops, side of mushrooms, and the duo chocolate Carmel bomb cake.  I would not recommend the spinach salad ... Olive gardens salad is waaaay better!  The lobster bisque was very good, but it fell well short of being great or excellent.  The portion size of the lamb chops were amazing, probably the largest portion of lamb that I have ever seen, but one was of the chops was overcooked, plus they were bland - thank god for the mushrooms and the dipping sauce on the side!! The filet was just alright ... I have had both better and worse.  The mushrooms were probably the best lol  The service was just so-so ... It wasn't amazing, but not horrible.  The price is very high for mediocre food, service, ambiance ... The view is nice, but there is plenty of restaurants with nice views in Vegas.    I do not know that I would ever return here or recommend anyone here ... It was too "average" for the excessive cost.

bCPMAKeN8u3K6lu-tLukmQ.text: The food was fine but the service was horrible. With so many great dining options in Vegas, try somewhere other than this place.

EUfX-tvWxvZms8kG1yAKoQ.text: For starters, we were with a WW11 vet that was turning 91. I told the hostess first thing when she sat us. We had a nice view until we tried to look out the window, which looked like it hadn't been cleaned in a year! The manager came by, we joked about the dirty windows , she said she got another complaint the day before. We also told her about our 91st birthday . There was four of us and we split two steaks and added lobsters to our meals . The lobster was horrible , way over cooked! We mentioned it to our waiter , never asked us if we wanted another, the manager never came over to talk to us about it. Three of our steaks were over cooked. My boyfriend and I didn't even eat our dinner. The waiter came back dropped our check and said they discounted the lobsters and dropped our $300 bill. No birthday dessert after telling two people. I reminded the waiter and he said he would bring something .. too late. I got up , which I never do, working in fine dining myself, and went over to the manager. Told her how terrible the food was and how they forgot the dessert. She said she would adjust our bill and apologized . She took off $30! Such an insult! I told her at the fine dining level, they needed to step it up! That was the most horrible meal I've ever had! Best part of the dinner was the view outside!

QaDJNwrimRh0abmI3yQH4w.text: Came here with high expectations, left disappointed.  Filet mignon was a bit dry and not as soft as I wished; the mixed drinks left much to be desired especially the super expensive witch doctor which just tastes like extremely sweetened cough syrup.  Giving it two stars because the waiter was nice, the salmon my wife had was pretty good and so was the truffle mac n cheese. The bone marrow was okay.

VvT6A-c5Zk3hnNQJCqiB3w.text: You definitely pay for the view here.  Its amazing and one of a kind.  I ordered the half dozen oysters and the 12 oz filet mignon.  I honestly enjoyed the oysters more than the filet mignon which i felt lacked any flavor... Our waiter was super friendly

xcW0QEEdyugvqjetcKQxhw.text: It seems like I've been giving out five stars a lot lately, but this place totally earned it. I've been wanting to go there for years and we finally got around to it. Lots of people suggested that the steaks were amazing and the view was great and they weren't wrong. Sam was our very friendly and happy server, and we will ask for him every time we go from now on. We started out with the Caesar salad which we shared, and they were kind enough to split for us. My wife ordered the fillet mignon and I had the flank steak prepared au poivre, which they don't even offer on the menu for preparation, but the chef was nice enough to do it for me. They should put it on the menu! It was the best au poivre sauce I've ever had in my life! Our steaks were cooked absolutely perfectly. We enjoyed every bit of the experience, add some fantastic wine, I recommend the Ferrari Carano, and they even invited us out to the rooftop for some pictures and to take in the amazing view from the 50th floor of the Rio. Sam was also kind enough to remind us that as locals we were entitled to a 25% discount, unbelievable! Will be back for sure many times.

Yhj7ZHGUoLoog17-nDrgcQ.text: We had a great dinner and good service. We laughed so much and enjoyed the view. I would recommend going if you have time. Queensland steak was one of the best steaks I have ever had.

Love that while the food is cooking we could go out on patio and do the zipline.

HnVYRBIfzXxv2ursCIeAtg.text: Husband and I had dinner last night . We went to celebrate his birthday but u would never guess it was his birthday since the staff ignore the fact that I told them . The table next to us had free desert for her bday. Anyway we ordered. 20oz ribeye with a salad , soup and asparagus. Our salad and soup came out right away but the steak came out like 45 minutes later. We asked for it to be cooked medium and when it finally got to our table it was cold and medium rare . My husband refused to eat it saying he was full . I know he wasn't so I sent it back to Cook some more . Once it came back nice and warm the steak tasted ok. Not worth $58 dlls but just ok. Our waitress offered us desert for the inconvenience and when the bill came she charged us for the desert. We didn't say anything cause we didn't want to look like cheap skates . The best part of this restaurant is the ambience. Beautiful view and the staff is super friendly. We ended our night dancing at the night club upstairs which was entertaining due to the diverse crowd. Weather was perfect too. Probably won't be back to eat there but it was a nice experience either way.

r1EyVWjlqhkSIvZIJju0QA.text: We have been to many restaurants in Vegas and this is now one of my favorites.  The wait staff was superb and very friendly.  It's nice sometimes, to sit down and enjoy your meal without someone coming to your table every 5 minutes to ask if everything is ok.  Here, they have class and trust that their food is good so no need to ask continuously.  The atmosphere is romantic and the food is delicious.  We started with the Lobster Bisque and the French Onion Soup. My friend invited me here for dinner and decided to go all out, she loved this place and was craving to experience it again with me! neg3p8n2oTet3PgTD6NANw.text: We come every time we are in town. Wagyu is delicious and service is phenomenal, plus you really can't beat the views!  Would like to see a couple new items introduced but otherwise yum yum

IQQq76tEiCPdDfwSZmlqDw.text: My wife and I were in town for a long weekend. Since we were seeing Penn and Teller at the Rio on Saturday night, VooDoo Steakhouse was an obvious choice. In a nutshell, it was average at best. The food was good, the service was ok, and the overall experience  didn't justify the cost. My wife and I eat out frequently and aren't afraid to pay a premium for a premium experience. Gordon Ramsey Steak is a premium experience; VooDoo Steak is an OK experience. Several Yelp reviewers were impressed that they were invited to go upstairs and check out the view from VooDoo lounge while their dinner was being prepared. We had to ask our server if this would be OK, and after we declined dessert, he was pretty much through with us, but said we could if we wanted to. Was it special? No. Was it awful? No. Would we go back? Probably not as there are too many other options in Las Vegas to be explored.

2JIN7Ft-RHuDivHJZVJRUw.text: I was very disappointed. Had to use the back of house elevators in heels . The tomahawk was very fatty and not really tasty. The mac and cheese was just ok - didnt seem like something you would find at a fine dining place.  The wedge salad was amazing.

oXt3bmX0VmO5azVJj7GjHg.text: I've been to many steakhouses, I also have been here when it was the VooDoo Cafe, before it became a full on steakhouse and honestly, I liked it better when it was a cafe. The food was better and the prices were MUCH lower. Me and hubby shared the 32 oz Tomahawk, we brought our 2 kids with us and my daughter had the flat iron steak and my 9 year old son had the Mac and cheese side dish, they have ZERO children's menu options. The tomahawk was good but not great, same with my daughter's steak. The Mac and cheese side dish was the best thing on the table honestly. I did have the lobster bisque before dinner because they always have had this on their menu and it really is amazing! Thankfully they didnt change this recipe. Highly suggest ordering the bisque. We had the chocolate bomb dessert and that was pretty good. But the steaks and the prices they are, in my opinion are not worth it. There are many very good steakhouses in Las Vegas, this one is ok. The service however is spot on.

BLaUUxGhC608HoHf4TybCg.text: Wow, I just realized that I have never gotten around to reviewing Voodoo.  How could I have done that when Voodoo is one of our favorite steakhouses in Las Vegas, and has been since even before we moved here in 2015?  My bad!  My wife and I have been here several times, and we have never been disappointed.  At a steakhouse, I tend to go straight for the steaks - usually the rib eye or the filet.  Each of these cuts has its own bugaboo at high end steakhouses - sometimes the rib eye has too much fat and gristle in the cap, and sometimes the filet has a nice sear but the texture is a little bit mealy.  Neither or these problems has ever reared its ugly head at Voodoo.  Meanwhile, my wife tends to order seafood, and she has always raved about her meals at Voodoo.  I notice that the one recurring problem that tends to pop up in most of the negative reviews here are about the halibut being overcooked.  Neither of us has ever ordered the halibut that I recall, but there sure are plenty of other choices that are first rate.  Now that Alize has closed its doors, I think Voodoo has the best view of any restaurant in Vegas.  Not only is the view fabulous from every table, but you can also take a quick stroll out on the deck between courses and enjoy the panoramic view from there as well.  I have also been pleased with the service every time; I can't recall ever having had a problem.  The fact that the Rio is a little bit off the Strip not only contributes to the view, it also makes it easy to get here (at least if you're a local like me, and are driving).  Prices are definitely high end, but not off the charts.  And, unlike the restaurants at most Caesar's properties, the online menu here actually lists prices.  (Menus that don't list prices are a pet peeve of mine, so I appreciate that.)  So, with the great food, great view, and great location, Voodoo is a perfect place for a celebration event, or just a high end dinner.

LANUO02W2IKdGRLkMd9aEQ.text: We went to the Rio Casino for the first time . Just so we could try the steakhouse.  The service was phenomenal and the food superb.

wxND9_Nl6TwfiD96I9effQ.text: If you are looking for a steakhouse with a view in Vegas this is your spot! Located 51 stories above the strip inside the Rio. This Steakhouse you will not forget! Don't forget about dessert!

photos.caption: Photo of VooDoo Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ASSYu0g6ldcnZRNXt8QmAw.text: My friends and I were invited to eat with one of Rio's Event Planners tonight, we had such bad service and the food was not cooked as requested. Two items did not come out till end of meal, like the Lobster Bisque and the 3 Shrimp Cocktail. The Halibut was dry and looked like a piece of chicken. I had better service as a walk in at a soft opening at Hell's Kitchen last week. Here, I ordered the grass fed steak at $58 medium rare. I received it and cut into it. To my eyes, it was almost well done! I requested for the waiter and showed him my steak. He tried to argue and said it was medium rare. After I had to bust out my flashlight and shined it on my meat I said, "that's not medium rare, it's almost done!" He then agreed, but what waiter argues with a customer? Also, a soup came out at the end of the meal to another person in the party, who serves soup after the the main course?!! Lastly, another person had to asked about her missing item that she had ordered. She was totally forgotten and embarrassed because she's the Event Planner here at the Rio. She apologizes to us, she had recommended this place. In conclusion, for a high end restaurant that is charging a high price to other comparable steak houses  in other casinos, this was a failure. Service is slow, not cooked to preference, & confrontational when questioning. It ruined my experience and any other possibility of doing business at the Rio. Voodoo Steakhouse WILL NOT be on my recommendation list. Attached is picture of first steak & the second, is the correct doneness it should of been. Photo of halibut that looked like rolled chicken breast

H6f50YF46ygqx81wLpFNsQ.text: Great, fun, exclusive place for drinks and dinner. The Witch Doctor will that leave you standing you should share!!! It has 5 types of rum and it comes bubbling from the dry ice they put in it. Its a fun vegas size drink to take outside and enjoy the view. We sticked to appetizers which are generously portioned except for the beef Tartare which cannot be easily shared. The Fried Brie was good but i wished it was melted inside to make it easier to spread. The witch doctor seafood sampler is a lot of food with: crab cake, frog legs, hush puppies, and coconut shrimp. The coconut shrimp was the best. The frog legs were flavorless. Hush puppies great for muchin. The crab cake could use a bit more seasoning. The lobster bisque was delicious, creamy, full with flavor. The lobster bisque even came with a significant amount of lobster in it. Refills on the bisque was greatly desired. Service was exceptional and fun.

qjrmKlCLLGxkagJOUWVWBw.text: Just came here for dinner and had a good time. The short rib bruschetta definitely stole the show. The steak, whipped potatoes and asparagus were good, nothing to write home about; but that bruschetta: delicious. The service was impeccable. SkUBoJ3x3HGguJS__-BOXg.text: Had the worst experience in terms of customer service tonight. Went in with my family to have a nice dinner but literally got treated like trash.   Our server was Jose and our reservation was at 8pm. My mom ordered a rare New York steak and when the meal came, she cut it in half to see if it was cooked right. The steak looked more like a medium-medium rare. While waiting for Jose to come around, my mom took photos because despite the mistake, she appreciated the steak. When Jose finally came around, she mentioned that the steak was not rare and instead of just simply taking it to the kitchen, he said, "Well it's been about 30 minutes already since you've had it" first off, it wasn't 30 minutes, more like 10-15. And he was NEVER around!   So he finally agrees to take it to the kitchen, and when he brings it back, he brings the SAME steak but now it's cut up into 4 pieces basically saying that the chef insists this is RARE. Not only that, he was rude enough to say, "I can bring you a raw steak if you'd like" basically insulting us as customers.   And even through all this, my mom still tipped the waiter which I wish she didn't. But then again I wish we never went here at all. It's unfortunate since we stay at the Rio often but this experience was by far the worst I've had at a restaurant. On top of that, it was my aunts birthday we were celebrating and it just became the most disappointing night out in Vegas we've had.

oEhUWgcR_SpjDfHTLeKOFA.text: *** Review is for Restaurant Week August 2104 Menu ***  I was to the VooDoo Steal restaurant about 10 years ago but hadn't been back since.  Restaurant Week gave me the impetus to go for dinner and to check out the new zip line attraction from the patio.  You have to check in on the second floor of the Rio's Masquerade Tower and then ride the glass elevator up the side of the building to the next to top floor.  The restaurant was almost empty at 5:30 when I arrived.    I was seated quickly at a window table facing the Bellagio and other south Strip properties across the freeway.  I was soon brought menus--I had to ask for the Restaurant Week menu.  I ordered an iced tea which was soon at the table and I got a nice basket of bread.  For the first course, I got the classic French onion soup.  It was a good rendition of this soup that I haven't gotten in quite some time.  For the main course, I ordered the flat iron steak extra rare.  It was a little too cooked for me but not enough to make me grimace.  The cut by nature is not the most tender steak cut but it has a lot of good flavor.  The red wine reduction added to the good beef flavor.  For dessert, I chose the assorted ice creams.  In this case, there were three dips of ice cream, pistachio, coffee, and vanilla with some fresh berries.  Service was very good.  My empty artificial sweetener packets were removed from the table as soon as a server or busser walked by.  Iced tea was refilled before my glass was empty, and plates were cleared in a timely manner.  After I ordered, my server told me to enjoy the patio and that I should feel free to take my iced tea outside with me.  This gave me a chance to take some photos and to check out that new zip line.  When I went back in, the server said he'd start my order.  This happened on my first visit years ago, and it's a nice touch especially for tourists who want to get photos of themselves with the resort corridor hotels behind them.  This was a good meal but it's not a place I'd regularly visit.  It's nice now and then for the view, but there are better values closer to home.  But we all have to be tourists in this wonderful city and this is a good way to do it!
