sY3S44G4pqQ8Z51QnIyGGA.text: Rob and John were phenomenal. The views were amazing and the food even better. Definitely a Vegas top 5 to do.

6GML4pJhb2hQf9EPp7KG-w.text: Paying for the view and that was worth it. Go outside and have a cocktail take some pictures. I have been to amazing steak houses and the food is the star, here it's the view. French onion soup and lobster bisque were good  as well as the steaks. The other sides were ok at best. Was ok service but it just didn't demand the price. 5 of us went and shared since we aren't huge eaters and it was 500.

BcpU08IAR9LSLTp-YdxrMA.text: A must do in Vegas ! Food and drinks are great and the team is very friendly and efficient ! I came here over 12 times and always had a blast. Even when it's crowded food is fresh and comes quickly to the table with a kind word from your server. While you make up your mind on the menu you can enjoy a cocktail or a glass of white wine with complimentary fresh bread and tapenade. The icing on the cake is the outdoor patio on the top of Masquerade tower where you can go to finish your drink with an amazing view of Las Vegas... Brought friends and family and everyone enjoyed ! On my last two visits my server was Jacinto and i was so happy to have him again 2 weeks ago because he is very nice and professional. The restaurant was not too busy so he took time to come and talk since i was by myself. We had a picture together and i hope to see him again on my next visit in december...

-mKBrMnvs7R5xtqPUHLT5w.text: Everything about this place was amazing from the view to the food! Our waiter Jose was great and attentive. This place is a must to dine at.

x5UJ0PQBcbJCzEsEDHw3Hw.text: Totally overated. I've tried this place twice now and doubt I'll be back. The service is TERRIBLE I truly cannot stress that enough. The servers disappear forever. We were constantly out of water, had to wait for almost 40 minutes to get our drinks.  The food took almost 2 hours to get to our table from the time we first arrived. The food was good but over priced. And my boyfriend became quite ill after having the lobster on our second visit.

HiSaSAP_bWNykxUfXDsHSQ.text: 4 stars food, 2 stars service, 3 1/2 stars atmosphere: The food was good and reasonably priced for an upper end resturuant. The service was slow (especially in light of the fact that we went early in the evening and the place was practically empty). The atmosphere is nice and they do have a fantastic view....but the view windows were absolutely filthy....I have never seen such dirty windows in a resturant before (especially for a place in which a key feature is their view). I am not sure how these windows became so dirty (since it has to be a couple of months since the last time it rained here)....but come on guys, CLEAN THOSE WINDOWS!!!

7uU3CqHhGtv9KG0AIKA9Sw.text: 8:45 reservation for 4, many tables open however we were not seated until 9:20.  20 mins later we get our drinks after stopping a waitress to order them.  We then ordered our food and at 10:45 went to find the manager as we still did not have our food. It arrived shortly after. 2 of us order surf and turf ($80) and the lobster was dry and tough, and the filet was just ok.  3rd person  ordered seabass which made her sick.  4th order ribeye was good. Sights of the city was the highlight.  Service was the worst I have ever had for such a fine dining restaurant.  Will not go back.

2AXqqadiAvZ2fr_ZwlpFRw.text: We came here on a weeknight with a groupon and figured we may as well give it a shot since we were in this part of town already. The first thing to comment on is the view-- it really is gorgeous and adds to the allure and fun of dining at a place like this. If you and your significant other are both into steaks, I think this place is a great choice just on that basis alone. It offers a refreshing atmosphere that really seems to take you away from the mundane activities of daily life. But I digress..  Service is good here. The hostess didn't glare when she saw our groupon and I appreciate this seemingly small fact. The waiter had a fair understanding of the menu and offered a number of suggestions based on our preferences and experiences with previous steak houses. Cheaping out, we neglected to order an appetizer and went straight for the main course.  My girlfriend ordered a veal with pasta dish. I don't recall the name, but it was respectably good. The pasta was light and had the distinct flavor of sauteed shallots throughout it, and I am certain it was cooked with a certain amount of wine. The veal was incredibly tender--probably the softest I have ever had at a restaurant. What sets this place apart is the quality of the meat; the waiter was sure to point out how very particular this establishment is about the meat here and where they get it from.  I decided to order something from their prime section, which includes a delicious looking wagyu cut that I will have to try next time. I instead opted for a 14 oz flat iron. I rarely order flat irons simply because most restaurants don't even offer them. Only a high quality cut is worthy of being served at the fine dining level.   After much thought and internal conflict, I chose the Truffle Mac n' Cheese as my side. It was incredibly rich, and full of flavor. Not like the stuff you can get at Lucille's barbecue, as this offering had a much more distinct taste. However, it was every bit as good, if not just a bit different. You can really appreciate the different cheeses in it with each bite, but like I said it's really heavy. I wanted to finish my steak so I decided only to eat half of it and saved the rest for an enjoyable leftovers session.  The steak itself was impressive. I was not expecting to enjoy a cut like flat iron because it is categorized below rib eye and new york in terms of quality. However, because it was prime beef I really was able to enjoy its flavor and thick consistency. It doesn't have some of the same marbling that you'll get in a filet mignon but in a way it is more enjoyable and it was prepared perfectly here. I gobbled it up without difficulty.   I can't say I'll be returning here soon because I just don't have that sort of money, but suffice it to say that I'll bookmark this place as a good spot for a celebration if I am still in Vegas years down the line.

re0YHoDLrfkXVPYPqFaYGg.text: Friday night in Las Vegas, one would think that it would be packed.  To the contrary, our server asked us to be patient while he was slammed (we were surrounded by open tables with a 7:30 reservation).   Steak was mediocre - wife and I shared the menage a tois steak shrimp and lobster - both the seafood portions were small, chewy, and terribly under-seasoned.   Terrible ambiance and terrible value. Of all the places to get a $100 + dinner in Las Vegas - we won't be returning as neither you should venture here.

a-8NLw1NH4TLgjmZT_fjUg.text: We showed up around 6pm. No reservation. We were immediately sat in a booth with prompt and very friendly service by Samuel and Alejandro. Our meal arrived quickly and was excellent. I had the New York steak and my wife the Scallops. Creme brulee for desert. This will be on the menu for our next trip.

a2z98YCua1nB8U7lC6keuA.text: Apparently the air conditioning was out as there were several fans placed around the dining room.  The steaks were well cooked, but were not the quality cuts you would expect for $60. The service was adequate but again, the overall experience was not what you would expect for the prices they charge. And I don't expect a roving photographer trying to sell me $40 photos.  If you have anywhere to be after your meal give yourself plenty of time.  It took nearly an hour to get our meal, with a mostly empty restaurant.  Overall very disappointed. Ruths Chris deserves your money way more than Voodoo Steakhouse.

L-PcTiIF3NaEtje0JTFzlg.text: Three star restaurant.  We split a dinner and lobster bisque.  It was okay.  The wait staff hovered then disappeared. I like the restaurant at Harrahs Las Vegas better.

cIze8CWhj5MHA-N7ulrbMw.text: Lovely heirloom tomato salad, but I would have been very happy to share it, because it was so large.  The view of Vegas was wonderful, but the prices were a little steep.  Next time, we'll Yelp for help.

a8s6abHxGsaIyhlDQ_kfhQ.text: Great view from almost every table.  The service was attentive.  Drinks were relatively strong, but were expensive.  They did seem to have a fair few decent wine-by-the-glass values.  I had a solid Australian Shiraz for $13.00.  The french onion soup was VERY average.  I was actually a little disappointed in it, as it is my favorite soup.  However, my friend had the lobster bisque and it was excellent.  Get it.    I had a New York Strip from the standard side of the menu.  It was $46.00 with Rewards Card discount.  The cut was really good and thick.  I ordered it medium-rare, but it was almost medium.  The flavor and tenderness were average.    For Vegas, a steak dinner will set you back and, in some cases, rip you off.  I felt the Voodoo was just right for the price.  Above average view, with average prices and decent steaks.  Make reservations.

Qd6VE6-ZwuRrYeB2Dt9YNg.text: The best steak I have ever had! The service was amazing and everything you should come to expect! John, our waiter, thank you!!!

-Ct8aZ18KdMEo51KjKJtyQ.text: Nice high view, food was superb.  Ribeye was good lobster was alright.  Staff was friendly and helpful.  I wasn't expecting all this goodness.  Also cool to go to the Lounge upstairs after dinner.  Guys some of the ladies who leave chippendales come up here.  Voodoo lounge reminds me of less sexier Ghostbar at Palms

e1i-nEydO-OLAHX3AjIbuA.text: What can I say? This place was delicious and also has a breath taking view! Food was definitely worth the money. I ordered the lamb and it was cooked to perfection! Our waiter was super friendly and very helpful with answering all of my questions!

Photo of VooDoo Steakhouse - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The witch doctor-- we usually get it only when they have dry ice! Looks so cool in person

oP6pgLFTfGNO7qlRnFw4DA.text: View was gorgeous and loved the restaurant's decor. Food was good, but nothing spectacular. The staff were great, attentive, kind, and had great recommendations. We had show tickets and even though we planned for plenty of time for dinner, at the end, we were rushing (our fault, we talked a lot and weren't paying attention to the time)  We asked our waiter to rush our dinner and bill and he accommodated without issues.

042L7lyzgxMtaD17qUM5_w.text: Pricey but worth it! Excellent food and service! Overlooks the strip and clean upscale restaurant...would definitely go back! Out of the four of us no one had complaints...

mL_hJI8YhYPyOIUG8Txr-w.text: Nice restaurant with a awesome view. Steak was cooked perfect and service was very good. Very pricey but we knew that ahead of time.

n_0xwh87vF5vVGSlJHywcA.text: The ambiance and views were great, and so was the roof deck access (free if you eat here).  The service was great too.  The food, on the other hand, was so-so IMHO.  I got the sea scallops, which were way over flavored, and the lobster bisque was unmemorable.  Nobody at my table raved about the food, but nobody complained either.  Food quantity was more then adequate for a "fancy restaurant".  Prices were too high, IMHO.  At least that meant there were no crowds even though the Rio was completely sold out for a conference.  Definitely pick up a free Total Rewards card from the casino level on your way in and you'll save a bit.  The place was very convenient for us since we were staying at the Rio.  So I'd count the meal as a success.  But I wouldn't come here as a destination.

dNDXngX9pW-xpOlEBqx-8Q.text: Where else can you get a 360 view of Las Vegas, with a nice dinner? Ironically, we came up here, to the 50th floor just to get a drink. But after seeing the view, and a couple great Martinis later, we decided to stay for dinner! Our bartender Antonio was so personable and fantastic. He made the best Martinis and described the best dishes served here. We want with his recommendations. The Lobster Bisque was to die for! So balanced and delicious. The scallops were seared perfectly, and the Huge bone in Rye-bye steak was cooked to a perfect medium rare and juicy! Don't forget the side shoe string fries in the cone, and a cream of spinach. We came in with no expectation, no reservation , and received one of the best dinner of our stay! One more thing, to get to the 50th (or 51 floor VooDoo Lounge), you can only access that elevator from the 2nd floor balcony. No elevator from the ground floor will go all the way to the top...

XXmBYYh8DIvLgQBk13LiWw.text: We ate here two years ago and everything was fantastic. Ate here last spring after they added 'Steakhouse' to their name and the food and service went downhill. The witch doctor cocktail is still worth the visit though.

n6F2k1TrbBV3yJBHCvu0Bg.text: I took my sons here for Mothers Day/sons 21st birthday. We were going to have dinner, go to the club, and make it an unforgettable experience. Unfortunately, 2 out of 4 of us became I'll after eating the seafood. My youngest son and I had the steak, which was delicious! No complaints there. One son had the scallops and the other had the sea bass. One was throwing up at the restaurant and the other hours later. I called to report the incident to the restaurant. They took some notes and that was it. No offer of compensation, an apology to me...nothing. As a matter of fact, I had to keep calling  the restaurant just to get a hold of anyone to make the report! I did fill out the hotel survey afterwards and still, crickets... Overall, poor customer service, lack of follow up and seafood is obviously not their forte. After having spent $400 on a meal, I would expect a lot more on the service side from the management.
